: For some reason, I was kinda reluctant to introduce myself to some of the
: people at the big group hug...  Ya know that feeling you get when like,
: everyone else knows each other and they're all hugging each other and
: smiling and having fun and talking about random stuff, and you wanna join
: in, but something inside is telling you not to??  I dunno... I guess it
: was just me.  But to the few people that I did introduce myself to, I
: wanna say "Hi!"

Yea well... Just be happy that these people don't criticize you for not
joining in. It is obvious that thousands of people are just like myself
when it comes to opening up, and feeling welcome.
SFRaves people set aside, at the ravEs I am usually looked opon as a person
that is only joining in to put on a good show. Imagine these unwanted
perceptions bombarding your perfectly understandable shyness. Explanation:
Like you finally get the courage to open up just so someone can ridicule
your actions and write you off like your fronting.


Anyways.. I am actually rather healthy mentally today, aside from being
alittle foggy from my partying decisions. I don't really let it get to me
these days as much as I might be projecting.. These are just things that
don't change at the ravEs. Me? Well, if you have seen me in the past, and
you saw me last night BEFORE 4AM you would have probably noticed a
substantial difference.

According to the Random House Colloege Dictionary...
CONGRATULATION:  1. the act of congratulating.  -interj. 2.
"congratulations!" (used to express joy or satisfaction in the success or
good fortune of another.)

In order to have a logical conversation, especially when it comes to
language, we must first agree on a common definition.  This is the purpose
of a dictionary.  It provides a common definition for each word of our
(confusing) launguage.  It is easy to misunderstand words and apply our
"personal" definitions, which are not always accurate.

My point?
1.  In the above definition of the word in question, I find no implication
of snideness or insult.  I think "congratulations" was an appropriate
comment to make.
2.  Use your dictionary when in doubt of the meaning of a word.  That's
what it's there for!

Here's to understanding and commonality...
Megan

Im glad that you had a good time. :)   

I sincerely apoligize for the bounce castle and virtual reality not
being at the party.   The Amusement company that was suposed to provide
them never showed up.  I talke to the guy on tuesday and thursday, and
both times he reasured me that he was going to be there.  Im not sure
why he flaked on me like that, but it realy bummed me out.  especialy
since I got a generator 3 times biger than what was needed to have the
power to run the VR and Bounce House.  And we left that big space next
to the fence for the house, and the big opening in the loading dock next
to RaveMart for the VR land.  

We tried, and do apoligize for them not being there, and I feel realy
bad about it.  

I wope that the Chill-Henge provided something for people to bounce
around on, and Low-Teck Land gave people a sorta VR experiece.  And I
hope everyone had a wonderful time.  

Keep It real

Vlad

-->	...Which reminds me, it's kinda strange to me that a great deal of
the new techno music made is very similar to Industrial from some years
past.  The pounding bass and metallic fills aren't that disparate, and
with the screaming of Prodigy's "vocalist" in the background they could be
the same.  I am probably making a fool of myself by learning that later on
that the Prodigy has always been played in industrial rooms and Dead Can 
Dance in ambient rooms :)  .  However, as it often occurs, I just listen
to the music; my knowledge of names thereof is quite limited.

Subject: Re: More Deep Shit.
Cc: "Jonas Judd (Etznab)" <jonas@hunab-ku.com>, SFRaves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <Pine.SOL.3.96.970831214628.24027B-100000@OCF.Berkeley.EDU>

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Right on!  I never really liked Wham! or George M. when they were actually
poplular, but right after high school I studied abroad in Japan and my part
time job was working as a host in a Karaoke House where I would sing such
classics as Careless Whisper, Last Christmas, and Kissing a Fool... yicks!
But the customers loved it!  Turns out that they were pretty fun and
somewhat challenging to sing too.  Anyway, when I got back from Japan I met
this girl (a love at first sight almost Romeo and Juliet level intesity
relationship) and she had been a big fan of all that 80's music growing up.
 So, I was always singing that stuff to her (she also loved all that old
Duran Duran - like Save a Prayer) and now it brings back some pretty cool
memories...  Now when I hear a song, I try to sit back and listen to it and
not judge it by the styles it trys to invoke but whether it actually says
something interesting or is well done (I give it a 9; it has a good beat
and you can dance to it!). I especially try not to judge other people by
the music they listen to because I think that is just a judgemental trap.
Now I meet the greatest people who listen to the worst music!  But it's all
good!

Binge and Plur,

Aleaxander
www.carbonated.com

On Sun, 31 Aug 1997, Mr nStuff wrote:

> Check you out...
> 
>  It's Ten o-clock, your going to take a nap before you head to Spundaes,
> you want to leave at midnight, and your asking people if they want a ride?
> Are you serious?
> 

-->	Yes I was serious, don't you know how much energy it takes to rave
sober for 6 hours straight?  Besides, I had a mega-huge sleep deficit
from the first week of classes to overcome.  However, it was all for
naught because I had to help a friend in distress at the last minute.  I
had to drive to the sunset and support her through a family death.  I
love parties, good-vibes, and making new raver friends, but you gotta take
care of your old friends first...otherwise you're a shit and not deserving
of the label "friend."  I don't consider this type of thing as duty or
obligation, it makes me feel good to help a friend in trouble because I
genuinely love her and a relationship requires a mutual exchange of
support between two people; heaven knows how many times she has been
there for me.  And you know what?  The weekend will always be there, but
your best friends will sometimes be in a different city, country, time, or
are simply unreachable; that's when you treasure all the times you had
together...through thick and thin :)



M&m

My friend was making a video of MeggaBuzz so a few of us could have copies.
 But He put the camera down on my friend's blanket by the speakers in back of
the main room.  Someone stole the entire camera case, which had our MeggaBuzz
video, the camera, and his car keys.  Luckily, his car keys were recovered,
but the camera was not.  If anyone knows about this or saw the camera (or
even just the tape) please let me know.  The footage is all the candy ravahs
and shots of dancing at the parties.  IF you could help me out I'd really
appreciate it, and I'm sure my friend would love to get his video camera
back.  I think it was a Hitachi.  THANX!!

-->	I am still trying to finish my '80s synth pop collection and am
almost done with my disco collection.  I like music of almost all types
including:

White Lion--"when the children cry"
Johnny Mathis--"chances are"
Michael Jackson--"ben"
Van Morrison--"tb sheets"


	I can't get rid of any of my music (unless it is _really_ bad)
because there are so many associations accompanying them; I mean, what
would all of our escapist movies be w/o a soundtrack.  Music defines an
era, and like scent, it is a powerful memory trigger. Now if they only
invented a scratch and sniff CD that would stimulate your inner ear :)

Subject: I just flew in from Argentina and boy are my arms tired!!!
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Hey everybody! I'm finally back. I saw all my family I hadn't seen in 7
years. I ate so much food and did soo much stuff.

These are foods that unfortunaly americans will not be able to taste
without flying south:

Dulce de leche = caremelized milk (delicious)
sandwiches de miga = sandwiches with a special bread
milanesa = like deep fried fish only its meat (good)
empanada = no transaltion (delicious!!)
facturas = like donuts but soo much better

Oh and also who ever said there are no raves in Buenos Aires, Argentina
doesn't know nuttin!

Yes there are raves in Buenos Aires. They are very very differnt all
together too. These are differnces:

There are mass quantities of alcohol and marijuana.
Hardly any other types of mind altering substances (including Xciting
cookies)
The music is nothing but rave/hardcore techno. Lots of buzzing noises
and sirens. Great DJs!!!
They dance so oddly. They bounce like they do when you are just grooving
to the music but they also do this robotic/liquid type stuff. But not
like in Seattle or LA or NY. Its different all together! And the other
half can't dance. NOBODY does the Home Base shuffle or our trademark SF
bounce.
NO FUN FUR!!!!
ALOT of silver and plastic. They dress hellza cyber looking.
They have hippi ravers, label hoes (tons of sick ass adidas), candy
ravers, about %50 cyber ravers, ass hole ravers, etc. etc.
And yes!! They even have club kids.
The vibe is way more mature yet incredibly insecure because of the
alcohol. But there is no violence or "thugs". Really nice positive
people. Its a new scene only like 3 years old. I had a lot of fun and
its a great experience.

Finally I am glad to be back and am gonna go to something this weekend
so i can see you all. 

Oh and i have flyers for Argentina too!

Love,
Paul*E*Wog

P.S. Now i must check my email!!!

work vlad, I was only there for four hours but it was well worth it.

Geeze people. I can't believe some of you don't know what I am talking
about. This has only been the UG Raver inside joke of the past 6 months.
You know those clubbers that go to raves at Home Base (Megga Buzz) the
people who can't tell the difference between trance and breakbeat and
think its all just deep house. Well.. those people usually go and freak
at the Home Base raves. Like they do at clubs. So the term Home Base
shuffle has become an AKA for freakin'.

Please tell me I am not living in a fantasy world and tell me some of
you know what i am talking about!!!

steak" and in the rest of the world (Argentina apart :) is called "Wiener
Shnitzel" (not really sure how you spell it, I call it "Milanese" :)

same name "Wiener whatever", but you can try...

***If this does not interest you please pass it on to someone else.  THANK
YOU***

LIFE, LIGHT, LOVE & PLUR

SOLUTION TO THE STATE OF THE WORLD

Theres so many problems around us today.  Its frustrating and depressing to
say the least.  To try to overtake or fix the many problems where can and do
you start at.  In reality we cant take on all these immense problems we see
around us, for they are to large, and our lives require to much for us to
give the focus to the time and attention needed.   

There is a possible solution to the problems of the world and a way to a
happier existence.  Its not a new message but a new delivery of it.  The
solution starts with You and then goes to Us. We cannot change everything
around us for it simply wont, but we can change ourselves.  We can grow and
become the best people we can be which in turn has an affect on all things
around us.  People are affected by those around them whether its positive or
negative and nowadays its mostly negative.  Most people live in so much fear
of everything around them.  Fear only paralyzes us and makes things worse
(remember the saying frozen with fear).  Thats whats happening.  We are
focusing to much on the bad things and the problems which only magnifies
them.  What we need to do is start to focus on positive changes and
solutions; how this  starts is with each individual person.  

We must do our best to have a positive attitude and start practicing Peace,
Love, Unity and Respect.  PLUR.  As we do this it starts to be created and as
it is created it then becomes reality.  How things become created is with our
thoughts and emotions.  They provide the blueprint for the reality we live
and see.  This is happening  whether people are aware of it or not just as
many things are happening everyday without peoples awareness of it.  Your
thoughts and emotions become your experiences (fears/negative as well as
faith/positives).  We are responsible for our own fate in that what we think,
the attitudes and prejudices we hold, and how we treat ourselves and others.
 These are infinitely reflected back to us.  

Most dont realize this but as you show them the see it because they are
thousands of examples and demonstrations in our lives on how this is done (a
sick mans thoughts are on his sickness, while a poor mans thoughts are on
what he doesnt have) all manifested as they are feed into the creating
energy of the universe.  Just look at your own life and try to see it such as
something you always wanted and strive so hard to get did you not receive it,
and if not, most times later you find out it was better that you probably
didnt get it.  To take it to the next step our thoughts as a whole (every
person) then collectively creates our society we live in.  Each person
contributes to society and nation as each individual life of each cell of the
body contributes to the whole of  who you are.  If there is a problem we see
around us individually or as a society we must look to ourselves as the cause
of it.  Many dont like to think this way because they want to point fingers
at others and say no its them over there.  Well its time to wake up for we
all are doing it together.  Maybe we didnt even create it but we are
accepting it and not doing anything about it.  If we are doing this then we
are allowing it to stand and supporting that which we dont like around us.
 The problem is we have been focusing to much outwards to fix the problems
but the real answers lies inward (with-in us).  

Whats this answer you say?  Its so simple and yet so complex.  We can
become better people and strive to live PLUR in our everyday lives, and then
we can make changes around us by own living and being.  We extend and spread
out our vibe to those around and if its positive then its returned to us
and if its negative its also returned to us.  It was once said long ago Do
unto others as you would have them do unto you  If we all truly practiced
this in our everyday lives, IMAGINE where our society and the race of man
would be right now.  We would be much further evolved in spirit and mind and
we wouldnt have most of the problems we are all facing as we look out around
us now and see our future ahead of us.  

We are constantly creating our life around us with our thoughts and emotions
are feeding into some unseen energy ,which then responds to and produces
visible results which we see and live as reality, individually and
collectively.  The law of cause and effect is operating on the spiritual and
mental levels as well as the physical level.  The causes on these levels in
our thoughts and emotion with life and reality the effects.  We usually dont
relate the in-world with the out-world but they are very connected indeed.
  We as a race of man just havent truly understood that we are all
interconnected with each other as our own cells in our body as interconnected
with each other.  Our quality of live truly does depend on the quality of
life of those around us and their happiness.  No man is an island, let us
remember our interdependence and start to live in TRUTH.  We are One people,
One nation, One spiritual race.  The physical is the least who we truly are
but really the most apparent.  Since its the most apparent it hard to look
past, but we must or else its going to get worse for us all.

As we live and practice love, light, and life(living) these positive energies
are then returned into our lives.  This is the HOUSE and happiness we all
feel at a party (hopefully many of you tonight are experiencing it as you
read this and will continue to as the night goes on).  We come to celebrate
life, people, and love amongst each other, and we create a higher unity; a
higher way of living and being.  We are all responsible for the good time we
all have because we all  add to it and create it together.  The more you give
to it the better you feel.  There is a scary part though is its not normal
for this world to know what we know.  

The world we are in practices separation and fear while we are practicing
love and unity.  They are now persecuting us for partying and sharing the
great time together we are sharing.  This is not the truth of the matter.  We
are light, love, and life.  We are practicing and living a better way of
life.  We seek Truth and are living and having fun.  This is not wrong, but
what life is really about.  Whats the point of living if you are not happy
and feeling good.  This makes life exciting and makes the hard work of life
enjoyable.  Its  necessary that we have fun for it is healthy for us and in
addition creates a better world it does this because when we are healthy and
happy we do better at living, work, relationships, and practice PLUR  the
best.    They are trying to portray to the masses something else.  They fear
who we are and what we are doing.  They use the media tool to convince many
younger people parents and the general public (who dont know what it is all
about) as we are evil crazy drug users.  They use the worst case scenarios
at what can happen at a party or anywhere for the matter as the rule rather
than the exception.  

Everywhere you look bad things are happening.  The worst killer right now is
alcohol, but its still freely celebrating on every corner in America.  We
all know more people are dying from drunk driving than any other thing but
are they covering this, No, they are covering what they dont like and
picking us out.  We are a culture(ravers) who generally speaking ,are not
into drinking, getting all fucked up, being depressed and hurting other
ourselves or those around us.  We are about positivity and love.   They are
not promoting these ideals in our culture.  All they do is show the violence
and problems of the world.  They teach us these things as we grow up through
television and movies and you learn at a young age how adults deal with
other adults; the old fashioned way go duke it out or go to war and kill each
other.  We are doing so much good for ourselves and others in partying, for
where we are is the celebration of the true individual, life, light, and
love.  Its truly about PLUR.  Remember this as you party and stick up for
who and what we are for it is right and good.  Those that are here who are
not about these things I hope you will eventually see the beauty of this and
want to embrace it and contribute your part to it and see and know that is a
better living than the old way.  This is the Future for mankind and we are
the start of it.  Its much more fun and beautiful to live on this planet
when those around us are practicing these ideals.   It makes life alot more
enjoyable and actually very exciting.  How many people out there in the old
world are feeling this.  Very few!

Know one thing, that you are right in what you are doing.  Be extremely proud
of who you are and what you are doing for its good and righteous(right-use).
 You are not problem but the answer and solution to the problem.  If you
practice a better way of thinking and living you are on the right track and
the reward is so wonder-full not only for you and others but for the world
as a whole.  You are and will live a full and complete life while those who
dont do what you and we are doing are leading  an empty and illusionary
life.  They have no great fulfillment in Life while everyday of our lives can
be and is fulfilling as we choose it to be.  I have great respect and
admiration for any and all who are trying to do better in living and treating
others.   This is not only good for those around you, but its the best for
you.  If you havent tried this way yet release your fear, stick your feet in
the water(youll find its warm) and try practicing PLUR.  Its such a better
way of living and its so much a happier and  joyous experience of life to
partake of.  

We are all mostly here for one common reason and this is HOUSE.  We are here
to have a good time, so make sure and have it, but also dont forget about
your neighbor next to you, their happiness is also interdependent on yours,
for it creates a higher happiness HOUSE for you to.  Let us realize this
Truth and contribute to others happiness and help make it for them; as we
do, we truly make our own, for ALL IS INFINITE REFLECTION AND INFINITE
REFLECTION IS ALL.  Our better life lies in our positive thoughts and
emotions and also in helping others to have a better and more fulfilling
life.  We all magnify and multiply each other as we do this.  PLUR.  When we
come together as people in HOUSE  and in the spirit of unity its not just
one person and one person = two person, but really one person squared =  1 or
two persons squared = 4 or three persons cubed = 27 and so on.  

This magnified number value is an example of the higher HOUSE AND UNITY we
create together collectively.  The more people in it the more magnified and
glorious it becomes.  We create something more than who we are and we all
feel the rush of it and benefit from it but remember one thing it starts with
each person and then us.  Some will  feel what Im talking about but many by
their own choosing miss out.  They and You dont have to though it is for all
people and its thrilling to share and experience with others.  Dont let it
slip you by and dont try to be so cool (scared) that you dont experience
it.  This is cool and right and those that knock it are the fools and are
only losing out.  We can all feel the PLUR together and share in this
wonderful energy freely. 

We can change the world this way in simply doing and continuing on with what
we are already doing.  We are the future.  While the out-world speaks the
message of brotherhood, we are living and feeling it here and Now.  We are
manifesting action of the right way of living and being.  Be proud of the
beautiful person you are and that is within you, for I AM.  Respect and
worship it and appreciate those around you who are beautiful people.  Let us
focus on what unites us not what divides us and also lets try to build each
other lives and other people selves rather than attacking and bringing them
down.  Let us appreciate our differences as more interesting and exciting
that they are there.  Try and rid yourself of prejudices and limitations of
mind as soon as you can and be truly FREE again.  Throw off the shackles of
mental and spiritual slavery we have been sold into.  Release negativity and
hatred and let love and faith fill you up.  We can beat this problem world
together as a Unity and One House One Team/Tribe/Nation/People.   The
truth of each and every person is we all have the same spiritual and mental
source of our beings.  We are a Family in ONE CREATOR, who created us.
 Remember this and let it give you strength and a feeling of release and
freedom.  A wise man once said Ye shall know the Truth and it shall set you
Free.  This is our birthright True Freedom on all levels of being. (spirit,
mind, soul, and body) This is our truth we can and are NOW sharing with each
other as we choose it and create it to be.  We are One People, One Source
Tribe.  Let us unite in PLUR NOW and FOREVER MORE!  Truth is in ONE.

Mad Props to all of you!  Keep shining and being beauty-full!!!!! The Good
Life is NOW!!!

LOVE, LIGHT, LIFE & PLUR NOW AND FOREVER MORE!!!      Brandon

ouch...but dont let a little Spiral fracture of the tibia stop you from
coming out to party. I see people come thru the doors in wheelchairs.
You dont have to dance to have fun and help create a good party.
I really enjoyed going around at some of the outdoor partys this year
handing out sliced fruit and tootsie pops...its really nice and something
that everyone should try sometime. We can have a little pre party
and paint your cast in day glow colors, cover you with glitter and fill
your back pack with tootsie pops...we could even put springs
on your crutches if you feel you just have to dance.

AAAAAAAAAAGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHH!  C'mon man, I was trying to forGET about
that...  I was so ugly those days my mother even told me so...

And Peter Murphy brings back memories of a not-so-carefully-chosen "I
forgot to take my Lithium today so I'm throwing lamps at my mom"
boyfriend...  Who, I should probably add, idolized and SANG like Peter
Murphy (but, IMHO, was a helluva lot cuter)...  And fucked up my head so
bad I almost took "Cuts you Up" a bit too seriously - bad thing to listen
to during that fucked up adolescence thing...

As far as goth-girl f*(king, nah, not too bad...  At least that's what I
was told, hehehe...

> I suppose the "milanesa" is what in Italy we call "Milanese" or "Milanese
> steak" and in the rest of the world (Argentina apart :) is called "Wiener
> Shnitzel" (not really sure how you spell it, I call it "Milanese" :)
> 
> So, I don't know if I have to suggest you the fast-food chain with the
> same name "Wiener whatever", but you can try...

Actually, the "Wiener whatever" restaurant serves only disgusting hot
dogs, but since Amerikkkans think a "wiener" is a hot dog, they don't
see the name of that fast food puke shack as a misnomer. 

Wiener actually stands for "from Wien" in German, and "Wien" is also
known as "Vienna" (austria) so a "Wiener Schnitzel" is actually a
schnitzel from Vienna. It's actually breaded, fried veal, and is
pretty tasty until you learn about veal...

Veal is little innocent calves kept in a tiny box with their head
clamped so they can't move, while fatty food substances are pumped down
their gullet even when they're not hungry. Then they kill these cute
littly fluffly calves early so that people can eat their fatty and
tender meat...

Hell, i became a vegetarian for a while after i saw how veal was created...

PS: w/r/t vegetarianism, i got better -- hell, i ate at In and Out Burger
in Grass Valley CA on my way back from burning man...

PPS: I'd love to see people name their favorite restaurants in the
Mission serving south and central american specialities....

Subject: I just flew in from Argentina and boy are my arms tired!!!

These are foods that unfortunaly americans will not be able to taste
without flying south:

Dulce de leche = caremelized milk (delicious)
sandwiches de miga = sandwiches with a special bread
milanesa = like deep fried fish only its meat (good)
empanada = no transaltion (delicious!!)
facturas = like donuts but soo much better


When I was in Buenos Aires, I developed a serious empanada habit.
I was forced to join Empanadas Anonymous to regain control of my life.

You have been warned....:)
M

To: sfraves@hyperreal.org

X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.4 PL25]

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


burning man '97 was another incredible experience.  They took a little bit
of the anarchy out of the event by making roads and designated camping
areas.  The arranged it so you camped on the "Shore" of the playa, making
an avenue on the beach where all the major theme camps were.  All the major
art projects, main stage, ect. were out on the empty playa.  The event
was kept very concentrated geographically, so you could easily walk to any
point of party.  They were successful in keeping the number of cars way
down.  At night the entire shore was lit up with crazy stuff, and did
indeed look like a city.  The dust was kept down to a minimum.

A few highlights:  the hot springs.  Dancing to an 6 hour Goa Gill set
through the incredible desert sunrise.  The sunset with 360' colors.
Bianca's smut shack/lounge.  Vmar's pedal-powered smoothies.  TAZ's mud.

It sounds like this might have been the last BM becuase of financial problems.
That would be a real shame...

-troy

hello =)
i just wrote this message to a friend about bman, and thought i'd share 
it with everyone here...

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Date: Tue, 2 Sep 1997 11:51:11 -0700 (PDT)
From: Tom Leichardt <djtom@svpal.org>
To: Brad Lewis <blewis1@mailhost.tcs.tulane.edu>
Cc: djtom@svpal.org
Subject: the playa 


hello =)

	i have 
rescieved messages that you've been calling, however last week was a 
very hectic one with the impending excursion into the desert for labor 
day weekend. burningman 97 was nothing short of amazing, mind blowing, 
and magical. there were a lot more people this year, but at the same time 
it was very well organized. many memories reentered my consciousness 
from last years bman, constantly being reminded with the surrounding 
playa and general madness weaving its way thru camp. i am forever altered 
by this years expereince. sitting here in normal reality at home my mind 
keeps wandering thru the many enchanted experiences that are now memories.
	The playa this year was considerably less dusty and not quite as 
extreme with its weather conditions. Black Rock City was very much more 
dense this year, this occuring at the request of the organizers who made 
several alterations in its setup. In addition to to more dense campsites, 
the city was designed for bicycling and walking around as opposed to 
driving, which was very discouraged. Also with being located at teh edge 
of the playa, there was much less of a need to drive across the desert. 
(no driving by vectors across vast expanses of desert this time).
	I resided at the Lyceum camp this year, also referred to as TAZ 
(Temporary Astonishment Zone). In addition to the camping section of TAZ, 
some distance out into the playa Rob Rayle and Randy Cone placed their 
soundsystem. This featured three nights of full on psy trance, plus lots 
of other stuff such as: live ambient, an electronic drum circle, and a 
few other random musical experiments -- some of these acts, of course, were 
done in the nude. Rob Rayle and I provided teh psy trance as it got late 
in the eveings, playing what we called gil sets. (this a reference to the 
length of them, as goa gil's sets tend to last at least half the nite) 
The playa and the many intrepid travelers weaved their spell dancing as 
we played our favorite tracks.  
	The peak of burningman was most definetly sunday nite with the 
burning of the man, as well as a full on CCC party on main stage -- 
lasting well past sunrise on Labor Day. The CCC event was guided by 
Kode IV and Goa Gil...
	After the burn i decided to walk out into the 
desert far away from town. A strange thing i noticed was that the 
farther one walks out into the playa, the muddier the ground became. 
Rather strange, but it began to make sence after a while -- the playa 
being an ancient lake bed. The stillness and emptyness of the desert had 
its influence on my wandering mind, and feelings of connection ran thru 
my body. connected to the earth, and connected to the billions of stars 
above, peaking out in between some clouds overhead. 
	...The pounding trance eventually lured me back to the main stage, 
where balcklites and psy banners surrounded many dancers. The dust 
floating around gave it a very dreamy feeling, as if looking at a hazy 
vision in the desert nite. i spent most of sunday nite here, with 
occassional excursions into Black Rock City. The sunrise was monumnetal. 
As the rosy fingertips of dawn gave way to fiery red bursting across the 
horizon, people turned around and began running out into the desert 
chasing the coming rays of sun. A mythical feeling of unity and feelings 
of 'home' filled my mind. After so many crazy experiences in the playa, i 
realized how much this ritual, the psy trance gathering, was really home 
to me. In looking around at everyone i thought how amazing it was for our 
family to come together hundreds of miles away in the middle of nowhere 
to celebrate our existence. 
	This concluded the desert madness -- it was time to head back 
to the bay area. Filled with dreamy remembrances of a magical time: Troy, 
Meri, Melanie and I dismanteled our campsite and headed out -- leaving 
the playa behind -- but taking with us our life changing experiences.  


tom

I find this to be the key, (music), that unlocks so many memories! I
keep music much like someone would keep photos. I have never been much
of a picture taker. One of my favorite rekkids is "Youth Brigade" and
it
reminds me of my youth as a "punk skater" living on the streets of
L.A.  I look at myself now, I thought I would be dead for sure by the
time
I was 27, I never imagined that I would be where I am. I'm goin' off
track here you get my point. Without music I would have nothing to
touch
off those memories good and bad. Its good to remember. 

Layne

"We'll sink with California when it falls into the sea!"  Youth
Brigade

On Sat, 30 Aug 1997, pistachio wrote:

> if anyone wants to be my dj apprentice i'll teach you how to mix and get
> you into parties for free. all you have to do is carry my records. :} dj
> pistachio
> 
> 

Oh me!!!  Please!!!  I can lift big crates full of stuff... I can dust
them off and hand them to you too!  It'll be just like Keoki... but
better, because you don't spin crappy records (dug your stuff at
Lepidoptera!).

If for some reason your record crate is a bad idea for you to be carrying,
I'd recommend a small luggage cart and a Az-Iz box and a bungee cord.  Not
that I take this advice myself.  Some of my favorite memories in the world
are not being able to find a parking spot near the dance studio, so I end
up walking 3-4 blocks through the Mission carrying my 80 something 
pound Anvil record case with a limp.  Yum.  I remember whenever
anything sucked that bad as a kid, my parents would tell me it built
character.

But it's cool, because as your arms stretch, you can reach three and
eventully four or more turntables with ease.  Plus, I suppose this never
really stops, and as I grow older I'll be able to pick up stuff off the
ground without bending over, which is good because my back is screwed up.

Andy

You know there ol' Deepfog, I hate to burst your bubble but I found out
some very interesting information today in my astronomy class.  The earth
actually wobbles along with the rotation and revolution thing.  This
means that the constellations that we all go by today are all wrong. 
These constellations were made 2000 years ago.  Since then, the earth has
wobbled some and those constellations that we all thought we were ours
actually are not.  I found out today that I'm actually Sagittarius.  To
find out your true sign, you'll need a star wheel to figure it out.

Point being, if you think your Sagittarius, check again to make sure.  If
you don't know how, feel free to send me your birthdate (month and day
only) and I'll let you know what you're true sign is.

Just thought I'd help out anywhere possible.  :o)

Bye Bye

dErEk

     Peace all,
     
     Well, this was quite a night...
     
     We got there at 11:00. It was nice to see a line for people who had 
     bought presale tix! Strong po-po presence, but they were harmless. 
     Approached with trEats quickly(I was worried about getting ripped 
     off), they were fantastic. Then the real party began.
     
     It was nice to see a overhead with all the DJ's listed and where they 
     would be playing. Helped greatly. At 12:30-1:00, there was still room 
     to walk, and places to chill on the mattresses, however past 1:00am, 
     the place just blew up... Many many many many many many people, from 
     everywhere!! Very cool vibe though... Didn't see any brawls or 
     problems.. The outdoor setup was nice, you could be chilling, watching 
     a DJ work, and right behind him, you'd see a nice backdrop of the 
     Oakland coliseum. Would have been a great kodak moment!
     
     Atari 2600 rocks... The only thing that room needed was a DJ, playing 
     some mellow beats or something, but I guess you need a place to go 
     where it's just that, CHILL... 
     
     I think it was room 2, but I think they had the best sets all night, I 
     spent most of the evening, and morning there... And let me tell you, 
     with such a collection of people on one night, in one place, I think I 
     saw some of the best dancing I've ever seen!! People were jamming...
     
     Macadio, Fantastic! He was the only set I remember... I don't remember 
     hearing a bad set!...  
     
     Now, one item I did notice, and maybe I'm in the minority, and I am 
     not trying to start a flame war, but I did see a bunch a mack daddies 
     at this event. I mean alot of people looked like they came straight 
     from a club, and wanted to continue picking up on the honeys all 
     night.. Wow, players were out in full force. I feel bad for the ladies 
     who were not looking for that kind of attention.. There was nothing 
     wrong with it, I just know that isn't the reason I go to parties..
     
     Anyhow, I dig FGE, and some of the volunteers came out and were 
     shooting the shit with us, making sure everyone was having fun.. Very 
     cool, and important... I've never met Vlad, but congrats is in order.. 
     There was alot of hard work put into this, and it went off without 
     problems...
     
     Oh well, just my opinion. 
     
     Did you see the guy dressed up like the dude from toy story? I wished 
     his jet pack really worked.... Keep the peace! <JCO>

Weird...

 I don't recall seeing any of the people in these pictures, there at the
ravE.. I guess I like don't see much of anything when I go.. I just hear
alot of stuff. And I can't really be sure if what I hear is real or not
these days, because I hear the same things everywhere I go, even when no
one is around. So I am either hearing things that are only inside my head,
or I am reading minds or something. Both of which I think are
possibilities. And both of which make it really difficult to respond to
something someone says behind my back or while passing.. Be it someone
talking shit, or someone complimenting me.. I don't know if I am thinking
it or someone is really saying it..
 Anyways.. I guess I am just trying to say, that if someone gots something
to say to me, good or bad. Please do me a favor and say it to my face.. I
guarantee a positive response.. Because I am really an open person. And
alot more REAL than most ravErs I have watched in action.

 And another thing.. You know how when you are around alot of people, how
all the voices just sound like one steady tone or something. Well it's not
like that. For some annoying reason my mind is constantly trying to
decipher everything EVERYBODY is saying ALL AT ONCE.. And well, I think it
makes me alittle insane I guess.

 I guess I am not a people person..
 Jeeezz... There's something we haven't evaluated.... RavEs are like
suppost to welcome ALL. Why am I not welcomed then? You need to be out
going to be excepted in the ravE community... I get looked at like, well
screw you for not raising your hands and saying "HI!!! MY NAME IS JEFF!! I
LOVE YOU!!" And I don't give off bad vibes... I mean well, until I get
completely irritated with all the bad vibes I have to swallow. But other
than that, I am usually smiling and peaceful looking.. But NO!!! That's not
good enough, you have to jump in there face and come up with something
interesting to talk about to get respect. Actually not to GET respect but
to avoid disrespect.
 Because I am not asking for respect.. It's the blatant disrespect that
bothers me. And it should bother all of you too because everyone hears it,
and it's not right and it's spreading. And it is not my fault it's
spreading, unless I need to proove myself. But do I need to proove myself?.
 But it's all good, I am not tripping, complaining, or dwelling off this
unavoidable, totally predictable scene I keep going back to for some
reason. See you all in October at Funky Techno Tribe's Holloween Tribal
Massive, my next ravE. Most likely. Unless I find a girlfriend first.  =]

Jeff
Hope this doesn't annoying anybody.

The dip is a girl dance. Where they go down really low. Jerk your body to
the left and drop, jerk your body to the right and drop alittle more..
Left, right.. And when you go left both fisted hands go right. And when you
go right both fisted hands go left. It's really dumb looking. You know, one
of thoughs things that will be laughed at in the next century.


Peaz.
Jeff

Hey Kids..

Well Saturday was a blast the long awaited Megga Buzz happened. It was
kewl Me and my trusty side kick Vertigo got off to a late start we
were running on Raver time. I wanted to get to the party kind of early
but I did not set my alarm and was like sleeping till 12:00 am. Could
it be cause I stayed up all night and most of the day on Friday for
the @spire party? Hmm... Ne-Wayz so me and Verts head out Making pit
stops on our way we make it to the party and are gretted by heat as we
walk in the door. it was hot and there were plenty of Folks walking
around some smilling some laughing some looking confused. the place
was set up nice I like lasers and visual thingies. The DJ's that I did
get to hear were throwind down. I got to hear Simon I have not heard
him in like a year or two and he was working the decks with some
progressive house. DRC was laying down some fierce Tekno traXX She
looked cute too like princess lia with a hair cut real short. She had
on the black suit that they wore in return of the Jedi. I and Vertigo
had a real good time we were a little nervous cause we did not get to
practice that much due to prior engagments so most of it was just off
the head. We got a lot of positive reinforcment from Friends and some
people that I had never met before. I Thank all you that came out to
support us. I would Like to Thank Vlad as well for giving me the
chance to display my talents to the masses. 


Highlights:

all the young beautiful ladies giving me smooches while I was playing.

The big laser that spelled out "Macadio & Vertigo" I always wanted to
see my name in lights or in this case Lasers.

The guy that grabbed my Ankle as I walked by and said that we
"floored" him it looked like he was having a good timEE 

The cute girl that asked my Name and looked very interested, but I was
to shy or was it to busy spinning?

Getting to play a good set with my Boy Vertigo!!! You go boy you know
your Ruff...


I love all of you Thanks for the Postive Energy!!!

Macadio

Ok this party seems to start out good.
Jer comes to my work and gets my coffin and Credit Card. (Don't ask
long story) So I get off work psyched about the party I will be
spinning that night I look at the directions and it does not say where
the party is I think "Shit how am I going to find the party?" it had
some girl Karens addy on it. Turns out that is the map point spot and
the party is like 3 blocks away from there. I get a frantic call at
9:00 saying they need my Needles and I am at Vertigo's house
practicing and shit. So I split that house and head to the party kind
of running late. I get there and sound is showing up I think hey this
is kinding of pushing it seeing how the party is supposed to start at
10:30 I think great every one is running on Raver time. But guess what
Jer is know where to be found and no one knows where to setup at. So
we hang there which seems like forever then we finally get to the spot
which I must say was one of the dopest beach locations I have been to.
Great nice pretty valleys etc. Did I mention you HAD TO WALK 3 MILES
to get to the beach? Well not that far but pretty far. I would like to
commend Jer for putting a lot of time and effort into the party but He
should have consulted DJ's and Sound on the location as it was a pain
in the ass to get to and load shit too. O BTW sorry My Credit card did
not go through I forgot it is Maxed out. Just made a payment today :P 
but Ne-Wayz the party did not start till 1:00 am all the DJ's times
got pushed back I was acting like a dick to Terrac and Dan Sorry guys
I just hate not getting able to play a complete full set. Bottom line
each DJ only played like Half Hour and I had a shitty mood and time.
:} I am a little fustrated with UG promoters not having there shit
together. I know that the cops and other things are to be considered
but some promoters should take not from some people that have been
doing it for while. Example the FGE party I was not tripping on shit I
went it handled my business and a good time was had by all. I am not
trying to down anybody just pointing out simple facts. Jer is still my
boy but next location please consult DJ's and Sound FIRST!! Thanks for
everyone letting me Vent if you have read this far. O BTW the DJ's
were good as Hot chocolate on a cold morning. Pistachio rocked so did
Todd and Terrac we have to play back to back one day!! Dan well I have
seen him many times as we has seen me we are both kind of bored of
each other I would think? He had new shit and so did I though.
hehehe...

Love ya all..

Macadio (Mack-Audio)

Ghetto girl steps in to drop some knowledge:

The term "freakin" usually refers to the dance where 2 dancers interlock their 
legs (while facing each other) in the following fashion:  Dancer A's right 
leg, Dancer B's left leg, Dancer A's left leg, Dancer's B right leg.  Then 
they kinda sway side to side, dip down low, bend over, and do all types of 
rhythmic sex simulation.  You can also do this dance w/ both partners facing 
the same direction (girl in front).  This is called "gettin it from tha back."

A variation of the freak is the "dip."  The song breaks it down:  "I put my 
hand up on your hip / when I dip, you dip, we dip."  It, and most forms of 
freakin, pretty much look stupid, but some people seem to think it's sexy.  I 
think it's just an excuse to grind against somebody, like a lot of forms of 
dancing.  But hey, what's wrong w/ that?

This basic form of freak and many of it's variations are usually seen at hip 
hop/r&b parties, massives, and clubs.  This may sound like I'm talking shit 
but I know these things because I sometimes frequent these places.  Not 
_everyone_ at those places does it, but plenty do.  Although I haven't "gotten 
my freak on" for a very very long time, I have no problem w/ it as long as 
it's done in an appropriate place, i.e. not a rave.  Sorry.

I actually think the term "Home Base shuffle" is pretty damn funny.  I'm going 
to use that sometime soon.  Not that doing it is a bad thing.  Actually, it's 
one of the safest forms of sex, if you think about it.  Those people you see 
freakin @ parties, you should give them props.  Because they are behaving in 
such a responsible manner.  (oooo that's a stretch)

xoxo--Miccaela
looking for her FILA beanie

From: Nancy Shaw <nancys@ucdata.Berkeley.EDU>
Subject: SPUNDAE
To: discobunnies <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Message-ID: <Pine.3.89.9709021312.A16103-0100000@ucdata.Berkeley.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk



Wow, no-one's written a review yet??  I hope that doesn't mean that none 
of you went (except Ari Fubari who I had fun dancing with for a while!), 
because this WENT OFF!

Without a doubt, Spundae is the best club going in the (admittedly 
dismal) SF big club scene.  This shit is REAL - really good music and 
happy, positive groovers only.  Like someone I met as we surveyed the 
crowd from behind the big dj platform said, "This ain't no club.  This 
here's a PARTY!"  Now, I can't think of any other club (I'm not talking 
about UG-type weeklies, bless 'em) I could say that about.  If you know 
of something decent on a Friday or Saturday night, let me know 'cause I 
haven't found it!  

Incredible music made this night.  Dave Seaman of Cream, UK, threw down 
the best set of the night with a 2 hour+ set of hard trance in the main 
room at peak party hours (2-4, you know it!).  Everyone was yelling their 
heads off until the energy in that room was sky high.  I kept roaming 
after that because every single room was different but all going off.  I 
really like the intimate feeling of the smaller rooms at Spundae, and 
found more blinding trance in the basement (who was spinning??) that kept 
me there for quite a while.  Coming back up, I learned I had missed Doc's 
set, which bummed me because I haven't heard him and I'm out for the East 
Coast in a week :(  But I was kicking back near him behind the dj booth, 
and he turned and introduced himself to me!  I try not to make dj's into 
gods, but I think that was a nice modest gesture from someone who is 
probably inundated with enthusiastic (high) ravers when he spins out.

This was the last great night out for me and an extended group of about 15
of us, and a fantastic time was had for all.  The best for me was the
presence of a friend from school who was pretty straight and had never
really heard techno (but, like they all do, assumed she hated it).  Her
first e and Dave Seaman's set has changed that forever!! (evil laugh). 
She turned to me on the dancefloor as she was madly dancing and screamed,
"this is fucking awesome!!!"  I try to tell people when they think they
dislike techno that it is not passive listening, catchy music like we have
been trained to expect from music.  It is, IMO, primarily an EXPERIENTIAL
music, something you must abandon your body to and let those repetitive
beats work their magic until that zen state of TRANCE.  She said later, "I
heard it before, but I've never _experienced_ it."  Exactly. 

Very happy to see all friendly, positive dancers in the club.  No bad 
vibes anywhere.  

Only complaints for Spundae: the music was TOO loud in every room and gave 
everybody a headache by the end of the night, there was no place to 
really chill out, and it was overcrowded (and you know those damn ravers 
never leave til daybreak).  Plus making us throw out our water and buy 
those fucking $3 little bottles inside (but that's 1015, a - yep - club).

I'm going back to 1015 Friday night for DJ Dan's 3-hour set.  A challenge 
to my fellow ravers: show up in force!  Let's rescue clubland from the 
dreariness of the pick-up, non-dancer crowd.  The predominance of 
weak mainstream music in SF clubs (think WILD 107 house and tired-ass 
hiphop) is also really frustrating.  Most of mainstream clubbing really 
revolves around the alcohol/pick-up scene and there is precious little 
for that wonderful community we have, the DANCE scene.

Love to you,
N

From: "Ran D. Dreams" <randream@cats.ucsc.edu>

To: Know 1 <knowoneness-l@photon.net>
cc: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>, Is it Trance? <604@party.net>
Subject: BM 97 review (long)
Message-ID: <Pine.SUN.3.91.970902151851.8269A-100000@si.UCSC.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk



Hi all!  ]=}

 Wow! This was an event that makes raves and *any* other festival look 
silly by comparison! The ultimate in sustained human surrealism!!

 Picture this; A flat, semi-dry lakebed (top was dry but there was mud 
just below the surface in spots) surrounded on all sides by pointed 
mountain tops. A bowl type effect. Within the bowl a crescent moon 
campground with a 40 foot wooden and neon lite man-like structure in the 
center of the lakebed, between the points of the crescnet moon campground.

 Everywhere you look (at nite) there are blinking lites; for miles! 
Strobes, whirling lites, fire eaters and dancers and the occasional art 
installation piece being burned. Nudity everywhere and lots of body 
painting and body adornment (I had my lingam painted and adorned). At the 
Esoteric Society of the Yummy Yoni they had a "twat squat". This was a 
place for women to squat and examine their twats and then compare them 
with with "archtype twats". Then they read a description about the 
archetype twat in a similar vein as a horoscope reading. (this camp was 
run by women)

 Another campsite had "bun registration". Here we had a design painted on 
our buns (I did this just before my lingam painting) which we pressed 
onto a canvas sheet and then signed. After we did the "4 cheek sneak" 
which involved passing a frisbee with our buns from one partner to the 
next and then back. Upon succesful conclusion of this we were given a 
very nice frissbee with the camp name and logo on it (a shaved headed 
woman with her butt prominately pushed foward with a brning man 
charachter catching a frisbee). and the words "Honor the Sacred Elements; 
Fire, Earth, Water and Air. Make Love. Choose Freedom".

 There was the biggest Telsa Coil I had ever seen (I didn't get to see it 
fired up tho), A house of doors, Bianca's Smut Shack (probably my fav 
camp site), flying people (on a paraglider with a fan strapped to the 
riders back), a giant lit up dragon fly, a golf course, a croquet camp 
(with flaming hoops) and sooo much more!

 The hot springs were divine! But the burning of the man was a sustained 
peak of pure release. Sorta a Mardi Gras parade, Rio De Janero (sp?) and 
and pagan fire dance rolled into one with about 14,000 attendees. 
Afterwords was the trance party with Ceiba/Kode IV and Goa Gil. The peak 
of that was watching a flame throwing (we are talking a 20 foot long 
tongue of flame with a huge fire ball and cloud of the blackest smoke) 
contraption wheel onto the dance floor and take aim right at the stage 
where Gil was nervously packing his tapes away as well as Adam from 
Ceiba. After a couple of minutes of frantic negotiations (and Gil played 
a track with a sample saying something about how fear makes your mind do 
things it normally will not do) the "monstor" was turned away to burn 
down other art installations still standing (after which it got stuck in 
the mud after unsuccesfully trying to destroy an ice sculpture).

 There was so much more of course but I'm simply not going to try to tell 
it all. I like to thank Troy and Neils and others for the Electronic Drum 
circle and of course thanks to camp TAZ for supporting our sound stage (I 
actually played about 5 hours of dance music for the first time in my life!).

 Big thanks and hugs to Rob Rayle and Julia Carter for making it possible 
for me to make BM 97!!

hugz,




Ran D. Dreams


				    (Namaste)
                                         /
                                   -=*=-/
                                     ~

Everyone,

I didn't get much time to see too many DJs ( I'll make sure to
give support next time) so I'll cut to the record chase.

There are certain instances in life when the energy becomes
one and things just begin to happen. the Energy given by the
folks in the crowd (you know who you are) trancended the music
to spiritual levels. This is what Love does. there was Great
love in that room, and I thank everyone. 

Macadio...Thanks for leading me with your experience, patience
and will. You truly led the set with Domination. 

Oh...BTW.. I had my first proposal by some mysterious woman
while we spun. I had to turn her down. You guys and the music
are the most important thing in this scene. With the vibe you
brought, it was multiplied. I've never felt it like this before.
Sooo....Let's Make More!

					VERTIGO

From: "just.jer" <jer@best.com>
Organization: @spire
X-Mailer: Mozilla 4.01 [en] (Win95; I)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Subject: @spire - Story/Appologies/Thankyous
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

ok guys... here's the scoop, but before I begin, I want to appologize to
macadio, dan (micron), carlos (pistachio), terrac, todd manley, jeff 'n
ari, and anyone who wasn't able to have a good time.

quick summary:
 location had a cop sitting in front of it. =(
 cop leaves. =)
 we set-up. =I
 party's going strong! =)
 genny craps out! =(
 genny get's going! =)
 I get sick. =(
 genny's outta gas! =(
 genny get's fed! =)
 all in all the party people had a great time! =)

lesson learned! get a damn good generator!

ok.... the story. it all started with a precision plan and a lot of
faith. the plan was to get it all going by 11pm, but it didn't get going
till 1am. now the reasons this all happened. the day of the party I went
to get the genny, but my friends credit card was declined, and because
of that, we barely got a generator. They gave us a real shitty one
because we didn't have any kind of deposit. We all meet up at the map
point to discuss the plan and go over how the setup was going to happen.
Now if it all went smoothly we would of been setup way sooner than 1am,
but things weren't so smooth. People helping out kinda took some of the
plan as a joke and were in disbeliefe at some of the things we had to do
to get this party rolling. So I kinda worked around those ideas and just
winged it. (I will NEVER do that again). We head down to the location to
set-up, and uh oh..... po po sitting there. At first we thought someone
tipped off the police about the location, but we hoped to gawd that he
was just checking for speeders. As we scrambled a plan for back-up
locations, we positioned someone near the location with a cell phone to
watch the cop. 30 mins later we get a call saying that the cop was
leaving, but it kinda looked like he might come back. I pause to think
for a sec, and say, "fuck it! I have a good feeling about this, let's
use the location!" so  I send two trucks down to unload and tell them to
call me when they've unloaded so that the second two could come unload.
I never get the call.... so the second load heads over to see what
happened. We don't see the first group anywhere! I run down to the
actual spot we were going to use and don't see anyone. I run all the way
back  to find them back at the top! I had no idea where they were or
came from, and didn't have time to ask. We jump on the setup and get
moving. I had no idea that the trek to the spot would be so bad with
equipment. (thank  you guys that helped out!) they finally get going and
set up, and I take off to check the ticket take, check point, and map
point to make sure everything was going ok. Everything was going great.
Sound starts thumping, people started dancing, and everything was going
great. Then the genny started giving us major problems. It also was
about to run out of gas. So I take off to go get gas and by the time I
got back to the top of the hill, I could barely function anymore. I had
only gotten 15 hours of sleep durring the week (w/o drugs), and just
over did it that night with all the stress, running up and down the hill
5 times, and not drinking any water. I drove to the map point and had
the kids there go get the gas and take it back. From that point on I
don't know what happened with the party. I had no other choice to try
and recooperate, so that I could help with clean up in the morning. What
I heard was that the vast majority of the party peoples there had a
really good time and even when the music went out, they were still
having fun talking and meeting people. Regardless of that, I am sorry
for all the problems experienced. I, myself, am really upset with what
happened. I don't want you guys to have to make the best of it to have a
good time, I want it to be where you have no choice but to have a good
time!

                                                                my
sincere appologies,

just jer - @spire

Thanks to all who came out and supported us and the scene once again,
all of you kids were great! Thanx to all who helped out in any way, big
or small. Thanks to all the dj's who spun out. And special thanx to Jeff
and Ari, without them, we almost didn't have the heart thumpin' bass,
thanx guys!

once again... I'm sorry!

?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?
?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?
?   ps. I promise you guys, the indoor! =) the indoor! =) just wait
'till the indoor! =)  ?
?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?
?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?    ?

> Ghetto girl steps in to drop some knowledge:
> 
> The term "freakin" usually refers to the dance where 2 dancers interlock
their 
> legs (while facing each other) in the following fashion:  Dancer A's
right 
> leg, Dancer B's left leg, Dancer A's left leg, Dancer's B right leg. 
Then 
> they kinda sway side to side, dip down low, bend over, and do all types
of 
> rhythmic sex simulation.  You can also do this dance w/ both partners
facing 
> the same direction (girl in front).  This is called "gettin it from tha
back."
> 
> A variation of the freak is the "dip."  The song breaks it down:  "I put
my 
> hand up on your hip / when I dip, you dip, we dip."  It, and most forms
of 
> freakin, pretty much look stupid, but some people seem to think it's
sexy.  I 
> think it's just an excuse to grind against somebody, like a lot of forms
of 
> dancing.  But hey, what's wrong w/ that?
> 
> This basic form of freak and many of it's variations are usually seen at
hip 
> hop/r&b parties, massives, and clubs.  This may sound like I'm talking
shit 
> but I know these things because I sometimes frequent these places.  Not 
> _everyone_ at those places does it, but plenty do.  Although I haven't
"gotten 
> my freak on" for a very very long time, I have no problem w/ it as long
as 
> it's done in an appropriate place, i.e. not a rave.  Sorry.
> 
> I actually think the term "Home Base shuffle" is pretty damn funny.  I'm
going 
> to use that sometime soon.  Not that doing it is a bad thing.  Actually,
it's 
> one of the safest forms of sex, if you think about it.  Those people you
see 
> freakin @ parties, you should give them props.  Because they are behaving
in 
> such a responsible manner.  (oooo that's a stretch)
> 
> xoxo--Miccaela
> looking for her FILA beanie
>

> Troy, how about elaborating on the Goa Gil set? Was it in fact Goa Gill 
> himself or "Goa" style trance?  Also, from DAT or tables?  I'm really 
> into goa music now and this fascinates me!

hi!  it sounded like it was off dat's - the mixing was, well, basically 
16 beats of sludge followed by the next track...  the music was up and 
down, too - some of it sounded a little dated to me, but fortunately there 
were some beautiful tracks as well!  it was interesting to hear some 
breakbeats in there as well - done goa style!!!  and the production 
quality on the tracks was superb...

while i fully appreciate the dj's bringing in unreleased material to 
play, if their whole set is gonna be comprised of it, i wish that 
they would put a little more effort into making the tracks flow 
together...  maybe drop the $$$ for a cd burner and mix off of cd's...  
or if that isn't feasible, try creating special mixes for _dat_ - ones 
that have more washes or open sample spaces where it is easier to mix 
into a different track...  basically, _design_ the track for the medium 
upon which it will be played.

oth, my friend was a quivering mass of gelatinous hysteria during 
goa gil's set - he couldn't speak, just laughed and jumped up and down and 
danced and danced and danced...

=)
me

From: "jAkE LoCo" <duv1@hotmail.com>

dear everyone, 

i can't believe that i've waited so long to go to the burninman.

sheer joy and heat and suffering heatstroke and visiting with the aliens 
and discovering the alien in me and seeing massive sculpture.
/////////
the creativity was over abudant the community, if you worked hard at it 
was alive and pulsating. 

yes there were thefts and forms of capitalism and overdoses and cops and 
other problems, but 

              there was nakedness and sharing and ART!!! and jokes and 
communications and an amazing display of people who care about the same 
types of things that you do.  Well, at least i personally met 20 or 30 
of them and i like to think that i was not a spectator.  
the first 24 hours i was a spectator but then i got in the groove.

you know the one groove that makes you feel allright.

o.k. well on to the techno section.

despite the well publicized fact that there was not going to be a large 
scale rave this year, those of us housecats in the know found out where 
the parties were at any way.....

i first encountered this camp from colorado.  i met a guy named dan and 
another guy named bradley,  very nice people, I asked bradley if he 
heard of r.a.w. or hipp-E.  he said that he knew hipp-E and that of 
course he had been experienced on r.a.w

I played a nice 45 min set at their camp at about 4pm for the dancing 
faithful. Mostly (fuck) deep house, but then bradley took over seeing 
how it was his camp and then proceeded to show me what colorado was all 
about. Well I just got a taste, but they sure do know their house in the 
rockies.  Bradley is a very talented individual when hes on the set.

Later that same evening, I saw bradley again and then some unknown dj 
from paris tripped my hop for a spell.  Butta say what? Say what the 
Popcorn.. Butta say what? Say what the Popcorn..  
Butta say what? Say what the Popcorn..  

next came jason, dj mess (I think) from daddys in berkeley. i met these 
great friends from india and san jose whom i had not expectd to see 
which was a treat.  Very solid. Very solid. In fact I must say he rocked 
the spot and made it damn phunky indeed.  There were many booty a 
shakin.
Around four as the headstrong began to make a turn toward dawn and I was 
treated to a power bar of soul courtesy of none other than cHris Orr.  A 
lecture on the deeper side of things.  If you ever get the chance.  Just 
chek him.  Its know wonder the records are 1000% better at rasputins 
these days. He played the greatest songs that I never heard b4 and that 
is simply because they were too underground.. I was proud to be a dj at 
that point and I still danced my ass off

the next nigh I was hangin with a particularly wonderful band HERE ARE 
THE FACTS YOU HAVE REQUESTED, And after the man burned down, they played 
a strong set and mine ears were exposed to dj b))merang. I was very 
honored to meet them and even more honored to hear them.. these guys are 
a tight group from what Ive seen and thats what makes their expression 
clear.

While I was playing some platters I met none other than destructo, a dbl 
hit legend.  He is a very nice person as well as tekno god producer. The 
very first raves I went to were dbl hit parties in la la landthose 
were the daze, but so are these and then I carted my rekkds over to the 
nother tent where I enjoyed the sounz of billy from sacramento.  This 
kid Is no sloutch.  Genuine article.

I finally ended my tekno quest at burning man with a sunrize set and 
then more ear pounding goa from the myth the legend goa gill. I have 
finally witnessed the guru and not a moment too soon.

Well thus ended my rave related burning man stay.  I for one was raving 
24/7 even when there was no music.  I give it a google on a scale from 
one to ten. I will never miss burning man ever ever ever ever ever ever 
what a party what a life what an existence weve got going over here.  
its the only life  you have might as well maxxx it out just like your 
credit card.

This has been a publicly served anouncement..jonas j robledo aka 
jakeloco

resist proper english, it's the mindcontrolla

Nancy Shaw wrote:
> 
> Wow, no-one's written a review yet??  I hope that doesn't mean that
> none
> of you went 

Yikes! I was there, but I hadn't had a chance to write up anything yet. But
here goes nothing....
 
> Incredible music made this night.  Dave Seaman of Cream, UK, threw
> down
> the best set of the night with a 2 hour+ set of hard trance in the
> main
> room at peak party hours (2-4, you know it!).  

I agree totally. DJ Dag, on the other hand, couldn't hold me. His stuff was
tired sounding and every few minutes there would be this long and protracted
break-down that just f*cked up the energy. I would be groovin' and then, BAM,
take a coffee break.

> Coming back up, I learned I had missed
> Doc's set, which bummed me because I haven't heard him and I'm out for the
> East
> Coast in a week 

Doc's set was pumpin'! Lotsa growly (in the seductive way) but truly uplifting
female vocals and great tribal sounding house records. The highlight for me
was a track he threw down that started with JayDees "plastic dreams" (one of
my all time favorites) The crowd went nuts. The cool thing about the track was
that it only used the sample and it morphed into something else with "plastic
dreams" samples through-out.
Doc was great. He was enthusiastic, pumping his hand in the air and was really
great about getting the crowd pumped.

> This was the last great night out for me and an extended group of
> about 15
> of us, and a fantastic time was had for all.  The best for me was the
> presence of a friend from school who was pretty straight and had never
> really heard techno (but, like they all do, assumed she hated it).

Don't they all.

> Her
> first e and Dave Seaman's set has changed that forever!! (evil laugh).
> She turned to me on the dancefloor as she was madly dancing and
> screamed,
> "this is fucking awesome!!!" .  She said
> later, "I
> heard it before, but I've never _experienced_ it."  Exactly.

Damn. SO DID I! (Actually I think had too much of the good stuff. I was
totally out of it for a little while. Danced my ass off!)

> I'm going back to 1015 Friday night for DJ Dan's 3-hour set.  A
> challenge
> to my fellow ravers: show up in force!  Let's rescue clubland from the
> dreariness of the pick-up, non-dancer crowd.  

Sweet. I'd love to meet whoever will be there. I'm gonna try to make it, if possible.
Yaknow, I've gone the the last coupla events trying to hook up with some
fellow SF ravers but it never seems to happen. How can a "newbie" to the list
get together w/ some of you fellow people? You have no idea what I look like
or vice versa, so I'd really like to hook-up w/ some of you in an obvious
place if possible. The worst thing in the world is to be in an ExcitEd state
and not have anyone to relate to on the same wavelength. Yannow whatimsayin'?
I think I tried to make it to the front of the DJ booth around two a.m. but I
saw no laminates or anything and there were so many people that I didn't want
to wander around asking random people if the were SFRavers.

Some body give me a sign!

rob.

I bet you,

I always find it hard to believe when something like this happens. You
know, if you really dwell sincerely on the death of someone, you will
actually feel their presents.
 Like for instance.. 2pak sugar(sp?) the gangster-rap artist. When he died
the day before PLASTIC I think it was. For some reason my mind dwelled on
him for a moment..You know, when you feel for someone that died, but not
necessarily have feelings for them. Well, I felt his presents in my room.
Or a better way of saying it would be, I felt him inside my head. And the
strangest thing happened after that! My radio at the time already had a
short in it that would shut it off & on intermittently. But that day, it
went from the CD player, directly to the radio and a 2pak song was playing
on Wild107.7..And the last time I listened to my radio before this, it was
set on 98.5
 Now, I have never listened to any of his songs, nor have I listened to any
of his interviews. But that day, I could have described to any of his close
friends or relatives what he is like when your talking to him at a personal
level. And I bet I would have been right!!

 And then there is my dear old grand-ma-ma.. When she died, I felt her come
to me aswell. And this one was really weird.. For after awhile she was
always coming around.. Tell it got to a point where I felt I had no
privacy. And then I simply thought to myself what I was feeling. And asked
her to give me some space.. And she was out of my head..

 I know, weird. But.. It happened. And it WAS all inside my head. But, I
would like to think that it WAS really them inside my head. You know,
because someday I am going to die and I would rather be somewhere else
other than the nothingness-void when I do.

Anyone ever watch a Ghost documentary on TV and then get spooked
afterwards? Boo!!!

Oh and uh.. With that 2pak thing. I would have to say, yes he is dead and
not faking it. Because I feel that 2pak was the kind of person that would
eventually have to come out and say "yeah, yeah, foo.. Thought I was dead"
But I am pretty sure that ain't gonna happen this time peoplez.
=]:...

But Diana the princess... I sense nothing from this... It was a setup.



Jeff
Hi Jil nStuff...!

I have been a long time fan of house but lately, it doesn't move me the way
jungle does.  Not to say I don't like house anymore but that 4,4 beat gets
plaaaaaaayed.  Again... and again... and again...
Jungle has so much variance.  The patterns of sounds can get so big and
wide that you totally lose track of them.  Just try losing track of a house
sequence, I dare ya!
Megan

>some very interesting information today in my astronomy class.  The earth
>actually wobbles along with the rotation and revolution thing.  This
>means that the constellations that we all go by today are all wrong.
>These constellations were made 2000 years ago.  Since then, the earth has
>wobbled some and those constellations that we all thought we were ours

>find out your true sign, you'll need a star wheel to figure it out.
