Precedence: bulk


How about bringing:

[ ]	Cigarettes if you smoke, or smoke only at parties...whatever...
also recommended is a little tin to put butts in for outdoor parties.  A
lighter helps too.  I usually bring at least double what I would usually
smoke because... well, most people don't bring enough, and sometimes, I
smoke more than usual at parties.

[ ] 	Money (enough to get in, do whatever it is you came to do, and
still be able to pitch in gas money or cab/bus fare should you ride flake
out, and maybe some breakfast).  Bring money even if you're guest 
listed... sometimes people list too many guests, or things get screwy.
Ask anyone who works door shifts how bad it sucks when somebody claims to
be on a guest list, isn't, and then starts whining about how they can't
pay, and they need to get in because they popped their E half an hour ago
and it's kicking in and they're meeting their friends and it's cold
out and it's all your fault or something. 

[ ]	Water, but most parties nowadays it's either free, or they won't
let you in with it anyway.

[ ]	Keys.  It breaks my heart to see someone bring everything under
the sun and forget their keys or something else important.  Use your
brain... you'll be glad you did.

[ ]	Drugs (optional, but if you're going to do them, please try not to  
buy them at parties... it's bad for drugs, its bad for buyers, it's bad
for honest dealers who have to compete with people selling bunk who you'll
never see again, it's bad for parties in general and it takes the focus
away from the event for those who choose to have nothing to do with
illicit substances).

[ ]	ID, Insurance card, driver's license... it's a bummer when things
happen with the cops or with medical emergencies, but better to be
prepared and have nothing happen than vice versa.

[ ]	Smile, unless it's fake.  Then either bring your damn frown,
or stay home and relax... watch some discovery channel or something.

[ ]	An open mind.  Crusty ravers, candy ravers, DJs, promoters,
wannabes, scum, gangstas, freaks, clubbers, junglists, househeads, and
hardcore junkies can all dance together and have fun.  Your judgements and
prejudices suck as bad as anyone elses.

[ ]	Your street smarts.  There's a lot of things you can do to keep
renegades from getting busted, including: not hanging out all dressed up
in front of venues, not honking or screaming out of cars as you pull up or
leave, not blasting techno/house/jungle out of your car as you drive
around looking for a parking spot, being cool to locals, not talking
about the party or location at the corner store, etc.

[ ]	Friends (optional).  Party with people who are going to be
supportive should you choose to use psychedelics and aren't too familiar
with them.  This is different from somebody who will take off when they
'can't cope' with your 'heavy bullshit'...

[ ]	Powerbar.  In a world where you can't always get three square
meals, settle on a little flat one.  Apple cinnamon highly recommended.
Candy should be avoided as an energy source, as it's not very long lasting
and I get whopping headaches and moodiness after excessive refined sugar.
Your results may very... but I think it's a healthier alternative.  Clif's
bars, other high carbo, high nutrient stuff is equally recommended...

[ ]	Nice manners.  It's nice to hear please, thanks, etc.  Just
recently someone literally took my water out of my hand took a big swig,
and handed it back with their slobber all over the top.  I wouldn't even
mind the slobber had they asked... just treat people with some respect.

[ ]	Dry shirt.  I guess this depends on how much you sweat when you
dance, but for some of us, it's a good idea, especially if you're bumming
a ride home.

[ ]	In colder months, plan on being at least a little colder than
usual.  Dancing, drug use, staying up late, etc all reduce your immunity
to effects of cold.  Bring a jacket, even if you might not get a chance to
use it.

[ ]	A designated driver if you might not be able to drive home okay.
Yeah, sure, dad will be pissed if you get home late, or if Billy drove
your car, but better than a phone call from the CHP asking for an ID on a
body.  That seems harsh, but it's for real... Try and avoid driving if
you're too sleep deprived to stay awake as well.  Hint: Caffeine is found
in the bloodstream of MOST drivers who fall asleep at the wheel where
alcohol isn't involved, so don't think coffee or NoDoz will fix
everything.  Get some sleep.  Also, E's after effects include a tendency
to just nod off with little warning (you know, that thing where you're
talking to somebody and their eyes just start to roll back and close...).
Please be careful.  Cars are big, metal, and propell you through the world
faster than anybody ever intended the human body to go.

STUFF TO LEAVE AT HOME:

[ ]	Six foot high Grafix.  It doesn't help the scene to have HUGE
bongs that can't be hidden when cops walk through.  Generally, obvious
signs of drug use, including shirts, hats, with big ganja leaves / E
caps, etc make it difficult for a visiting city official to believe this
is just a dance oriented event.

[ ]	Candy you can't finish.  Nobody likes standing up to realize
somebody's semi digested Jolly Rancher is stuck to their butt.  If you
don't want it anymore, throw it away please, don't just drop it... I won't
even go on my half chewed blow pop rampage now... 4 pairs of pants and
counting.

DJ Add on list:

[ ]	Your records.  Try and get a box or good bag as early as possible,
too. It makes taking care of your records in hot, wet or outdoor
environments a lot easier.

[ ]	Emergency ambient or spoken word record just in case you follow a
DJ who plays totally whack shtuff that you can't beatmatch to, or don't
want to beatmatch to (ever notice how bad vocal tracks sound sped
waay up?).  Keep it at the back of your crate/bag, so you always know
where it is.

[ ]	Headphones.  Many reasons... mostly, do you want to spend an hour
and a half with somebody else's sweat on your ears?

[ ]	Record Cleaner - especially for outdoor parties.  It's a good idea
to at least try to make sure there's nothing on your records
(especially sand!) when you put them back in the sleeve.

into.

In a message dated 97-09-10 12:19:51 EDT, you write:

<< From what I know, "microdot" is not a nominal term for a drug but rather
 a descriptive term for the tiny pill form in which the drug comes.  The
 actual content is <bold>mescaline</bold>.  Maybe the confusion with acid
 and shrooms comes from the fact that mescaline is a synthetic
 hallucinogen just as LSD, but its effects are commonly compared to those
 of 'shrooms.  
  >>

First off, mescaline is a natural halucinogen found in a lot a cactuses like
peyote and San Pedro cactus. When somebody offers you a microdot that is
either psilocybin (shroomies) or  mescaline, it is usually fake becuase it is
very difficult to fit enuf drug into a microdot to be psychoactive unless it
is HEAVILY concentrated. microdots usually contain lsd, which is such a
powerful hallucinogen (as all of you psychonauts know) that enuf lsd can
easily be fit into that tiny little pill.
-blake

2 Blonde Carpenters
 
        Two blonde builders were working on a house. One blonde was on a 
ladder
nailing. She'd reach into her nail pouch, pull out a nail, look at it,  
and
either toss it over her shoulder or proceed to nail it into the wood. 
The
other blonde couldn't stand it any longer and yelled up, "Why are you
throwing some of the nails away?"
        The first blonde explained, "When I pull it out of my nail pouch, 
if it's
pointed toward me I throw it away. If it's pointed toward the 
house,then I
can use it!"
        The second blonde got real excited and called her all kinds of 
names,
explaining, "Don't throw away those nails that are pointed toward you!
They're for the other side of the house!!"

Non-violent protest to stop the cutting of the ancient redwood groves in
Headwaters forest.  60,000 acres of old growth forest.

This march is happening at the gates of Pacific Lumber's land up here in
beautiful Humboldt County.  On hand to get our groove on will be
resident Dj INTUITION (Humboldt Full Moon Family) along with DOC MARTIN,
THOMAS, MARKIE, GARTH, JENO, and SAM (loop Guru).

			(510) 468-1660

bay area.  There is a spot for camping  very close to the protest site
and I believe its free.  E-mail me for info on other campsites.  Last
year thousands of people showed up to protest and we made national media
attention.  This year will be no different when we get together to make
ourselves heard.

This is talk that the Beastie Boys and Pearl Jam (if your interested)
might show up as well.  Anyone heard any on this?

Humboldt area send me some e-mail.  :)

Yep, if you see two Droogs dancing their asses off tonight then you need
to come up to them and give them fat hugs and candy. :)
Tonight Derek and I are dressing up in Droog gear and venturing to BIG TOP
for a night of fun under the laser beams... :) If you're not familiar with
what a "Droog" is then you need to read or watch A Clockwork Orange. :) 
"There was me, that is Byroni, and my fellow droog, that is Derek, Derek
being really derek, and we sat in the Korova Milkbar making up our
rassoodocks what to do with the evening, a flip dark chill winter bastard
though dry. The Korova Milkbar was a milk-plus mesto, and you may, O my
brothers, have forgotten what these mestos were like, things changing so
skorry these days and everybody very quick to forget, newspapers not being
read much neither. Well, what they sold there was milk plus something
else. They had no licence for selling liquor, but there was no law yet
against prodding some of the new veshches which they used to put into the
old moloko, so you could peet it with vellocet or synthemesc or drencrom
or one or two other veshches which would give you a nice quiet horrorshow
fifteen minutes admiring Bog And All His Holy Angels and Saints in your
left shoe with lights bursting all over your mozg. Or you could peet milk
with knives in it, as we used to say, and this would sharpen you up and
make you ready for a bit of dirty twenty-to-one, and that was what we were
peeting this evening I'm starting off the story with."

See you guys there. :) It's going to be so much fun!

Byroni... .. .    
(The Space Cowboy)

 The opening credits of The Simpsons shows Bart Simpson
writing the same sentence over and over again on a chalkboard, reminiscent
of the whole "write it 100 times" punishment, which establishes him as a 
troublemaker. Each episode is usually different. Someone apparently went 
through the trouble of taping all the Simpsons, watching them all and 
writing down what Bart is writing on the board. These are the collected 
writings of the Simpsons from the chalkboard exercises that Bart  writes 
during the opening credits.  Even if you're not a fan, I think you'll find 
at least  few of these worth cracking up over:

> > > I will not carve gods.
> > > I will not spank others.
> > > I will not aim for the head.
> > > I will not barf unless I'm sick
> > > I will not expose the ignorance of the faculty.
> > > I saw nothing unusual in the teacher's lounge.
> > > I will not conduct my own fire drills.
> > > Funny noises are not funny.
> > > I will not snap bras.
> > > I will not fake seizures.
> > > This punishment is not boring and pointless.
> > > My name is not Dr. Death.
> > > I will not defame New Orleans.
> > > I will not prescribe medication.
> > > I will not bury the new kid.
> > > I will not teach others to fly.
> > > I will not bring sheep to class.
> > > A burp is not an answer.
> > > Teacher is not a leper.
> > > Coffee is not for kids.
> > > I will not eat things for money.
> > > I will not yell "She's Dead" at roll call.
> > > The principal's toupee is not a Frisbee.
> > > I will not call the principal "spud head".
> > > Goldfish don't bounce.
> > > Mud is not one of the 4 food groups.
> > > No one is interested in my underpants.
> > > I will not sell miracle cures.
> > > I will return the seeing-eye dog.
> > > I do not have diplomatic immunity.
> > > I will not charge admission to the bathroom.
> > > I will never win an emmy.
> > > The cafeteria deep fryer is not a toy.
> > > All work and no play makes Bart a dull boy.
> > > I will not say "Springfield" just to get applause.
> > > I am not authorized to fire substitute teachers.
> > > My homework was not stolen by a one-armed man.
> > > I will not go near the kindergarten turtle.
> > > I am not deliciously saucy.
> > > Organ transplants are best left to professionals.
> > > The Pledge of Allegiance doesn't end with "Hail Satan."
> > >  I will not celebrate meaningless milestones.
> > > There are plenty of businesses like show business.
> > > Five days is not too long to wait for a gun.
> > > I will not waste chalk.
> > > I will not skateboard in the halls.
> > > Underwear should be worn on the inside.
> > > The Christmas Pageant does not stink.
> > > I will not torment the emotionally frail.

i don't know about YAP's "album", but you can still pick up trax from
his earlier releases on various CD compilations, e.g. Twitch,
Razormaid, etc. YAP's "Nature", for example, is on Twitch #4. Those
comps may be out of print too, but I see them in used CD shops all the
time.

PS: My Favorite "score" from the dustbins of old is Eddie Flashin' Fowlkes
& 3MB -- The Birth of Technosoul... couple of good trax on here, IMHO.

PPS: trivia question -- what movie do the samples in "Nature" come from?

When Scott was highlighting the all the lives acts for me just now, while
idiling in his car, on his way home from the infamous SpaceChildren's
warehouse, after sweating for days putting together all the equipment,
decorations, and keeping up with contacts, I shuddered with the most intense
anxiety.........How could I be so lucky to experience all this incredible
talent all in one night and just 10 minutes from my house ?  It is amazing,
but true......and you can have it all too!!!!   See you on the dancefloor!

Subject: Y so many divisions?
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

I guess ignorance is bliss. I never realized there were so many 
predjudices in this 'scene'. It seems like everyone is so worried about 
identifying themselves w/ a certain genre of music that it's not even 
about the music anymore. What am I? I LOVE Jungle, DnB, Hardcore, House, 
Gabber, Breakbeat, Trance, Experimental.... ALL of it! I never even knew 
Gabber/Hardcore was such a violent manifestation! (I wish I had remained 
ignorant.)
  My whole idea with this fOaM party was to get everyone together and 
feature all styles of music... so everyone would feel comfortable and 
maybe even find a new musical interest. I don't know if that's such a 
good idea anymore. Please tell me that people can put aside they're 
pre-concieved notions and just listen with an open mind.
What are you?
-TRACY

At 10:23 AM 9/12/97, Aurora8 wrote:
>I guess ignorance is bliss. I never realized there were so many
>predjudices in this 'scene'. It seems like everyone is so worried about
>identifying themselves w/ a certain genre of music that it's not even
>about the music anymore. What am I? I LOVE Jungle, DnB, Hardcore, House,
>Gabber, Breakbeat, Trance, Experimental.... ALL of it! I never even knew
>Gabber/Hardcore was such a violent manifestation! (I wish I had remained
>ignorant.)

i never knew either. but you know, i heard a few years back that jungle was
associated with all sorts of gang related shit. what ever. i guess you'll
find disturbed ppl who like all kinds of music, but that isn't to say that
because they like it i can't. you know? i agree, there are deviations
within this community, as there are in every one. diversity is what helps
create a lively community. we ought to embrace the diversity, realize that
there aren't a lot of us out there, and that our love of techno *in
general* is what unites us. what is it that they say... together we
stand.... it's ridiculous, childish even, to label a person by the type of
music they prefer. ask yourself, if you don't agree with them, why they
like it? perhaps you will _learn_ something. i dunno... this is all so
trivial in the larger scheme of things. eeeeewwww! you like tootsie pops
rather than blow pops? i can't possibly like you! gawd.

>  My whole idea with this fOaM party was to get everyone together and
>feature all styles of music... so everyone would feel comfortable and
>maybe even find a new musical interest. I don't know if that's such a
>good idea anymore. Please tell me that people can put aside they're
>pre-concieved notions and just listen with an open mind.
>What are you?

who the hell knows. but if you find out, let me know, will ya? i would hope
that ppl could *enjoy* each difference - not put them aside, not fight
about them. embrace the diversity.

cheers - e. :)

We're honestly excited about the fact that you've found a way to advertise
for free, but this is FLAGRANT COMMERCIAL SPAM.  I realize it's rave
related, but I'm pretty confident we're not interested in world domination
at this point in time.  It would be nice in fact, if we could just start
with some common courtesies like not abusing e-mail or public mailing
lists (especially topic specific regional lists).

Please avoid crossposting.  If you'd like to let us know about it, roll
down the hype, and tell us like we'd tell each other about an event.  We
have no qualms with an occasional post regarding a semilocal event
(seattle, oregon, mtn or la regions) assuming it's EPIC... or even a
global scale event in London, New York, Chicago if say... everybody and
their mother is there, but this seems  a bit excessive. In addition, a lot
of the lists you sent to (313, IDM, calendar) have almost nothing to do
with this event that I can see, and to be honest, this looks opportunist
at best.

Honestly, you'll get better mileage with a handful of flyers.  Nothing
personal, just this is starting to become a problem with mailing lists in 
general.

Thanks,
AndyW

p.s.	Personally, I feel there's enough Global Chaos and Mass Hysteria
in this world already.  How about a little unity... we can build things if
we try, if we respect one another and realize common goals.  Sorry if I
seem offensive, I'd prefer you think of it as defensive of our lists goals
and methods, as well as the time invested by everybody on it.

         "People think love is an emotion.  Love is good sense."
                             -- Ken Kesey

	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) with SMTP id MAA06025;
	Fri, 12 Sep 1997 12:40:31 -0700 (PDT)
Message-Id: <3.0.3.32.19970912121859.009568d0@hyperreal.org>
X-Sender: brian@hyperreal.org
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Pro Version 3.0.3 (32)
Date: Fri, 12 Sep 1997 12:18:59 -0700
To: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
From: Brian Behlendorf <brian@hyperreal.org>
Subject: Re: (__..--::--~~World SPAM~~--::--..__)
Cc: OnLine Bass Addict Support Group <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
In-Reply-To: <Pine.GSO.3.96.970912110446.23646D-100000@atari>
References: <19970912.135015.3342.0.worlddomination2@juno.com>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Before you jump so quickly to respond to spam, make sure for yourself that
the message you're responding to actually made it to SFraves.  In this
case, this spam message was filtered by my spam filters; but from the looks
of it Andy got it through another mailing list, and since it had
"sfraves@hyperreal.org" in the To: field, his response made it to the list
even though the original didn't.  Before you respond to a multi-list spam,
make sure you GOT IT through the sfraves list before responding TO the
sfraves list.  The easiest way to tell is to look for a header which says
"Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org" in the mail headers.  This happened
earlier this week.  Thanks.

	Brian


--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--
"Why not?" - TL           brian@organic.com - hyperreal.org - apache.org

Message-ID: <Pine.SUN.3.91.970912143724.29043A-100000@si.UCSC.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Hi all!   ]=}


 You know, I used to enjoy going to HUGE massives/commercial events for 
the crowds, the production levels (big lasers are *really* neat!), and 
for the incredible music that is *occasionally* played there.

 But something has happened and I've changed. I've been introduced to the 
UG scene over the years and have a deep respect for the UG (despite the 
petty political and egotistical bullshit that goes on).

 To me the epitimy of "non-commercial" events is Burning Man. There I got 
to experience a multi-artist collabrative of about 10,000 peeps without 
*one* sign for Coors or a Lotus Magazine laying about (sorry Lotus, you do 
have a nice rag) or any other advertisment that is designed to make you 
feel like shit until you buy their product.

 What has soured me (finally) to Massives is the work of two production 
companies (and/or their crew/associates). We had a sound stage at BM (the 
largest [I believe] except for main stage (which only played "dance 
music" on Sunday nite). Some scum bags decided to leave huge glossy 
flyers to two events there on our tables. This is not only an insult to 
us (no one asked if they could leave their trash on our tables) but is an 
insult to *every* participant at Burning Man. NO ONE is there to be 
exposed to commercial advertisments. That is one reason why we go.

 The offending flyers were for Space Children's "Be Here Now" event on 
November 30th. and Organic's show Sept 20th. I highly advise all those 
who truely care about non-commercial art and freedom of expression to 
boycott these shows as a protest to their disrespectful attitude towards 
Burning Man (and our camp incidently).

 I intend to foward this info to other lists and to foward it to the 
Burning Man organisers in hopes of creating a huge protest. I will 
willingly stop these efforts if a public apology is given to the Burning 
Man organisers from the two production companies

hugz y'all,



Ran D. Dreams


				    (Namaste)

                                   -=*=-/
                                     ~

Hi folks!  ]=}

 With a little bit of self reflection I've realised that I've been 
involved in a share of spamming with regards to events I've been very 
involved in (finacially and otherwise).

 With that in mind I should offer my apologies to those who have had to 
deal with those spams. I am sorry. most of the time they have been for UG 
events where we were just concerned with breaking even. Case in point 
would be the 4X4 campout. We *way* spammed SFraves and I also apologise 
for my part in that (we still lost over 6 thousand dollars on that).

 I do want to inform peeps about shows I (Dionysus Dreams) am working on 
as I know some peeps want to know and I can't email everyone personally. 
However I will try to keep it to an absolute mininum with as little use 
of buzz words as possible (kewl! ;).

hugz,



Ran D. Dreams

>If there is anymore to be said take it off your list and just say it to
>me....

>Do not post another message about this on this list..
>thanks for showing me what SF is all about...

oh, hey now, we aren't *all* like that! some of us are displaced east
coasters who sought the sunshine and laid back attitude of sf.... and a lot
of us are just plain *nice*! please don't make such generalizations about
sf.... yes, there's a lot of crap, but there is that everywhere. as someone
who's lived on the east coast (24 years) the so-called 3rd coast (tx - 6
years) and now the west (only 4 months), i must say that this is a fabulous
city. i love it! maybe you'll have to come out here to see for yourself?
warning - the ug parties bring more 'plurrier' (is that a word?) ppl. or so
i've seen thus far (read: _opinion_ folks!). but it takes all kinds, which
brings me back to my earlier post about diversity. embrace it! if you
don't, you're the one who's losing out. (never mind that it's the most
immature thing i could think of doing, but what ever.) i'm tired too of all
the bitterness. lighten up, ppl.

cheers - e. :)

Why are you attacking everyone? What do hope to accomplish by trashing 
people on SFR?

You do not rerally deserve a respons eto this type of language and 
behavior...but out of sympathy for you, I will.

Two of my friends, who will remain nameless, threw the party that you 
speak. They were resonsible for the sound system. They rented it from a 
person named MIKE G. They allowed some other party promoters to use the 
sound system a second night, uinder the pretense that they would return 
it the next day. I had absolutley nothing to do with this. Sorry that you 
want to attach this to me. Additionall, the person who's system was 
stolen received all new gear, and harbors no grudges about the situation. 
Why do you.

In respnse to me being an ego-bound DJ...you don't even know me. How can 
you even comment on anything? Anything that you feel that you know about 
me is at least 2nd or 3rd hand info.

All of your negative energy only helpd to perpetuate the bullshit that so 
many "REAL" paople work hard to get away from every day of their lives. 
Their is enough rumor and inuendo floating through this scene to fuel 
fires for years....and you seem to be adding as much fuel to the fire as 
humanly possible.

Sorry your filled with so much hate, anger, and distateful comments.

peace,
ES

On Fri, 12 Sep 1997, Joe Desantis wrote:

> If there is anymore to be said take it off your list and just say it to
> me....
> I f you have something to say to me then say it....to ME.
> Do not post another message about this on this list..
> thanks for showing me what SF is all about...
> P.L.U.R.
> 

I might have made the mistake of speaking my mind and feeling the list
agreed, but at least I don't tell them what to do.

How about a please along with your request?

To reiterate today's events:

I replied to a cross listed spam, to only it's sender and the list of
which I am part, rather than the trans global cross posting list it
originally contained.  I did this ON PURPOSE to keep my opinion from
affecting the outcome of your event.  If your intentions are good and you
have planned carefully, I wish you all the success in the world, however
you might measure it.

I basically stated that this is SF-Raves, as in San Francisco Raves, as in
a regional list for San Francisco.

Why is there an SFRaves?  Because a US-Raves list would be hard to manage
or enjoy.  Raves are fairly regional events, as you have to attend them to
really get the whole experience.

Plus, it adds to a certain convenience.  If I'm going to Texas, I hop on
their raves list for a couple weeks before I go, and I have a pretty good
idea of what to expect.  Same for NYC, same for MW, same pretty much
everywhere.

You quote PLUR, as if it were some unifying banner to make the meanines go
away.  I've seen it used here by all kinds, from shit talking little
gossipheads spun out on crank and looking for some guy to hit on so
they'll buy them an E to amazingly connected and enlightened people to
everybody in between. Like LOVE, it means different things to different
people.  To me it means it's something I won't cheapen by quoting.  I try
to be respect of people, of this list, of the internet and servers and
admins that support it, and the conditions governing it.

When you subbed to this list, you read a welcome, that included a brief
mission statement if you will about this list.  "Information pertaining to
raves, in and around the San Franscisco Bay area".  If every party in the
country was promoted on this list, it would create a problem.

I found your post disrespectful, because there are literally hundreds of
events going on every month in this country.  If everyone crossposted all
of the lists you just crossposted there would be a major problem.

The policy exists to make these lists viable.  Considering yourself above
these policies indicates either:

a.	A lack of understanding of basic netiquette

b.	A feeling that you or your event or somehow above that policy.

Either way, you took it upon yourself to take your needs above the needs
of others far away across the country.

The list welcome statement also recommends that you lurk for a while
before you post, just to get a feel for the list, which you chose to
disregard as well.

I respect the rules, because they work.  I defend them, because I have
seen what happens when people don't follow them.

Most of you have a good point, in fact, at some level I should hope all of
us do.  I'm ready to back down, but  I can't help but find it ironic
that a promoter from NYC trying to get free publicity could win the hearts
of this list by putting PLUR at the bottom of a mail and taking a cheap
shot or two at me for reminding you some of some of our guidelines.


Is it really about these POWER terms, like "domination"?  Do I just not
get it?  We are more family than enemy, yet we seem so attracted to being
in charge, on top, at the controls of the MASSIF, head of the Juggernaut,
of the big machine.  The goal should not be the end result, the goal
should be coming together for the sake of coming together, as we do...
often.

So, I don't know what I seem to you, but I know how you seem to me.  You
post in violation of policies that you agreed to when sub'ing to this
list, and now you fire off a couple shots and then say don't cc: the list,
send it to me direct.  You chose to tell me something, and I should be
entitled to say my piece.  When you retort, I should be entitled to
retort as well.

Sorry if I didn't respect your wishes, but I feel it best to justify my
actions before the people I see every weekend.  You don't have to live
with them, although I'm sure you'd find them as wonderful and
fascinating as I do.  I hope your party goes well, but I won't be there.

Peace,
AndyW

Disclaimer:	I am not the owner of this list, nor am I it's longest
standing member, nor am I hot shit of any variety.  I choose to speak my
mind in this case because this discussion is somewhat rave related and
very respect related.

People, wake up.  We all need to limit our sense of importance in light of
respect for the sense of importance of others.  That goes for everyone,
including me.  So I'll shut up for a little while, because what I've seen
today has been pretty amazing.  Good night. Reply to whoever you like,
I'll still be on, I'm just not really compelled to speak for a while.

Sorry about the derision, about the infighting, and sorry if I offended
anyone.  I can't tell you all to stop, but I feel like kaka knowing I
helped start it.

Received: (from corey@localhost) by ivanova.ncd.com (950413.SGI.8.6.12/950213.SGI.AUTOCF) id PAA19692 for sfraves@hyperreal.org; Fri, 12 Sep 1997 15:25:39 -0700
From: "Corey Alambar" <corey@ncd.com>
Message-Id: <970912152539.ZM19690@ivanova.ncd.com>
Date: Fri, 12 Sep 1997 15:25:39 -0700
X-Mailer: Z-Mail (4.0.1 13Jan97)
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: PLUR and the treatment of newbies
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Okay, time to stick my neck out here...

I have been lurking for the most part here for a couple of months, and I have
to admit I'm very heartened by what I've seen, the people I've gotten to know
here, the general feeling of fellowship, of community.  It's wonderful, and I
wouldn't trade it for the world.

However, it seems that lately some people on the list have forgotten some of
the basic problems of close-knit societies.  You see, we have our rules, our
conventions, our guidelines and creeds, but they aren't documented anywhere -
Think about NRR and BSP, for example.  They seem obvious, now, but to new
people, they're jsut more TLAs.  Normally, newbies are quiet, and listen a
little before they dive in, and when one makes a mistake, they are normally
reminded of the rule they broke, and life moves on.

The problem comes from a clash of cultures.  Someone who's obviously part of a
more "energetic" scene (not to say ours is moribund by any measure - just that
there's a different way of using and spreading energy) comes to offer us an
invitation.  Yes, it was in a style we have come to regard as suspect of the
commercial types.  Yes, it didn't come with the (BSP) disclaimer.  Yes, it was
an advertisement for a party 4000 miles away.

But it was ONE MESSAGE.  Look at it for what it was - an invitation, an example
of interregional Unity.  Remember, the U in PLUR?  Regardless of your opinion
on the marketing tactics, how boorish or juvenile you may have felt it,
consider it for what it is.

Those who spoke up with loud voices immediately appointed themselves as
spokespeople for the entire Bay Area scene... And as diplomats they seemed to
be very undiplomatic indeed.  Flame, flame, flame...And there's no Respect in
flames, only hard feelings.

If someone makes a mistake, they tend to be a lot more reasonable about being
corrected if you don't do it at the top of your lungs, insulting them all the
way.  if the person won't accept it for what it is, then ignore them.  Walk
away - don't get into needless fights, and save your energy for the things that
matter.

Now that my neck is out, let's see who's got the axe...

-Corey

Ok, yes this is Jeremy again. Yes a party will happen Sept. 20th, this
is a promise. I've worked too hard, and you've heard me BSP too many
times for me not to let this party go off. So unfortunately, my three
room indoor party will not happen. THere is still a possibility of a
one room indoor on the Monterey Peninsula. If this does not go off, we
have two seperate  locations we could use for outdoor parties. if this
does occur, I'll make sure this one goes off like no outdoor you've
ever been too. THis means my line-up has drastically changed. But
there's no way, i'll let you guys down with that line-up. it will be a
combination in some way of our jungle line-up and our main room
line-up. If any of you know me, you know how badly i feel about this.
This is my first party, and I've learned many lessons. And from what
I've learned, I'll make sure you have will have Always Something to
Remember when it comes to *Play Nice.*

you may have been asking why I'm so set on having this party in the
Monterey area.It's because us (the monterey kids) have traveled 2
hours to the city for parties over 30 times. and yes that means
driving home in the morning another 2 hours. This is my chance to give
something back to my area, if this is the only time i throw a party in
the Monterey Bay, it will be one of the best ever. I can tell you
this, but shhhh promise not to tell anyone, K? ASR PRODUCTIONS will
bring you *THE AWAKENING* MARCH 8th 1998. THIS PARTY WILL BE IN THE
BAY AREA, AND WILL BE MY BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION. 

THANK YOU for reading my confessional. I hope all of you come out and
support my dream to make *Play Nice,* GO OFF.

love~jeremy

~~REMEMBER TO *PLAY NICE* SEPT. 20th~

At 05:37 PM 9/12/97 EDT, Joe Desantis wrote:
>I have never checked out the western lists before....today was my first
>day...

When you subscribed, the welcome message you got back said:

  * Normal etiquette is to wait around 2 weeks or more before you start
  posting anything; that ensures that you don't tread on old ground and
  that you have a reasonably good idea of the mindset of the list.

In general, any message which includes more than one mailing list in the
To: header I'd consider spam - yours was addressed to 13 different lists,
which it looks like you got by simply looking for email addresses on the
hyperreal.org web site.  It looks like you subscribed to each list to make
sure your message got through, too.  Finally, the description of the party
itself wasn't anything special - it looks like a typical party.  What if we
posted the sfraves calendar each week to nyc-raves?  That would suck.  

If you want to reach the "general" population of online ravers, post to
alt.raves.  Don't think of "sfraves" as "online ravers who live in sf", but
instead as "online ravers who are interested in information related to the
sf scene".  BIG distinction.

	Brian


--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--
"Why not?" - TL           brian@organic.com - hyperreal.org - apache.org

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Jenn Farago <jenn@cloudfactory.org>
Subject: NRR: Disrespect on SFR (long)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

	I just resubbed for a few days and wow! I cannot believe the things
being said on this list. Never have I seen such disgusting and
disrespectful language and actions towards anyone on any mailing list or
for that matter in the real world. It's amazing how hiding behind a
terminal can increase one's testicle or ovary (as the case may be) size.
	I have been on and off this list for a few years now because of the
disrespect that so often occurs here. It's almost impossible to stay on and
read a days mail without feeling hurt, upset, angry, disrespected,
disgusted or as though I want to go on a killing spree. I do not blame any
one person and I do not blame all of the SFRavers. I don't need to point a
finger, because I know that those who engage in this kind of conduct are
aware of who they are. But if you aren't sure, wanna know if you are one of
them? I bet can I can show you without ever knowing you or seeing you post.
Here's a simple test. If you are reading this and are upset by my opinions
and racking your brain out to find the perfect insult and readying your
typing fingers to post a nasty reply, then I have done my job and shown you
who you are. Thank you for doing it for me.
	Not all of SFRavers are like this obviously, it is just that there
are a select few on the list with rather large oral cavities. A few people
out of hundreds that sadly, can make the SF scene look like a rotten place
to be sometimes. Plenty of people have said it, so this is not only my
opinion. Come on, SFR drama has even been a topic on other rave lists for
crying out loud. That is just rediculous.
	Having been in this scene for almost seven years, I have seen many
changes and met many people. I know that the SF scene isn't as bad as it is
sometimes portrayed on this list. I also know that some people who bark a
lot on this list have no bite in reality and that they really have very
little bark, if any, in person as well. Ahhh, the power of the internet, of
hiding under an assumed name or just behind a terminal, away from facing
people in reality. It can be such a good drug can't it? A real ego boost.
	But it's not only the people who cause the trouble on this list
that are to blame. I'm sorry to sound cliche, but those of you who bicker
about it are just as much a part of the problem. People complain about the
disrespect and start flame wars and create new threads telling them what an
a**hole that person is. Great, what has that accomplished? Let's see...
more wasted bandwidth, that person only attacks more (that kind of person
feeds off of your comments whether your right or wrong... they'll find a
way to put you in the wrong) and then what? You have more to complain
about. It's an endless cycle. Constantly I see people say to keep personal
attacks off the list, but then when the one you are attacking says to keep
it personal, what is done? You basically tell him to go screw himself and
that you can do what you want. I think the quote I read was more along the
lines of don't tell us what to do or something. I just don't understand all
the hipocrasy and double standards. It's sick. Practice what you preach
people.
	Having a lack of understanding of basic netiquette was also
mentioned. Well, I think all of you who get involved in this kind of
demeaning activity should check yourselves, I see all of you mention it so
often yet never once see you follow it. Saying the words over and over
doesn't make it happen. There is no need for name-calling, disrespecting,
demeaning, or bringing up past issues that have nothing to do with the
subject at hand, yet you figure it can tarnish one's personality if you do.
That is fully childish. That is the kind of thing I see little tiny kids
doing to one another and even they aren't that brutal and immature about it.
	Please, just learn to respect one another. Learn to keep a personal
attack if you must make it, private. Learn to keep your mouth shut when you
see that same person who always posts starting trouble, so you don't
instigate them any further. It's a cry for attention... it's what they
expect and want, if it wasn't they wouldn't do it. Human nature and common
sense tells us al that.
	Maybe I have instigated a little flame war of my own by coming
forth with this. I'll admit to having slightly poor netiquette by posting
this, but this one post, is nothing compared to the damage that has already
been done. This post does not insult anyone or personally attack anyone. If
you feel it does, I apologise, but it was not truly intended that way and
like I said, if this truly upsets you, especially to the point of publicly
bashing and insulting me, then maybe you are the one with the problem. Not
to mention the fact that I am not one of those who perpetually bickers
about netiquette on this list.
	After only being on again for a few days, I am off this list again,
so sadly I won't get to see all the drama this stirs up on the list as I am
sure there are certain people with plenty to say. So if you want to make
sure I get your personal attack, make sure you email it to me directly, if
you just put it on the list, I'll never see it.
mailto:jenn@cloudfactory.org Just in case, there's my address again. But a
word of warning, if you have a really juicy personal attack for me, you
most likely won't get a response. Just so you won't be disappointed, when
several days pass by without an insult from me. If you really want to
demean me and insult who I am, stop hiding behind your terminal and try
saying it to my face. And that goes for anyone you want to do that to.

Goodbye all.
jenn

p.s. My apologies to all whom this really does not apply and those whom I
may have offended or upset by posting this NRR message here.

.......................................Jenn Farago
.............................jenn@cloudfactory.org
...................................sprout@vibe.org
................."To sin by silence when we should
...............protest, makes cowards out of men."
..............................-Ella Wheeler Wilcox

Our friends throwing the gathering in people's park this Sunday
the 14th, have asked me to make a clarification about the party.
The party is not solely a Moontribe event.  While there are many people
from Moontribe coming up to help out and play and chill with us, there
are many other people from the bay area that are putting their energy
into
this event as well.
thanks a lot and we hope to see you there.

peace
jen

<!-- Excerpt From Article-->
		<TR>
			<TD ALIGN=3D"center" VALIGN=3D"middle">
			<FONT SIZE=3D"4" COLOR=3D"#730000" FACE=3D"Helvetica,Universe">
			<STRONG></STRONG></FONT>
			</TD>
		</TR>
		<TR>
			<TD WIDTH=3D"105" HEIGHT=3D"10" NOWRAP></TD>
		</TR>

<!--  Split Image Lower Half   -->

			<TD NOWRAP>
						</TD>

	</TD>
	<TD WIDTH=3D"10" NOWRAP></TD>

<!--  Author -->
	<TD WIDTH=3D"278" VALIGN=3D"top">
	=09
		<FONT SIZE=3D"2" FACE=3D"Helvetica, Arial" color=3D"003333">
		<STRONG>by=20
	=09
			<A HREF=3D"mailto:declan@well.com">Declan McCullagh</A>
				&#160;&#160;September 10, 1997</STRONG></FONT><BR><BR>
		<!-- Commence Article -->

        <FONT FACE=3D"Helvetica,Arial,Universe" SIZE=3D"3">
		<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The U.S. Congress, bowing to law enforcement=
 demands for more wiretap powers, is preparing to approve a scheme that=
 endangers the personal freedom of every American.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Nobody doubts that wiretaps are useful tools for=
 law enforcement agents. FBI Director Louis Freeh, who as a young agent=
 built his career on them, knows this well.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; But <A=
 HREF=3D"http://cgi.pathfinder.com/netly/editorial/0,1012,1343,00.html"=
 TARGET=3D"_new">Freeh's plan</A> would expand the FBI's eavesdropping=
 ability by building Big Brother into every word processor, every e-mail=
 program and every web browser. All computer software distributed after 1998=
 would have a special, secret backdoor for government access to your most=
 private files. Even your Internet provider would be deputized as a=
 cyber-snoop. It's the technological equivalent of requiring that every=
 homeowner turn over a spare copy of his front door key to the FBI.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; This is the same FBI that has a long and=
 disturbing history of abusing Americans' privacy. As director, J. Edgar=
 Hoover built a successful career out of illegal wiretaps, secret files and=
 political blackmail. Hoover despised Martin Luther King, Jr. -- branding=
 him an "obsessive degenerate" -- and once sent him an anonymous letter,=
 using information gathered through illegal surveillance, to encourage the=
 depressed civil rights leader to commit suicide. Hoover's legacy? Having=
 the FBI headquarters bear his name today.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; This debate plays out against a backdrop of=
 export controls on data-scrambling software. For years, the National=
 Security Agency has contended that encryption is dangerous in the wrong=
 hands, which is why the Clinton administration considers encryption=
 products to be munitions. For export purposes, government bureaucrats=
 consider Lotus Notes to be like a B-2 Stealth bomber or an M-1 Abrams tank.=
 This view stems from when encryption was largely the province of soldiers=
 and spies -- and amply demonstrates the <A=
 HREF=3D"http://cgi.pathfinder.com/netly/opinion/0,1042,1344,00.html"=
 TARGET=3D"_new">techno-illiteracy</A> of President Clinton and Vice=
 President Gore.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Bills have been introduced in both the House and=
 the Senate to loosen these export restrictions, which businesses say cost=
 U.S. industry millions of dollars a year. A study to be released next month=
 by the <A HREF=3D"http://www.epic.org/" TARGET=3D"_new">Electronic Privacy=
 Information Center</A> shows that many overseas firms aren't hindered by=
 such Cold War rules and are free to sell strong encryption software around=
 the globe. Three lawsuits are challenging the constitutionality of the=
 government's regulations on First Amendment grounds and have met with some=
 success.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Of course the Eavesdrop Establishment opposes=
 such changes. After all, limiting freedom through hardwiring Big Brother=
 into communications systems has been long-standing White House policy for=
 at least six years. Only now, however, are the bureaucrats admitting it. A=
 new book by <A HREF=3D"http://www.counterpane.com/" TARGET=3D"_new">Bruce=
 Schneier</A> and <A HREF=3D"http://www.epic.org/epic/staff/banisar/"=
 TARGET=3D"_new">Dave Banisar</A> called "The Electronic Privacy Papers" (<A=
 HREF=3D"http://www.wiley.com/" TARGET=3D"_new">John Wiley & Sons</A>, 1997)=
 reveals that the push for demanding computer and telephone snoopability is=
 both long-standing and bipartisan: in 1991, George Bush ordered advisor=
 Brent Scowcroft to press for such controls.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The plan stalled during the 1992 election, but=
 two years later Clinton endorsed and Congress passed a "Digital Telephony"=
 law requiring that telephone companies build only networks that are easily=
 snoopable by the Feds. Now Freeh is waving that precedent around Congress=
 to justify banning <i>software</i> that's not readily snoopable. "We're=
 asking for a Fourth Amendment that works in the information age. When it=
 was designed by the framers, they didn't contemplate, obviously, Digital=
 Telephony and encryption," he told a Senate panel last week.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Both the House and the Senate are poised to=
 approve his plan. Rep. Sonny Bono (R-Calif.), who once staunchly opposed=
 such a measure, told me yesterday that "we weren't aware of" all the issues=
 and there are others "we have to be concerned about." Bono and his=
 colleagues on the National Security committee yesterday voted 45-1 to gut=
 "<A HREF=3D"http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/z?c105:H.R.695:"=
 TARGET=3D"_new">SAFE</A>," a House bill that would have relaxed export=
 controls. Their amendment gives the White House the same veto over exports=
 it has today

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Now SAFE moves to the House Commerce and=
 Intelligence committees, which are expected to vote on Freeh's proposal=
 later this week. "They're going to address some of Louis Freeh's concerns,"=
 Rep. Curt Weldon (R-Penn.), an opponent of SAFE, told me yesterday. The=
 Senate already is <A=
 HREF=3D"http://cgi.pathfinder.com/netly/editorial/0,1012,931,00.html"=
 TARGET=3D"_new">moving in a similar direction</A>. The sad irony, of=
 course, is that legislation originally designed to promote freedom may be=
 perverted to limit it. In a way, though, this outcome was inevitable: the=
 intelligence community wields enormous power on Capitol Hill. Privacy gurus=
 and business lobbyists are simply outnumbered and outgunned.

<P>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; If Congress doesn't have the courage to do the=
 right thing, we should demand they do nothing. As technologies evolve, we=
 need to preserve our civil liberties, and courts -- not the Congress -- are=
 their most reliable champion. Since any encryption bill is bound to be=
 corrupted in the dank legislative byways of Capitol Hill, it's now time to=
 turn obstructionist. We should reject all legislative changes to encryption=
 rules and let the courts decide.
		&#160;
		<IMG SRC=3D"/netly/images/bolt.gif" WIDTH=3D"19" HEIGHT=3D"9" BORDER=3D"0"=
 ALIGN=3D"top" VSPACE=3D3 ALT=3D"*">
		<P><B>The Past 5 Articles:</B><P>




 <FONT FACE=3DHelvetica,Arial>
 <STRONG><a href=3D"/netly/editorial/0,1012,1382,00.html">The Battle of the=
 Quake Queens</a></STRONG>,
 by Andy Eddy, September 9, 1997;
 "Quake isn't  just for boys anymore -- Amazon Quakesters battle it out at=
 the All-Female Quake Tournament."
 </FONT><BR>


 <FONT FACE=3DHelvetica,Arial>
 <STRONG><a href=3D"/netly/editorial/0,1012,1379,00.html">Mother Teresa:=
 Cyberspace's Patron Saint?</a></STRONG>,
 by Chris Stamper, September 8, 1997;
 "The saint of the sewers joins Princess Di, Jerry Garcia and The Notorious=
 B.I.G. in having a holy huddle of netizens express love, hate and satire at=
 her demise."
 </FONT><BR>


 <FONT FACE=3DHelvetica,Arial>
 <STRONG><a href=3D"/netly/editorial/0,1012,1344,00.html">Stupid Senate=
 Tricks</a></STRONG>,
 by Declan McCullagh, September 5, 1997;
 "What do you get when you mix discussions of high technology and the=
 Internet with the weak minds of the aging techno-half-wits in the U.S.=
 Congress?"
 </FONT><BR>


 <FONT FACE=3DHelvetica,Arial>
 <STRONG><a href=3D"/netly/editorial/0,1012,1342,00.html">The Olympic=
 Flame</a></STRONG>,
 by Tony Karon, September 4, 1997;
 "Who will host the 2004 Olympiad? Looking at the sites of the five=
 finalists, it's difficult to see why any of them made the cut."
 </FONT><BR>

On Fri, 12 Sep 1997, Jenn Farago wrote:

> 	I just resubbed for a few days and wow! I cannot believe the things
> being said on this list. Never have I seen such disgusting and
> disrespectful language and actions towards anyone on any mailing list or
> for that matter in the real world. 

Please, let's not be overly melodramatic... You have never seen more
disrespectful actions in the real world?! Hello! People are getting
beat-up, raped, killed, falsely imprisoned, etc. etc. every day...
Can't get much more disrespectful than that. 

> 	I have been on and off this list for a few years now because of the
> disrespect that so often occurs here. It's almost impossible to stay on and
> read a days mail without feeling hurt, upset, angry, disrespected,
> disgusted or as though I want to go on a killing spree. 

I don't know if the Post office is taking job applications at this time. ;-)

> I do not blame any one person and I do not blame all of the SFRavers. I
> don't need to point a finger, because I know that those who engage in
> this kind of conduct are aware of who they are. 

Aww, how sweet and non-confrontational of you. If you have a problem with
someone, how about taking some of your own advice and confronting them
with it? Really, how do you expect to correct problems if you don't go to
the source rather than making broad statements that may or may not apply
to someone or anyone at all from that individuals perspective. You are
counting on those select fools to think like you do. Given their inability
to even enter a conversation with a modicum of civility or post
anything but, what makes you think they are of the same mindset as you and
will know that you are talking about them?

> 	Not all of SFRavers are like this obviously, it is just that there
> are a select few on the list with rather large oral cavities. 

Who? 

> A few people out of hundreds that sadly, can make the SF scene look like
> a rotten place to be sometimes. 

It can be. The list reflects some of what is present in the real world.

> opinion. Come on, SFR drama has even been a topic on other rave lists for
> crying out loud. That is just rediculous.

Big deal. Drama is present everywhere in the world, in every scene and
culture. 

> 	Having been in this scene for almost seven years, I have seen many
> changes and met many people. I know that the SF scene isn't as bad as it is
> sometimes portrayed on this list. I also know that some people who bark a
> lot on this list have no bite in reality and that they really have very
> little bark, if any, in person as well. Ahhh, the power of the internet, of
> hiding under an assumed name or just behind a terminal, away from facing
> people in reality. It can be such a good drug can't it? A real ego boost.

But this being a scene, most of the people here have personally met some
of the folks here. So I don't know how "anonymous" this all is.

> 	But it's not only the people who cause the trouble on this list
> that are to blame. I'm sorry to sound cliche, but those of you who bicker
> about it are just as much a part of the problem. People complain about the
> disrespect and start flame wars and create new threads telling them what an
> a**hole that person is. 

And how is what you are doing any different? 

> about. It's an endless cycle. Constantly I see people say to keep personal
> attacks off the list, but then when the one you are attacking says to keep
> it personal, what is done? You basically tell him to go screw himself and
> that you can do what you want. I think the quote I read was more along the
> lines of don't tell us what to do or something. I just don't understand all
> the hipocrasy and double standards. It's sick. Practice what you preach
> people.

See above....

> 	Please, just learn to respect one another. Learn to keep a personal
> attack if you must make it, private. Learn to keep your mouth shut when you
> see that same person who always posts starting trouble, so you don't
> instigate them any further. 

Run! Run away! Creep silently through the night! Don't say anything to
the total assholes, you might upset and/or provoke them! Puleez....

> 	Maybe I have instigated a little flame war of my own by coming
> forth with this. 

How? By making sweeping statements that are directed at no one in
particular except "those that know who they are?"  

> this, but this one post, is nothing compared to the damage that has already
> been done. This post does not insult anyone or personally attack anyone. 

So, by avoiding dealing with the source(s) of the problem(s) you perceive,
do you feel you have really accomplished anything? 99.99% of SF-Raves and
the world can agree with you, but if you don't reach the .01% causing the
problems, what exactly do you hope to accomplish? 

> If you feel it does, I apologise, but it was not truly intended that way
> and like I said, if this truly upsets you, especially to the point of
> publicly bashing and insulting me, then maybe you are the one with the
> problem. 

Well, I don't know if you will consider my post "bashing," however my
intent is to point out my view that your method of addressing the
problem is prone to failure as it deals in generalities.

> 	After only being on again for a few days, I am off this list again,
> so sadly I won't get to see all the drama this stirs up on the list as I am
> sure there are certain people with plenty to say. So if you want to make
> sure I get your personal attack, make sure you email it to me directly, if
> you just put it on the list, I'll never see it.
> mailto:jenn@cloudfactory.org.

Do you have a persecution complex, or are you just unable to deal with
the possibility that some others may not feel the same way as you about
everything you say and might wish to converse with you about your
viewpoints? If you really wish to make a difference, why is it that you do
not have the courage to stay, but instead choose to run? Who wins then?

					Black Adder

ahhh, my favorite thread!

here's my patented recipie for both rave energy and eternal salvation:

the nutri-flip:

go to your local health food store and buy some spirulina (the powder,
not the capsules, for some reason those never seemed to work for me). 
go ahead and splurge for the good stuff, it's all expensive anyway. 
peel and freeze a couple or three bananas overnight, 
break them up and put them in a blender with a heaping
tablespoon or two of spirulina, 1/2 cup orange juice (crucial), and
any other flavors you feel like tasting.  finally, top it all off with
a couple of spoonfuls of royal jelly for that mind-blowing one-two
punch.  then share it with a friend before going out to that big
all-night event - teenagers will be coming up to you asking what
you're on.  

- messiah wannabe

I don't think you're wrong with the whole bunch-o-genres idea for the 
f0am party!  I think the best parties I've been to have been ones with a 
diverse selection of music.  Any one subgenre gets boring after 6 or 8 
hours straight.  When you mix it up, you get a tase of what all is out 
there and it gives you a chance to hear stuff that you probably wouldn't 
hear on your own.  :)

Who's still in for the Santana Concert?!?!  We're meeting up before the
concert!

         Okay, so guess what happened?  Despite my financial woes as of
late, it looks like I get to come down to the Bay Area and go see
Santana this weekend after all!  I have to go to my sister-in-law's baby
shower in Fremont on Saturday.  And my friend from up here is a bit
stressed out right now and needs to get out of this boring county for a
day or two, so she called me up and asked me to take her to the Bay Area
and take her out.  I told her I couldn't because I didn't have any money
to go down there and my bills are more important than trips to the Bay
Area, and she said that she needed this so bad that she would pay for
both of us.  Her car is running funny, so all she asks is for me to
drive and take her where she'll have fun.  Yay!
         So on the agenda for the weekend is the Santana concert at the
Shoreline on Sunday evening!  When mentioned almost a month ago on
SFRaves, you all had shown interest in going.  So now I'm wondering if
the interest is still there.  If you still want to go, we're buying
lawn/general admission tix for $16.50 at BASS.  Santana is playing with
Rusted Root and the show starts at 7 P.M.  I'm trying to get some sort
of group thing together, so we can all meet up some place before the
concert, and then carpool there... And then we can all hang together at
the concert!!!   We can pick our own little spot for all of us
SFRavers!  I'd really love to go see Santana with a bunch of you guys!
It would really make my day and fill it with smiles!  I won't be able to
check my e-mails after around 2 PM on Saturday afternoon and I won't be
reachable at my home #s (209-984-3918 and 209-984-5151) after around 4
PM Saturday, so if you don't get this until later, go ahead and either
page me or leave me a voice-mail at (415) 790-1759 to let me know if
you're coming.  And hopefully by Saturday morning, I'll know exactly
where we're meeting up (probably City Espresso, but that's not definite)
and what time we need to meet up to carpool to Shoreline.  Hope to talk
to you soon!
                         Starting to Smile Again,
                                                       Julie Mae
P.S.  I hope this makes it to the list.  I know I'm not currently
subscribed, but I e-mailed Brian to ask him to send it through.  If it
doesn't make it to the list could one of you please forward it?  And
again, for good measure, here's my pager/voice-mail #: 415-790-1759

Caffeine seems to be the cheapest "energy booster" around, but it isn't the
best.

If you want a good enrgy booster for late night studying, I'd go with a
nutrient called DMAE, it's available at a lot of health food stores.. It
makes me pretty linear.... not always what i want.. tho'


You can get a good morning lift from a big spoonful of tyrosine (an amino
acid) mixed with a little bit of scalding water, and then orange juice...

That is the best thing for those mornings after dancing, when your body is
about 10 pounds lighter...

On Sat, 13 Sep 1997, Brian Behlendorf wrote:

> At 01:12 AM 9/13/97 -0400, Wyvern47@aol.com wrote:
> >fav:  Red Bull
> 
> Oh god this stuff is so vile; like carbonated Kool Aid with extra sugar.  I
> can't believe it's as popular as it is - a true testament to guerrilla
> marketing.
> 
> 	Brian
> 
--> 	Hi B.B.!  I ditto your sentiment.  It tastes like liquid gummi
bears but is so much worse than those Haribo gelatines.  It might taste
somewhat better with carbonation, but I doubt it.  A popular mix in ole
D'land was Red Bull with a shot or two of Vodka...ewwww :P   There are a
lot more energy drinks out there that taste much better.  There was one
called Lipo-something-or-other that was in a tall slim can (standard
e-drink shape, BTW); it tasted like lemon iced tea and was very
refreshing.  Another one had the SS Enterprise on it (can't remember the
name, but copyrighting isn't much enforced in Germany anyways) and was a
definite improvement over Bloody Bull***. 
	My fave though was this Guyrana drink (not the one in the US;
Josta or somethin (?) that tastes like cough syrup--YUCK!) that tasted
just like Mountain Dew...after three of those I was wired; but in a nice
way :)  The packaging was very similar to those small fat glass Pepsi-cola
bottles one used to get from vending machines.  Another "drink" was this
mega-shot that was packaged in a 12" long test-tube.  It had some red
colored *40* proof alcohol in it that evaporated once it hit your
tongue...not bad.  I can't remember the name (something to do with seismic
activity, I think), but I do recall seeing it somewhere in the US; maybe
NYC.  You know, there might be a trend to all this forgetfullness...maybe
I should slurp some carrot juice or V8 in the future, but then again, I
never did like the taste of a bloody Mary ;)



M&m

	  by emout01.mail.aol.com (8.7.6/8.7.3/AOL-2.0.0)
	  id EAA08956 for sfraves@hyperreal.org;
	  Sun, 14 Sep 1997 04:06:55 -0400 (EDT)
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 1997 04:06:55 -0400 (EDT)
Message-ID: <970914040654_-631981362@emout01.mail.aol.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: MegaBuzz Disaster (Car theft rampent)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

	I don't know how many other ravers went to BigTop, but other than Moby's
set, I felt the show was a disaster. No one was into the music early. They
saved the faster, more breakbeat performers for 4-5 AM, instead of putting
them on between 11-3. 
	The place was much to big and the crowd was rather meager for such a hyped
show. The overall vibe was pretty bad early, with most people there either
selling drugs or what seemed checking out the scene for the first time. I
feel for the second group because these people will be getting the wrong
impression of raves. 
	However, the biggest problem with the venue was the location. I don't no how
many people left the place, only to find there cars were broken into. I'd be
really curious to find out how many. I saw at least 5 or 6 smashed windows on
the way back to our car, only to find out by some twisted irony the same
thing had happened to us. 
	The driver side window was smashed, over a hundred CD's gone, wallets
missing, and other fun surprises only to be found later. And what made it
worse was the polices only response was "You shouldn't have been in Oakland".
I might take his advice. Sorry if I killed any good vibes or if I'm bitching
a little to much, but shit happens.
										--sEan--

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Sun Sep 14 01:34:56 1997

	for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Sun, 14 Sep 1997 01:34:44 -0700 (PDT)
From: ravalum@pacbell.net
Received: from LOCALNAME (ppp-206-170-4-195.wnck11.pacbell.net [206.170.4.195]) by mail-gw3.pacbell.net (8.8.7/8.7.1+antispam) with SMTP id BAA11425 for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Sun, 14 Sep 1997 01:34:37 -0700 (PDT)
Message-ID: <341BA23A.63E@pacbell.net>
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 1997 01:37:14 -0700
X-Mailer: Mozilla 2.02E (Win16; I)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Review of...Electric Highway Tour.---LONG REVIEW
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Okay now don't flame me just for going to this-Patrice had free 
tickects that her friend won off the radio, ouch-off the radio, I know-I 
know.  Anyways we went to check it out, it was our first commercialized 
rave and we wanted to know what it would be like.
	So after we get there(Pier 45) we meet lots of nice people, Dave 
from Seattle flew all the way down here just for it!  And it was supposed 
to start at 5pm, then we heard 6pm and then it finally started closer to 
7pm. 
	Jeno was up first and he did well.  It was really emtpy, hardly 
anyone danced for the first few hours.  After him some band came on--Booo 
& get the hell off the stage was heard from me---I mean what the f*ck a 
rock band at what was supposedly a rave.  Then we had, hmm(ask Patrice 
for the Line Up of Djs), then there was ANOTHER BAND, The chic was okay.
	The "Chill room" also served as their "Jungle Room" if you dare 
so call them.  Then out the back doors was a parking lot that you could 
smoke in.  Total police at the front and back of the place.  A sheet 
served as a wall between the main room and the jungle room.
	After the bands left and Dan came on things picked up, the 
Crystal Method was there and they did pretty good, my first time seeing 
them--all live.
	The best part was the H U G E cicle that there was for the circle 
dancers.  Although I think the vibe is definatly better at our raves, 
this one still had a decent one.
	We left at right before Doc Martin & Sneak came on, 
****Grrrr.**** I soo wanted to see them.
	But apparently they took out many people for overdosing on drugs. 
 They also had FREE BOTTLED WATER and FREE RED BULL energy drink, its 
like carbonated Kool-Aid.  IT had me sooo JiVeD for so long.  Can we say 
HyPeR?!?!?
	I think that is the end.  Oh yeah, they gave out free 
glowsticks, everything just about was free.  AND they had this hella cool 
thing that misted water out of the tips of orange street cones, it was in 
the shape of a star.  There should be one at every rave--they are soo 
good for cooling down.

THE VERY END..................T E R E S A    =]

Subject: Electric Hiway Tour (dud!)
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: Text/Plain
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Electric highway tour, rating (scale: 1-10):  3.5

Got there around 8, and it was a sparse crowd for such a large place.  $25 
freakin' dollars!  They better give out free Red Bull (that shit gave me a 
stomach ache).  DJ Dan was one of the better acts.  Fluke was ok, not great for 
dancing.  Some good videos, very loud sound.  Crystal method just couldn't seem 
to get it right.  Did anyone else notice this?  They'd start a build, then it 
would go nowhere.  Doc Martin was better, but by then everyone was tired and he 
never really set it off.  OK vibe, as in no negatives, but nothing to write 
mama about.  Did I mention loud?  Jungle room was ok, but still somewhat 
mediocre.  Free bottled water was the highpoint.

What did we learn from this weekend, liebe Gruppe?  Car break-ins at Big Top, 
ho-hum performances at EHT= Massives suck! Curiosity:  was that you Jeff, in 
the mask and orange roadworker outfit, in the circle?  Time for bed.

Okay. I seem to be one of a minority. I guess it's just 'cuz I seem to 
have fun everywhere I go. I liked it. Crystal Method were ok I guess. 
Nothing like I had expected. I'd heard them on CD and they were better. 
The chill out room was up&down. The times it was up... IT WENT OFF! (If 
you were there, I was the tall girl w/ the red knit cap [that kept 
coming off 'cuz my fro kept escaping] and red parachute pants that was 
jumping around like a fukin' madwoman with glowstix in full effect!) DJ 
Rap is good. I mean she's good. Little gurrrl... BIG boom.
  The water ran out (kinda insane), so I decided to use that tire/road 
cone misty thangy as an H2O fountain. Not quick, but refreshing.
  Question for all of ya. I've never done any drugs before (yeah,really) 
and I had decided (after 'bout 6 mos. worth of deliberation) that I was 
gonna E. Well, my friend & I took 1 each. 2 hrs. later... nothing for 
me, he was doing just fine. So I went back to the person and he gave me 
another (free) I took 1/2... nothing. I took the other 1/2... nada. 
Meanwhile, my friend is having the time of his life. Anyone ever had 
this problem before or am I just a fReAk of science?
-TRACY
Hi ROB! (and Kirsten and *Smurf Hair (sorry, I concentrated so hard on 
his hair that I don't remember his real name : (

to wear something a little more unique and silly - my Goofy (tm) 
t-shirt! It's a black and yellow checkered shirt with a facial view
of the Disney character Goofy on the front of the shirt, and the
back of Goofy's head on the back of the shirt.

 It was one of my first "raving" shirts, so it's very special to me!
Also helps to identify me. 

 I may or may not also have my "SFR" cap on. I just got a very short 
( for me ) haircut - black hair, brown eyes, 5' 7".

welcome to join me !

*sigh* welcome to the world of new york area events (big ones, at least) -
although here in the city, you rarely get your CAR broken into since most
of us don't have one - you get your pocket picked, or god forbid you
brought some presents for friends - my friend got pushed up against a wall
once by some hoodies, and they took all his party favors and cash...  later
on that night, some guy walked by my boyfriend and tried to pick his
pocket...  lovely, eh?  

ya know, peeps, it seems like this crap happens everywhere - and even
weirder is that some of the silly things that have been happening here
lately on this list happen everywhere too...  sometimes i wish we lived in
houses instead of little boxes here (and to think that for manhattan, my
place is a spacious luxury) cuz i end up a lotta times at home, dancing in
my living room...  it's much more fun that way sometimes, and you won't get
arrested for doing it naked... ; -)

>them on between 11-3.

So, people...
We haven't yet learned to not leave a bunch of crap in the car?  Not to say
this theft was your fault but let's use our heads!  Even if these items
were hidden in the car, the windows may have still been smashed.  People
just like to be destructive sometimes.  But think about what a plus you
added to the jerks who did the breaking into.  "Hey, we were just being
ass-holes and smashing wiondows, but look at all this cool shit we came up
on!"  Had there not been a car full of goodies, the only thing lost would
have been a window.
Rave Intelligently,
Megan

Man.

I am not sure what life is like where some of you may be from.  I wish
that I could experience the innocence of block after block of houses with
their doors unlocked, and that type of thing, but as they say, you can
never go back.

As with any situation in which you are unfamiliar with the safety of your
stuff, be it travelling or going to a rave in a lurky section of the
world, PACK LIGHT.  The things of value should be carried on your person,
in such a way that someone would have to physically assault you to take.

Not to sound like some MARTIAL LAW LOOK OUT kind of muuuug, but listen...

An money belt is easy to find or make.  Get one.  Use it.  And if you go
to REI or anyplace like that to buy a money belt, you can also consider a
travel thing that is like a wallet that goes around your neck and has a
nice Cambrelle lining to go against your skin without being annoying.
These thangs are made for carrying your passport and other vitals without
them being accessible to the quickfingered public.

I tend to wear one sort of wrapped around my waist with the wallet part
between my pants and my KNICKERS.

Now that you know that, know also that should you try to use this
information to my demise and your profit, that I am well trained not only
in the Mad-Cow and Hungry-Tiger styles of kung-fu, but also the

Subject: Re: NRR Energy Boosters
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

In terms of drinkable energy boosters, I like some of the Durk
Pearson/Sandy Shaw formulas.  BLAST is the original, active ingredients
are caffeine and phenylalanine; also has the vitamin content of a
multi.  It tastes orangey and can be mixed with water (kind of
tang-like), or far better, throw it in the blender with a banana and
some juice and frozen berries and you  have a delicious smoothie. 
Because of the phenylalanine content, it is best consumed on an empty
stomach (phe. is an amino acid that will compete with those in your food
if taken that way).

I am just now sippin on a "MELLOW BLAST" smoothie; this newer formula of
theirs also has phenyalanine, but less caffeine as that present is only
in the form of green tea polyphenols (added as an antioxidant).  This
one also has vitamins and grape skin extract (another antioxidant).  I
think it tastes better than the BLAST formula, but it may be the fresh
mango I put in the mix.  

They also make a few other variations on this theme, turbo blast, and
capsule forms of all of the above.  Pretty smooth, I think.  These are a
mail order product only.

For energy boosts in a pill/capsule form, I like the PEP products you
can find in any health food store.  Ingredients vary depending on which
type of PEP you get, but include the usual herbal stimulants:  ephedra
in some, guarana, gota kola, ginseng, etc.  These too are not too speedy
and give you a nice lift when needed.  Try 2 capsules.  

happy sunday all!

ZiggyStr01@aol.com wrote In thread titled "Megabuzz Disaster (car theft rampant)

>         I don't know how many other ravers went to BigTop,

Just a correction....   BIG TOP was NOT MEGGABUZZ,  Not even close to the same party, nor
put on by the same people.  Megga-Buzz-Mania was a Feel Good Entertainment Event,  Big Top
was Space Children.

> but other than Moby's
> set, I felt the show was a disaster. No one was into the music early. They
> saved the faster, more breakbeat performers for 4-5 AM, instead of putting
> them on between 11-3.
>         The place was much to big and the crowd was rather meager for such a hyped
> show. The overall vibe was pretty bad early, with most people there either
> selling drugs or what seemed checking out the scene for the first time. I
> feel for the second group because these people will be getting the wrong
> impression of raves.

That event was NOT a Rave, nor was it a massive... It was an Electronica Concert Tour held
in a warehouse.

>         However, the biggest problem with the venue was the location. I don't no how
> many people left the place, only to find there cars were broken into. I'd be
> really curious to find out how many. I saw at least 5 or 6 smashed windows on
> the way back to our car, only to find out by some twisted irony the same
> thing had happened to us.

This is why I want to point out the difference, because at Megga-Buzz-Mania, We had 15
patrol guards walking the streets of oakland in a i mile radius of the party... LOOKING
around and patrolling cars to keep them from getting broken into.  WHY... Because we are not
like any other big-rave production company in this scene... We care about you... Not your
money.  And unlike at big top, where the police told me they had 17 auto break-ins that
night (had that was about 5 when I was leaving)  We only had 2 on our night.

>         The driver side window was smashed, over a hundred CD's gone, wallets
> missing, and other fun surprises only to be found later. And what made it

Well.. The high point in my evening was definitely DJ DAN.  What can I say??
I got my money's worth.  00$$.  Well.. after freezing outside of the
warehouse and trying to pull some, "I'm with the promoters, I'm on the set-up
crew," so I could get inside and get warm, I opted for cuddling with whoever
I could find.  It was the weakest appearance of SFRavers anywhere, but how
can I blame you guys??  
I definitely noticed the Red Bull was not agreeing with ANYOne... and I speak
from personal experience.  the Sound system sucked, and yet they thought if
they turned it up louder the fuzzies would go away.  Apparently the cops were
there way past when they were supposed to be.  (You could hear the sound from
four blocks away, there were a few to many overdoses, and the
drug-dealer-to-party-goer ratio was waaay off)  
No where to sit... I tried to covet an innertube I found as a comfy chair,
but apparently that was a decoration in progress and some Live 105 crew
member stole it from me to hang from the ceiling.  Opting for a couch behind
the nice man selling glass pipes, I finally got some rest.  However,  Sitting
behind a drug paraphenilia counter in a well lit area with people you've just
met is not the thing to do when your mom decides that she's bored and wants
to stop by to see how the party is going.  HI MOM!! SO WHAT DID YOU THINK????
Hello to Vlad, Terry, Ryan, Laurea, Teresa, and everyone else who tried to
make this pitiful event somewhat happy.
