That Red Bull crap was pretty refreshing. It tasted like Sweet Tarts! And
it gave me a heart Burn that reminded me of sweet tarts. Ouch.. Yuck.
Please don't belch again.

Cydomax.
 This stuff is great.. First time I had a glass was in the morning before
work. And I was like dancing at work with no music. Like I had ants in my
pants for shore. Like James Brown or something. And I forgot to get coffee
that morning! 
 Cydomax comes in a powder form, you can find it at GNC in two (maybe more
now) flavors.. You can make a smoothie, or just mix it straight with water
or milk. Fill a zip lock sandwich bag up and take it to the ravE. Shore ads
flavor & Color to your water bottle.
 Anyone ever drink so much coffee, it ended up having an opposite effect on
you? Like coffee totally drains your blood sugar..Don't be surprised if you
find yourself laying in bed awake with your mouth wide open zoning-out in
the middle of the day after a couple tall mocha's. But if you have a
Cydomax, it completely feels like your blood sugar jumps back to normal
within a few minutes.
 I used to suck on lolly-pops at the ravEs to increase my blood sugar
levels.. But one glass of Cydomax does the job much more efficiently..
It even warns you to NOT drive while taking Cydomax. Because cops might
think your spun or something.
It's intended use, Weight lifting.

Jeff nStuff..
Wanna hear something trippy?
I used to workout in high school three times a week for two years.. The
teacher gave me Most Improved in the class... I used to be like, buff
nStuff.
Woh..
Trip huh?
Yep, continuation school P.E. was bomb.
Jeff nStuff reports: Feeling the rhythms can actually make you lose muscle
mass.
Look at most musicians.. =]:...


And while I am like, shooting the sh!t nStuff.. Anyone that has to build a
computer from time-to-time read this.
 Me being in TechSupport & RMA, I have to build a customer a new computer
every so often. And I usually get chewed out like it's my fault or
something.. "Hey man! You sent me a F'ed up computer man. I want you to
send me a whole new one! And I want your word that it will work this
time!!" I don't work in Assembly. Nor do I do Q.C.  So when people come
across like this to me. I get alittle annoyed.
 So last week I was determined to do something to this one guys computer. I
mean, I couldn't bug it, or flaw it...I gave him my word it would work
right! (customer satisfaction).. So I came up with the idea for "TIP"
pranks..
 Well, I had to load Win95 onto the computer. And I noticed before how
there are some really funny Tips like in Linix.. And you know how after you
successfully install Win95 it has thoughs damn tips popping up on start-up?

 So I searched and searched for where these Tip reside in the Win95 data
base nStuff. And I found them all in the registry.

Click on the Start button, select RUN, type Regedit.. Goto:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\explorer\Tips
Then on the right of the regedit screen, click on the AB number you want,
and select Modify..

I messed with hell of Tips on this guys computer... One of my favorites
was..
Did you know...
Using too much laundry detergent can actually increase hemroid expansion?

Followed-up (ofcourse) with:
Did you know...
Tucks medicated pads can actually stop the itching, burning sensation of
hemroidal flare up?

Something like that.  =]

At 1:37 AM 9/14/97, ravalum@pacbell.net wrote:
<snip>
>        So after we get there(Pier 45) we meet lots of nice people, Dave
>from Seattle flew all the way down here just for it!  And it was supposed
>to start at 5pm, then we heard 6pm and then it finally started closer to
>7pm.

i was informed last night that the reason this pier is empty is due to a
labor strike that happened (don't know when) and apparently the company
just fired and moved elsewhere (you noticed the lack of running water and
bathrooms - wouldn't you strike too?)  - you'll have to forgive my
ignorance on local issues - i did just move here a few months ago... but
then i guess the choice of location really shouldn't be surprising given
the sponsors. :P i _will_ give them credit, and huge thanks for all the
freebies... it was just a bit weird to have ppl selling tires at a party.
weird occurence of the night: this live 105 woman tried to give me a
sticker and when i asked what it was, she looked at me in disgust and said
snidely 'a band'. no thanks. (*shrug*)

>        Jeno was up first and he did well.  It was really emtpy, hardly
>anyone danced for the first few hours.  After him some band came on--Booo
>& get the hell off the stage was heard from me---I mean what the f*ck a
>rock band at what was supposedly a rave.

i *know*!!!!!! what the (and i'll say it) FUCK?!?!?!?!? and they, along
with the other *cough* band seemed to set a rather discordant mode with the
music that ensued. yuck. (imo ;) i was with you right there, screaming
*boo* go *home*! (liked the fact that they didn't even know where they
were...)

>        The best part was the H U G E cicle that there was for the circle
>dancers.  Although I think the vibe is definatly better at our raves,
>this one still had a decent one.

'our' raves... a bit exclusive, no? but i'll have to agree. i made some eye
contact and talked to ppl, tho!

you know, when i first walked in, my first reaction at seeing all the
stands and everything was 'hey - like a dead show!' loved the stand with
all the glowing toys... sure wish they had had ear plugs tho. LOUD! and a
pity, 'coz the 1 larger space seemed to drown out the other. alas, it was
not what i was hoping for tho. (you can tell i'm a bit disturbed by this)
tire stands??? and was that *really* supposed to be an art exhibit?!?!? HA!
but yeah, the stack that spewed water (so conveniently near the really dark
port-a-potties) was a luxury.

>        We left at right before Doc Martin & Sneak came on,
>****Grrrr.**** I soo wanted to see them.

you left too early, imo. i didn't *really* enjoy the music until their set.
then... oh no! i couldn't stop dancing! :o (thanks kerry for your drumming,
tho, which kept me rolling until we got to the after party!) so what's up
with me, that i'm still dancing at 2 in the afternoon??? ;)

anyway, *i* had fun... but i couldn't have done it without the ppl i was
with, the ppl i met, and the ppl i just exchanged smiles with. it was *not*
the fun of live 105 or goodrich tires, i'll tell you that much!

cheers - e. :)

oh yeah: _1_ how come the flyer, and the postings, stated that it would be
$20 in advance? tower charged us $25 + their regular fee. _2_ how come when
we asked the ppl at the door when entering if the party would be extended
to make up for the lateness they told us that "yes, it would"? the shit
ended at 2!!!! i can't help but feel a bit abused - let's shut everything
down while ppl are just getting going (and when the music is finally
decent) so they'll come to our (not free) after party (where you couldn't
even bring in _empty_ bottles for water).... just doesn't seem (imo) like
very good pr - telling untruths to your customers.

time to stretch my back. :)

At 1:06 PM 9/14/97, Dori wrote:
>*sigh* welcome to the world of new york area events (big ones, at least) -
>although here in the city, you rarely get your CAR broken into since most
>of us don't have one - you get your pocket picked, or god forbid you
>brought some presents for friends - my friend got pushed up against a wall
>once by some hoodies, and they took all his party favors and cash...  later
>on that night, some guy walked by my boyfriend and tried to pick his
>pocket...  lovely, eh?

yes, one of my worst experience was at what should have (and would have,
anywhere else) a peaceful, or in the catch-phrase of the day, a plur-y
event, was at the meadowlands. (yes....) a dead show, where a *lot* of ppl
had their bikes and things stolen from their vehicles in the 'camping' area
(which was inside the facilities, supposedly... not to mention that there
was rumor that a cop actually killed a deadhead after one of the shows....
(i did witness quite a bit of unnecessary violence on behalf of the
security there - funny guys with bandanas, tie-dies, and batons... :P)

but you know, it's really weird... i've frequented nyc with my car, as well
as phila. (including germantown, for those of you who are familiar with the
city), houston, made a few visits to oakland, and i now live in the
tenderloin...  but the only place my car has been robbed was in the
*suburbs* of my pretty quiet hometown of rochester, ny. i even worked there
in the projects, but nothing ever happened there either. but, after about 5
robberies during which both the exterior and interior of my car was
_trashed_, many tapes (oh those bootlegs!), leathers, boom boxes... you
name it (except my car-stereo, which each time proved to be resistant to
their attempts)... it's been taken. so what's to learn? a. theft insurance.
they'll even reimburse you for tapes. :) b. don't leave valuables (things
that are expensive, or can't be replaced) in your car! it's just asking for
it. and for me, i've learned not to buy little red cars (mine was a gti,
and at the time i bought it, i read an insurance report statintg that a.
vw's and hyundai's (??) are robbed the most frequently, and b. red cars
have the worst reputation for getting broken into (and i have quite a few
comparitive stories to back this up, and not just my own); yellow cars have
the best (still haven't had the nerve to buy a yellow car tho!). anyway,
the point of all this dribble (and i'm doing a lot of that today) is that
this shit happens *everywhere*. and it's _not_ uncommon.

cheers - e. :)

Okay folks, here is the nitty-gritty:
Saturday, Sept 20 (in honor of Play Nice)
approx 6pm - 10pm
DJs Thorfio and ???
In Santa Clara, right next to SCU (why, that's on the way for most of you...how convenient!)


FROM 101: Get on 880 going South (Santa Cruz) and continue with the directions below


FROM 280: Get on 880 going North (Oakland) and continue with the directions below


FROM 880: Take The Alameda exit.  Turn right if you are coming FROM the north (101)
and left if you are coming FROM the south (280).  About a mile down there will be
a left turn lane with a light for The Alameda (yes, again).  Turn left.  You will
almost immediately see a Safeway on your left.  Turn in to the parking lot and cut
across in front of the Safeway.  (It is a small lot.)  Turn left at the road on the
other side and park anywhere.  My apartment complex is the only thing behind the
Safeway.  Go to number six or follow the noise.  And there you are!

If you have any questions call 408-984-6360.  Most of you live in or around SF, do
you really want to make the drive to Monterey in one shot?  Take a break at my place!
 It is easy to find, honest.

If anyone has equipment, decorations, food etc. they would like to bring I would
be delighted!  I want to see some new faces, don't be shy!!  I'll even have some
goodies for you.

Write or call with questions or even if you just want to talk...just because Summer
is ending doesn't mean the fun is ending.

>:) Amber

Actualy this scpace is a special event venue.  It is available to be rented for
special events by anyone.  You can rent it anytime for any party, as long as it
ends b4 2am... thats why it is never been used for an underground or a real
rave.. cause its limited, and expensive.  And its BORING!  Willy Brown had his
enogurational ceramony there when he became mayor of SF, and this location hosts
many anual festivals, and events, skate demos, art and wine festivals, the 87
dcronicle Centenial celebration, and much more.  Its a turnkey facility for
comercial events.

cool guy named Andy, and we danced all night, but it was still wierd. I
just cant even explain it.  Me and 3 of my friends came all the way from

depressing that the water ran out.  I was unhealthaly dehydratd.  Dj Dan

wanted to see Dj Rap and i missed her.  Well thats all for my review.. I
cant wait for the next party i come down for i hope its more worth the 4
hour drive than this was....  :)

around near the pier.  :)  Weren't there any candy ravers inside?
Hmmmm.....Didn't phase me, tho :)
Then, my posse and me went to the after party, but got there about 30 mins
early, and so noone was out there but a cop and some guy painting over some
tagging.  Did it go off?  We were worried the party would be busted, so we
split b4 it started....then we came back to Oakland and went to Super
K-mart and walked around, me in all my necklaces, bracelets, n stuff :) :)
:)
And that was my experience with Electrick Highway.  :)

OH, but I did get to have a lil fun at people's park for about an hour or
so.  Big HI to Anthony E, Nico, Zina, and SmileGirl Julie Mae (thanks for a
groovy afternoon!!!)  Disappointment of the day.....I was all prepared to
meet Teknodiva for the first time, and I find out that she left 30 mins b4
we got there....Waaah!!!

Peace, Hugs, and Happiness :)

Glitterboy Thomas

PS--Visit my homepage if ya don't already know who I am...
http://www.netwiz.net/~jedimac  And if you know who I am, sign my guestbook
when ya get there!

Little Johnny and Jane are playing in the garden when they start having
an argument about
whether boys are better than girls. After a while Johnny stands up and
pulls down his shorts
saying 'Boys are better than girls 'cos you haven't got one of
these!!'.
 
Jane looks at him in astonishment as she knows that she hasn't got one
 of those between her
 legs. She bursts out crying and rushes inside to her mother. A little
 while later she comes
 back out with a big smile on her face.
 
 'My mum says girls are better than boys', she says.
 
 'No they're not.' says Johnny pulling down his shorts, 'You haven't got
 one of these!'.
 
 Jane looks at him, then raises her skirt, pulls down her panties and
 says
 
 'My mum says that as long as I've got one of these, I can have as many
 of those as I want!!'

Okey Dokey, here's a review. Not a "E"view but a review.

Derek, Herb, and Myself arrived at about 9ish. We walked into the party
without having to wait in line (which was nice). Entering the party was
like entering the deathstar or something. It always has that essense of
darkness, emptiness, etc. I looked far ahead and some some AWESOME visuals
and some major bass and stuff was pumping. We spent a few moments in the
porta potties and were on our way. :) THe first thing I noticed was that
the music was REALLY hard and mostly on the dark side. So I looked at my
watch and wondered when BT or some other group would come on and take me
to where I like to be; high above in the white puffy clouds where the cute
little pigs fly with their platinum white feathery wings... and their
currly little tails flapping in the wind... :) But I never
got a chance to see Wilber. My journey would leave me somewhere between
dark jungle and pumping dancinble trancy techno. Unfortunately Tony or
Jeno were not on the bill. :( So the three of us danced from one area to
the next (and were like the only people dancing a lot of the time.. it was
strange) and never really saw very many people we knew. The strangest thing about this
party was the low energy level. I think the party was so long that people
were arriving at all different hours and you never saw a moderate energy
level within a large group of people. It was so scattered. Plus by about
2-3am people were exhausted it seemed.... and as each act/dj was
performing people seemed so unaware of what they were doing and were concentrating on
the act that was setting up behind them. I think there should have been a
curtain or something. It was like people were constantly *waiting* for the
next act and never focused on the current act as much. I dunno maybe I
crazy but this is how it felt. Like there were all these acts crammed into
a space and each act had about an hour... something that took place just
to draw a lot of people and give them a small taste of what these
extremely talented acts had to offer. I think this should have been a two
day event that cost the same and you could go both days. That way you
would be able to actually enjoy BT at 3 am.. if you were there at 4
you would either be totally wired by 3 or 1/2 asleep....
as for me, I was so exhausted by 3 that it took a lot of effort to
raise my hands to the air to participate in the mass groove that BT
suggested.. :)

Overall I think I could have skipped this party and save my (actually
Herb's) $30 for Cyberfest or Life Force. I'm beginning to realize how much
I love house and Bukem style drum and bass. Whatever music it is, it has
to make me feel like I'm walking in the clouds towards the love of my
life... and once we meet we'll bond forever and ascend to the heaves
above... *snap* *snap* *snap* *slap* ok,ok,... enough of my day dreaming.
But you know what I'm saying. I look for LOVE and UNITY at parties and I
NEVER feel that at Space Children parties. The last time I felt that was
at All Together Now.... I can always count on FeelGood Entertainment,
Martin's parties (The Gathering, Freedom, basics) and Pacific SOund system
to take me to that place.....

I hope to see you guys at Cyberfest. It's going to be fun. You all should
go and give this MASSIVE a chance. Massives always have that MASSIVE vibe.

Lets all go and increase the LOVE and UNITY. There's no excuse for
complaining about massives if you're not there giving all your love and
making the party what you want it to be.

 				Byroni... .. .    
				(The Space Cowboy)

For all those people out there who think DJ Rap dropped "phat beats" 
and did such a great job, I have a couple of questions for you. Are 
you high? Were you in the same room as I was? Maybe she was off that 
night, but in my honest opinion, she sucked. Can you say, "tennis 
shoes in a dryer?" She even stopped one record and started another 
one, killing any possible flow she may have created. And did you see 
her record stack? What was it, all of 20 records? Yes, I think it's 
cool to see a female DJ be brave and perform at a public event, but 
she sucked and doesn't receive all the rant and rave about her set at 
Electric Highway.
Just saying my piece   :-)

From: Interplanetary Monkey Jockey <anarchy@galaxy.galstar.com>

Subject: Big Top/Car Theft (kind along)

Precedence: bulk

Okay here is my 2 1/2 cents about friday night.

Me and the droogs = ) got there around 8:00 ish.  The first real act that I 
saw was No U-Turn.  Not sure if Nico showed up all i saw was Ed rush.
A little dark at times but a lot of cool drum n bass. They
had a MC who i liked a lot but byroni and AI kept cracking up the next day.
"UK drum n bass ... the sound of the phuture .. phuture" = )

I talked to them later in the nite and they were pretty kool guys.

Next up was 808 State and I was pretty excited.  I last saw them on tour
with Meat Beat Manifesto in dallas May '93.  I must admit that I had high
expectations b/c of that too.  But they came out on stage (had a live drummer)
and proceeded to groove out.  There style has changed a lot over 4 years and 
they played a lot of experimental garage sounding tracks.  I got upset at a
some of the younger crowd due to the lack of respect they were showing.  The 
last song they played was cubik.  Man that was my favorite song back in the day 
and it brought back some good memories.

Next was kevin saunderson.  This was the first (and prolly only) time I have 
heard house spun at a space children party.  It was a nice change.  I just wish
the DJ's had more time to spin instead of just serving as fillers between the 
acts.

System 7 was next.  I saw them at Juggernaut and was kinda suprised that they
were back but their performance was a lot better then the last time. I think
most of that was due to the power outage in the middle of their set at 
Juggernaut.  Anyways, they produced some of the nicest ambient i have heard in
a while and was a nice change of pace.

Left the main room to check out Grooverider in the other room.  He was spinning
some great jungle/drum n bass.  I am a new convert to jungle/drum n bass.  i 
still prefer house/trance but I no longer run at the first sounds of the bass.
As byroni puts it he is very charismatic.  Swaying and grooving behind the decks

After grooverider was loop guru.  I saw them with Meat Beat manifesto back in 
november.  THey put on another good show I just wished they had more lights on 
that back stage. 

Wandered back into the other room to catch the last few songs of Andre lucero.
I was talking to a friend when all of a sudden the music stops and a voice rings
out over the speakers. " Hello my name is moby"  then the phat beat kicks in.
Man his performance was great.  While all the other acts seemed tired and glad
that the tour was coming to an end  Moby had more energy that half the audience
combined.  It was very reminescent of the prodigy/Moby/Cybertronic show I saw
back in 93 as well.  He played all of his classics as well as some new ones.
I couldn't stop dancing/smiling throughout his set.  I got this weird feeling
when someone asked me "hey who is this" puzzled I replied "Moby" I guess its 
very possible to not know who he was, but I am glad that that person has a 
such a positive experience to correlate with who moby is.  I was sober but I
thought I was going to explode.  My chest started to hurt from dancing so much
but I couldn't stop.  That defiantely made my night.

After that I was kinda down b/c i knew nothing was goin to top that but I
figgered that I might as well enjoy the rest of the show.

Joey Beltram spun all of his phat anthems.  Its amazing how many songs that guy
has produced.  Imagine being able to spin for hours and they are all your songs.
He tore it up.  Very much like he did that last time I saw him again in 93.
(1993 was a great year for me and the rave scene.  i will always remember that)
After he was done everyone was chanting "joey joey" and to much dismay of the
following acts he went on to play a few more songs.

after joey was this band called the headdrillaz.  I was very curious to see
what they sounded like and after the show was impressed.  A lot of people 
weren't dancing which kinda upset b/c if it was the prodigy ( who they
sounded a lot like, new prodigy that is) people would be dancing their butts off
oh well that is how it goes.  But i grooved. very high energy. A lot of angst
which is another reason i think people didn't groove veyr well with them.

On ther other stage was Eat Static.  They was this huge brain sculpture on stage
which had all this tripped out lighting.  Kinda wierd.  But as much as I liked
the music, I wanted some energy from them.  And after moby and the headdrillaz
two guys behind keyboards was not going to cut it.  Back to the prodigy show
from a long time ago.. At least they had dancers on stage to dance and move 
around so it just wasn't two of them behind keyboards.  Music was good but it
lacked life.

The long awaited 2x4 of Juan atkins and derrick may.  I was at the very front
seeing how the headdrillaz just finished and juan was kinda upset at this
stage/sound guy. I am not sure about what but it kinda threw me.  i don't 
remember seeing him smile.  Derrick may had one tho and looked puzzled at juan
as he proceeded to yell at the guy.  But they got their set going and started
grooving.  A lot of detroit techno which is okay in spurts but I didn't stick
aorund much.  I was not in the mood it seemed.  But everyone else was having
a good time which made me feel better.   I caught the last few songs which
i danced to and liked a lot.

On the other stage was BT.  This was just one guy and even tho he showed a lot
more energy that Eat static by hopping around behind his cage of electronic
equipment it didn't seem to spur much reaction from the crowd.  Again I really
liked his music but it felt lacking after seeing to high energy live acts.

I was getting really tired around 4:00 but seeing how i got there really early
it seemed acceptable.  I did manage to see empirion and they had a dark set
which didn't seem to appropriate.

All and all i had a great time seeing some acts that brought back some great 
memories.  My only complaint is that there were too many acts and not enough
time.  just when DJ's/acts were getting their groove on, time was up and they
had to stop.  Quantity does not equal quality.

Leaving I saw a few cars with smashed windows and shit.  I totally felt for them
b/c the same thing happened to me at 1015 a few months ago.  And my friend had
her car stolen from 1015 a couple of weeks ago.Its not just oakland or raving 
its metropolis and life in general. Things like this happen so we can appreciate
what we have.  

I hope in the future that promoters have better security, but they can't be
everywhere all of the time.

Lots of luv and mad hugz,

Herb

From: SCiEnCe <djscience@rocketmail.com>
Subject: Re: Electric Highway: DJ Rap
To: "Neves, Kathleen" <kneves@gwa.com>, "'SF Raves'" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>

---"Neves, Kathleen" <kneves@gwa.com> wrote:
>
> For all those people out there who think DJ Rap dropped "phat beats" 
> and did such a great job, I have a couple of questions for you. Are 
> you high? Were you in the same room as I was? Maybe she was off that 
> night, but in my honest opinion, she sucked. Can you say, "tennis 
> shoes in a dryer?" She even stopped one record and started another 
> one, killing any possible flow she may have created. And did you see 
> her record stack? What was it, all of 20 records?

Don't worry, your opinion is heard and respected. Just a note, though,
because a lot of people don't realize that jungle dj's from the UK
operate in an entirely different culture from ours. For example, it's
completely normal to stop a record during your set. Not a whole bunch
of times, of course, but if a dj really wants to drop on particualr
track, or wants to change the vibe, or especially if it's the last
track of the night, they'll fade out of one track and start up
another. Now you might think this is weak, but honstly, it's just
different. A lot of jungle dj's don't care about taking you on a
'journey' and performing ultra-smooth mixes, but more like a hip-hop
dj, it's about slamming down the fat bass drops. 

As far as the the record stack, I don't understand why it matters that
there were only 20 records. Can you explain?

-take care

Science

In-Reply-To: <19970915172807.25058.rocketmail@web2.rocketmail.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.SUN.3.95.970915103538.23745M-100000@ccnet3>

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Yeah,

Jungle DJs are insane. :) They do things that don't make sense to the
average house raver. We're used to continuous mixes of melodic beats.
Jungle DJs stop the decks, scratch a lot, don't necessarily beat match and
have MCs.

I personally like the continuous mix and don't enjoy the choppy sound you
can get from jungle. But that doesn't mean the DJ sucks, in fact I give
anyone major props for spinning music in front of people. It takes a lot
of guts to do that. But the guts part can be replaced by the love you
should have for the music you're sharing with others.

Byroni



On Mon, 15 Sep 1997, SCiEnCe wrote:

> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ---"Neves, Kathleen" <kneves@gwa.com> wrote:
> >
> > For all those people out there who think DJ Rap dropped "phat beats" 
> > and did such a great job, I have a couple of questions for you. Are 
> > you high? Were you in the same room as I was? Maybe she was off that 
> > night, but in my honest opinion, she sucked. Can you say, "tennis 
> > shoes in a dryer?" She even stopped one record and started another 
> > one, killing any possible flow she may have created. And did you see 
> > her record stack? What was it, all of 20 records?
> 
> Don't worry, your opinion is heard and respected. Just a note, though,
> because a lot of people don't realize that jungle dj's from the UK
> operate in an entirely different culture from ours. For example, it's
> completely normal to stop a record during your set. Not a whole bunch
> of times, of course, but if a dj really wants to drop on particualr
> track, or wants to change the vibe, or especially if it's the last
> track of the night, they'll fade out of one track and start up
> another. Now you might think this is weak, but honstly, it's just
> different. A lot of jungle dj's don't care about taking you on a
> 'journey' and performing ultra-smooth mixes, but more like a hip-hop
> dj, it's about slamming down the fat bass drops. 
> 
> As far as the the record stack, I don't understand why it matters that
> there were only 20 records. Can you explain?
> 
> -take care
> 
> Science
> 
> 

Byroni... .. .    
(The Space Cowboy)

Subject: music-making: killer looking Cakewalk studioware for MC-303
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 97 10:58:28 -0700
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>

See http://home.luna.nl/~code/303awe/layout.htm

Subject: most complete cakewalk layout
From:    Trifkac <code@luna.nl>
Date:    Fri, 12 Sep 97 01:32:33 +0200
To:      Multiple recipients of <groovelist@mail.ganesa.com>
             ----------------------------------------
The most complete cakewalk layout with the look of the real mc303 is
available now!

Use the knobs to control channel 10 and 11 (rhythm sets), channel 1 to 5
(tone parts) and channel 6 (awe32 samples).
- volume
- cut off
- resonance
- pan
- portamento
- modulation
- chorus
- reverb
- attack
- decay
- release
- delay

Use the part mute buttons to mute channel 1 to 6.

Use the rhythm mute buttons to mute track 10 to 17:
- bass drum
- snare drum
- hihat
- clap
- cymbal
- tom/perc
- hit
- others

Use the play mode button to switch sound module / normal mode.

Use the keys to start / stop samples form the awe32 soundfont bank.

You can get de layout for free when you send one of your songs in
cakewalk (.wrk) or bulkdump (.sys) format.

For more information:
http://www.luna.nl/~code/303awe/layout.htm

---------------------------------------------------
to subscribe or unsubscribe to this list, please visit
http://www.mc303.net/maillist.htm

you may also use this page to set your subscription to the daily digest mode
or to get help with list commands.
---------------------------------------------------

The stuff that gives Red Bull its "Zing" is called Taurine (The 
caffine and sugar do help too, tho). Taurine is naturally found in Bulls, 
funnily enough, some kind of hormoney stuff, but the stuff in Red bull is 
artificially produced.
I find it gives me pretty bad stomach ache after about 2 cans - 
managed 5 once and stayed awake for days.
The drink originally came from Austria, and a great local cocktail is 
Red Bull and Vodka - try it and see- rocket fuel feeling!
There is a better taurine drink called Indigo - don't think it's come 
over here yet - Wolfberry flavour and no stomach ache.
So there ya go
Overnout
Catweasel.



Get free e-mail and a permanent address at http://www.netaddress.com

> The stuff that gives Red Bull its "Zing" is called Taurine (The 
> caffine and sugar do help too, tho). Taurine is naturally found in Bulls, 
> funnily enough, some kind of hormoney stuff, but the stuff in Red bull is 
> artificially produced.

I believe Taurine is an Amino Acid.

You can also find such amino acids in various nutritional concotions 
at GNC and other health food and vitamin supplement stores.

I've found Twinlabs "Choline Cocktail" to be a good substitute for
coffee (has caffeine in the form of Guarana Extract, plus tons of
choline and b,c,e vitamins). It's a powder that you mix with water or 
juice to produce a drink. The only problem is that after a few days of
drinking it, you feel all amped out but you can't think productively
and just sit around daydreaming and staring at things, or you end up
wasting time in useless flame wars on SFR... :-)

Hi all again,

So I am looking towards the rest of my week (like I always do on monday) and I
can't help but get a little depressed.

My once filled wednesday and thursday nights are now vacant. It seems like 
there isn't a good place to hang out with your friends and loiter = ).
But I just liked seeing the faces of people and my friends.  Talking and making 
plans for the weekend.

Oh well I know its not really that bad but hey I will definately notice 
something different about my week this week.

SMilez,

herb

Slow day at work so I get to post a lot today.

There are a lot of web sites devoted to taurine or so it seems.  There 
are a shitload of drinks out in the market with taurine as its main 
ingrediant.  But a brief description for all of you.

Taurine is am amino acid. It is found in all animals (including humans).  it
is called taurine b/c it is most abundant in the organ of bulls/ox hence the
name is derived from the word taurus.  Whether or not that is the source
of manufactured taurine I am not sure.

here is a general listing that is pretty informative about taurine.
http://www.smartbasic.com/glos.aminos/taurine.glos.html
or just type in the word taurine in your fav. search engine and watch about
1000 entried come up. = )

Herb = )

Okay I am a veggie but I wanted to try a few of these drinks to see what the bigdeal was all about.  My fav so far is the SoBe Power drink.

okay, i'm getting really disgusted now. i haven't eaten meat in ... 14
years (cheese, and a few fish, yes, but anything that grosses me out
doesn't enter my system ;) and i had a couple of these nasty drinks
saturday night. not only did i get stomach cramps and nausea from hell, i
haven't been able to sleep, and now i find that i may have injested
something extracted from a bull's _balls_?!?!?! who would have thought - in
a drink - that you'd have to check for animal products? gross. if you all
could see me, i am shaking from this news. i always assumed that the amino
acids i took were... i don't know really, but not from animals or people!
perhaps i sound incredibly naive, but can someone please enlighten me on
where these things come from? (yes, i am naive. i felt like such an idiot
when i realized what gelatin was made of! another gross one.)

Well... I think that the mental aspects of taking E, are straight up in
your head.. YOu didn't know what to expect.. I have seen people NOT E
simply because they thought it was going to be bunk... Strange. "Man, this
sh!t is bunk! I am not going to E".. Well cheer up man.

Maybe you were E'ing. The first time I e'ed was my first ravE.. And I felt
like I was E'ing tornados.. But maybe I was just over heating. ... You,
having gone to several ravEs prior to taking E. Maybe you thought you were
just over heating like normal.

And then agian.. First time I took Acid, I didn't fry.
I am sure your eye's will start rolling next time.

Your not alone Tracy...  I had fun too at EHT.. Not much was getting to me.
Except maybe some of my inhabilities. And it was pretty depressing to see
Samona(sp) ignoring me.. We were on such better terms last time I saw her.
It's like, she either heard some bull-shit rumor about me. Or she just
wanted to look cool infront of "everyone" by dissing the STUFF. Oh well...
No loss over here.  =]:..
But the music did seem to lag.. Sometimes, it started sounding hell of
hyper, and before even I realized it, it was back to some kinna mellow weak
sounding stuff. Alot of unwelcomed ambient breaks...Didn't go over to well
with House & Break-Beat. And the Crystal Method, now I know why Technics
put tempo control on there tables. They were TO SLOW...... Putt, putt.. 


E sucks though.
=]:..

music, and sweat. Because at four in the morning, my body has already
built a tolorance to all magic potions.

interesting either. By the way..

>>>>> "e" == e menon <emdash@grin.net> writes:

    e> that the amino acids i took were... i don't know really, but
    e> not from animals or people!  perhaps i sound incredibly naive,
    e> but can someone please enlighten me on where these things come
    e> from? (yes, i am naive. i felt like such an idiot when i
    e> realized what gelatin was made of! another gross one.)

	Did you know that all of those kind of pinkish fruit juices
(like pink graprefruit, Mui Laui, Guava drinks, etc) are colored that
way with the guts of insects? Take a look at the label of any food in
question and look for "carmine", "carmine extract", or "natural and
artificial colors including carmine". It is required to be listed if
the food contains it, and carmine is extracted from a certain species
of insect that lives off of leaves. They basically scrape them off the
leaf and grind them up.

	Brings new meaning to the word "bug juice"...

	Marisa

pushed up against the tables like stoners in the front of the stage at a Slayer
concert. If you were to have went up front to try and see what she looked like...You
would of seen that she was way buggin out on the people hanging so close to the
tables asking questions, and straight up not even giving her elbow room.
 Yes.. I believe she deliberately busted out with some "Wimpy" jungle at first to
clear the place out alittle bit. Cause she played some tight soundin jungle later
on. And yea, she stopped once, and she also spun the record back a couple of
times. But she was getting WAY interrupted. 
 I myself just wanted to dance infront of her set. But I could barely even get a
glimpse of her, with all the hard-up doods buggin her up front. Yea 20
records...Probably remixed by her.

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Excuse me? But that is the lamest excuse I have ever heard for why a 
DJ performed so poorly. She train wrecked the whole time I was back 
there. I came back again to give her another chance (maybe she had a 
bad mix or I caught her at a bad time) and it still sounded like two 
shoes in a dryer. Come on now, we're talking about a DJ who has been 
labeled "The First Lady of Jungle" , has been ranted and raved about, 
and has had a full page, color picture slapped in the middle of this 
month's issue of Mixmag. I figured with all the hype built up for her 
and all the recent bookings, she would at least perform a half way 
decent set. I was disappointed. She's definitely got the look, but she 
didn't show her skills (if she really has any) at the Electric Highway 
party. DJs are paid to make a public performance. If she can't handle 
the public whom she is paid to perform for, then she needs to learn 
to. It's just my personal opinion.

-----Original Message-----
From:	Mr nStuff [SMTP:stuff@hooked.net]
Sent:	Monday, September 15, 1997 1:40 PM
To:	Neves, Kathleen; 'SF Raves'
Subject:	Re: Electric Highway: DJ Rap

Wrong...

 She was tearing it up through the end of her set...
 Incase you didn't notice Sir, she was getting completely distracted 
by about 20
fools lined up around her tables. Smoking in her face.. I mean, people 
were totally
pushed up against the tables like stoners in the front of the stage at 
a Slayer
concert. If you were to have went up front to try and see what she 
looked like...You
would of seen that she was way buggin out on the people hanging so 
close to the
tables asking questions, and straight up not even giving her elbow 
room.
 Yes.. I believe she deliberately busted out with some "Wimpy" jungle 
at first to
clear the place out alittle bit. Cause she played some tight soundin 
jungle later
on. And yea, she stopped once, and she also spun the record back a 
couple of
times. But she was getting WAY interrupted.
 I myself just wanted to dance infront of her set. But I could barely 
even get a
glimpse of her, with all the hard-up doods buggin her up front. Yea 
20
records...Probably remixed by her.
 People were so crammed up; they were literally over the tables.

Just my peice nStuff
Jeff
"Yea well, if you were a good DJ you wouldn't be disrupted"  -- Shut 
the F#%K up!

hey sweets, 

first off, you are NOT an idiot for not knowing what an amino acid is...i
had to take several science classes before i figured out what they hell
they are:)....ok, an amino acid is the building block for all kinds of
proteins, whether they are found in plants or animals. proteins serve SO
many functions i won't even go into it, but just to name a few: serve
structural roles in the body (muscles, chromosomes), are enzymes (speed up
chemical reactions in the body). the actual chemical make-up of an amino
acid is nitrogen and hydrogen (and i think some oxygen but i'm not too
sure).
so don't feel disgusted or anything, amino acids are EvErYwhERe.....and
good for you:)
take care dears. 

con amor y paz
priscilla

> >name is derived from the word taurus.  Whether or not that is the source
> >of manufactured taurine I am not sure.

> years (cheese, and a few fish, yes, but anything that grosses me out
> doesn't enter my system ;) and i had a couple of these nasty drinks
> saturday night. not only did i get stomach cramps and nausea from hell, i
> haven't been able to sleep, and now i find that i may have injested
> something extracted from a bull's _balls_?!?!?! who would have thought - in
> a drink - that you'd have to check for animal products? gross. if you all
> could see me, i am shaking from this news. i always assumed that the amino

---Marisa Giancarla <marisa@andromedia.com> wrote:
>
> >>>>> "e" == e menon <emdash@grin.net> writes:
> 
>     e> that the amino acids i took were... i don't know really, but
>     e> not from animals or people!  perhaps i sound incredibly naive,
>     e> but can someone please enlighten me on where these things come
>     e> from? (yes, i am naive. i felt like such an idiot when i
>     e> realized what gelatin was made of! another gross one.)
> 
> 	Did you know that all of those kind of pinkish fruit juices
> (like pink graprefruit, Mui Laui, Guava drinks, etc) are colored that
> way with the guts of insects? Take a look at the label of any food in
> question and look for "carmine", "carmine extract", or "natural and
> artificial colors including carmine". It is required to be listed if
> the food contains it, and carmine is extracted from a certain species
> of insect that lives off of leaves. They basically scrape them off
the
> leaf and grind them up.
> 
> 	Brings new meaning to the word "bug juice"...
> 
> 	Marisa
> 
>

>

> at GNC and other health food and vitamin supplement stores.
>

> coffee (has caffeine in the form of Guarana Extract, plus tons of
> choline and b,c,e vitamins). It's a powder that you mix with water or 
> juice to produce a drink. The only problem is that after a few days of

Ack!  Enough already.

So she had a bad day.  And so has every other well known/unknown dj I know
of.  Deal with it.  
Dj Rap kicks ass as far as her own producing goes.  As far as djing, well
I'm not sure cause I
have never seen her, but I do know one thing; I wouldn't want a bunch of
"boys" goo-goo eyed and slobbering on the decks if I were her.  

It doesn't matter if your a well known dj or not.  Having people hovering
over the decks would get me claustrophobic and very uncomfortable.  You
don't know anything about how that person felt that day.  What happened to
them or how tired they are.  What if she just didn't get any vibe from the
whole production, but she had to play any way, right!?  

I'm sorry but a dj is not always going to be on it.  It happens.

My 2 cents, take it as you will.

Siphon

> 
> OH, but I did get to have a lil fun at people's park for about an hour or

I got to do the sound for this, and honestly, I had so much fun!!!!

Hella props to Roman and crew for a job well done.  I saw a ton of people
i haven't seen in forever, and enjoyed a great day dancing, playing around
on the grass, socializin, and just generally enjoying life on a Sunday.

I didn't get names for all the DJ's, but I heard great stuff from
everybody.  Bonnie and Ethan tore shit up, and Roman did a great job
bringing the energy back down enough so people could go home without
trying to grind into their upholstery (which was a threat after Ethan's
hella fun, slower than usual set that had people freakin the speakers,
including a couple of the residents of the park).  The other DJs were
rippin shtuff up, heard some jungle I haven't heard in a while, as well as
some tasty LA-UG style breakbeat and some tasty housier stuff.  Hell
yeah... good to hear a party that played some serious slower stuff as a
general rule.  Good, mellow, afternoon vibe music...

High point of the party was sitting down with this guy who has been living
in the park for a couple years, and talking about unity and
positive progress.  I'm still blown away when some people just "get it"
right away, and see us for our intentions, not our differences.  Right
on...

Special thankyous to Carrie for transpo and the mobile martini laboratory,
Jonathan for getting me that tape, and Ethan for saving my butt with his
big ole amp rack.

Peace,
AndyW

now back into my previously promised self imposed silence... bad andy...

way happier to support Rap, VSF, and FTT all at the same time in
surroundings that have proven in the past to be enjoyable for ME.

In the second, place, so far I have seen several junglists whose opinions
I respect naysay Miss Neves' opinion, so I thought I would put my word in.

>From what I understand, DJ Rap is a sort of shy person.  Yes, she is
confident in her looks, her production skills, her mixing, etc.  After
all, she has been a huge success in the UK and the Continent as a DJ *and*
a producer.

None of which changes that fact that several people I'm friends with who
have met her, and gottten to know her through the UK/East Coast jungle
mashup all say that while she is a bouncy happy person when among friends,
she is initially quite a shy person.

And if she had a legion of groupies, and crap sound, and like no one
showing their appreciation for anything but the face and the body...I
would imagine circumstances would be sort of negatively affecting her
mixing, etc.

Also, I have found that certain types of women are quite against
everything about DJ Rap, whereas certain types respect her production but
think she's just a whorish girl who gets gigs because she dresses in
ALLURING FASHIONS.

I like the ideas that Massives have.  Gathering thousands of ravers together
for a huge celebration.  Bringing out lots of fun things to do that give
people a chance to have lots of fun if they don't quite feel like dancing.  I
think that's all great.  The problem is, the community (not just our scene)
it's ready for it.  Since raving has so far to go to be publicly accepted and
UNDERSTOOD, there is almost no chance of a real massive to go off anything
like a smaller party.  The vibe CAN'T be there because too many people don't
know why they are there.  Too many people go for the wrong reasons to the
massives.  Unlike the smaller parties where we know why we're there and
everyone shares in the experience.  Until the majority of the people going to
massives understand, then no massive will truley "go off".   

That is, IMHO.  :o)

LuV -N- BiG HuGZ,
~^V^~PhoeniX~^V^~
P.S. I'm making my very own laminate right now so everyone look for me at
Play Nice.   I'm looking forward to meeting everyone!  :oD

I don''t think that everyone should diss ALL massives. Some parties suck and
some are incredible. Variety is the key. It all depends on the mix of music,
people, vibe etc, ( pick yer order ). I think that if you wanted a massive to
be fun, it would be, as long as you and those around you contribute. If you
go to a party with a set mentality of "this is going to suck" it probably
will. I'm not saying that you should have happiness popping outta every
orifice of yer body, ( although it would be kinda nice ) but you should
always go with an open mind. That way, your mind is free to change, and
hopefully please.

To me, Lifeforce looks to have a stellar lineup, and hopefully draw a stellar
crowd. Cyberfest looks huuuuuuuuggggggggeeee and rides @ a rave seem like a
very interesting concept. I think that it would be so wunderful if all 30
acres of that could be completely immersed in an awesome vibe. Small parties
with intimate vibes are so much fun, and you get to bond with people, but at
the same time, a rilly good massive gets hundreds, maybe even thousands of
people to shake their booties all nite long, with a wide grin etched on their
face, along with other evidence of happiness and good feeling. THAT is the
goal of the real massive. It can only be achieved if we ALL contributed,
instead of bitching the entire time. WE can control the party TOGETHER.

'Till then.
Spread some vibe...
Keep it alive...

~*=LaUrEa=*~

It bothers me , too.  Anyone else?  I like having a clear line of site and
energy between my groovin' ass and the dj.  Sure, they've a right to be
there, but they put a damper on the vibe, 'specially if all they do is
stand there with cold faces.  Parties are SO much better when
we're all participating and contributing.  Don't 'cha think?  

I've made it a personal challenge to try to elicit some energy in the
watchers by throwing some of my own at them.  Sometimes I get some butt
waggles and head grooves, and other times I get cold hard stare downs.  Ya
win some, and ya win some(i tried didn't I?)  When I'm feeling especially
naughty I jump right into the midst of the stone crowd and bust out a
multi-directional special; rainbows of skittles, fountains of chocolate,
candied jewelry, ear to ear grins, and a little bit of teasing too.
Bedlam.  Please join us in the dancer's outreach program to reach out and
funkify someone.

And here's my more practical, Libra, let's please everybody idea for those
wannabe DJ's who like to watch other DJ's spin so they can learn or
criticize; pipe a video feed into another area where people can watch the
DJ's handiwork on tv.  They can have their own little DJ vibe going, and
discuss amongst themselves the finer nuances of the art.

We can all be happy..

G eORGIE *|)

hey folks

i just moved here about 2 months ago, and decided that i should introduce
myself finally :)

i go by dsp among the continuum... some people call me garrett ;-) I live
in the Ho CHi mIn district of Santa Clara.  I hate silicon valley but i
really like hanging out in santa cruz and san francisco and adventuring in
northern california.

Im from northern Vermont/New Hampshire, grew up with NEAU/NEW, ive been
one of the ne-raves cult for 4 years, i dj free parties and house parties
and sick cheap underground gigs, im a vegetarian, i really like techno
music like deep minimal sometimes overwhelming stuff (not that boring
shite and not that melodic lala stuff with no oomph or jam to it) i also
like deep house if it has oomph and it jams... if it goes Bap tsss Bap
tsss Bap tss for 8 hours i become disturbed.

im curious about warehouse kinda parties in san francisco... im really out
of that loop 100%... the city loop.  im not talking about the $35 empty
warehouse with two speakers that dont work and lots of candy things like
booths and massage parlors and big name wankers... but the ones i read
about in your papers that "slam" ;-) and the ones with "weird" music ;-)
For some odd reason Ive been very successful getting the 411 for free
parties :) truth ruled :) 

Some random facts about dsp:

Favorite Djs: Richie Hawtin (+8), Prozac (DiskoB), Pixie (Spiraltribe),
Function (downwards), Neil Landstrumm (peacefrog...)
Favorite Live Sets: Regis (downwards), Raoul Delgado (sheep)
Favorite Record Labels: DiskoB!, Drumcode, ABsense, Auk, Primate,
Subsounds, Future Frontier
Favorite place in the world: New Mexico
2nd favorite place in the world: Williamsburg bridge in brooklyn at dawn
Favorite food: Burritos
Favorite time of day: 6am
Most exciting thing i did this weekend... saw deer jumping OVER the road
on highway 1 at 6am over a cliff and straight down at the ocean :-)
Favorite Party ever: Minimal (+8) Toronto Ca, 96
2nd Favorite Party ever: the "cocacola party" (n.e.w.) Manchester NH 95

Im going to "Diet for the Sick" it should be toootally awesome :)
Definitely get a ticket sooon! time to go MENTAL!!! hehehehehehehheheheheh
word. Richie Hawtin in the U.S.!! I saw him two years ago in montreal,
best house set ive ever heard (he went on at 5am and the whole place was
going MAD) and at Minimal in Toronto a year ago... the sickest most
twisted party ive ever been to... totally totally worth the $10CA
heheheheheh bigger sound better setup best music than any party ive ever
been to :)  (and richie was spinning the hard shite)

do you guys have pre-partys and net meets and stuff for people like me to
say hello? 

i want to go grocery shopping with vegans too, like i want to be a vegan
but i dont know what to cook and what to buy.  and i hear there are some
vXe people here that listen to crazy music ;-)

pk
word
-dsp

I think crowd around the DJ can be kinda fun, myself.  Down here in SoCal 
everyone dances toward the speakers (I mean like right on top of the 
speakers, face to the grill, no lookin back!).  You're spinning your 
rekkids and you look up and there... NO ONE!  It's really kinda odd to 
look out and not see anyone there and to have to crane your head out and 
around the decks to see if kids are hugging the speakers or not. If the 
people in front of you are grooving, it's all good (as long as the floor 
isn't weak or something).  When they're just standing there, arms folded, 
baseball caps down past the brow staring at the mixer and the decks, it 
kinda puts the pressure on.  It's as if they're saying, "Okay, let's see 
some scratchin' or somethin'!"  That's when I start getting kinda scared 
'cause my scratchin sounds kinda wiggity wiggity wiggity wack if you know 
what I mean. :D  And when you throw out some stupid (and I dont' mean 
stoopid fresh) scratch and the kids watching so intently all of a sudden 
make that hissing noise and just turn away shaking their heads like 
you're a foolio, it's kinda depressing :D

Subject: STUFF (was: Electric Highway: DJ Rap)

I was just going to send this to George Porgie. But because of how it came out when I was writing
it to this individual person George, I have decided to share it with anyone interested in deep mind
transfer  =]:..
 
 For starters. George sounds like he completely knows what I am going through at the ravEs.
 I was not intending to give off a disrespectful vibe. I have to assume you are talking about my
French, my dirty mouth. But you ever hear the way Woopy Goldberg says the F word? She says it in a
way that is NOT disrespectful.. And I honestly believe this is one of the things that made her so
interesting when she started out.
 But I am not trying to insult no one in my post. I may have yelled alittle,  but most great
leaders could pipe down alittle more in their speeches too. Perhaps, you could have seen it as me
be-littling another person.. But I wasn't trying to get any points like that across.
 It's like someone standing up and saying "F&%K EVERYBODY!!"  This right here can definitely be
taking as disrespectful. But I am sure you could think of many instances in your life..where this
was more of a turning point..Maybe even a way of telling everyone you love them.. It has been used
in so many different ways, I am sure.
 You know what I am saying? If we were all standing around in a group, and I got up and said the
same thing I said in that post.. You would of known by the look on my face that I was not being
disrespectful..

 And asfar as being shy -n- all that.. You see things through my eyes pretty clearly. But it's
worse for me, much worse.. I trip off more things. For one, I need to quit smoking pot. I don't buy
it on weekdays but. I have other problems. I have some kind of inability,  that makes it hard for
me to concentrate on any one thing at a time. Like I need LOTS of input all at once to be at peace.
And if I don't get all the input I am unwillingly craving for. Most of the time I will fade out of
the present and start thinking about past experiences.
 Somebody will spark a memory in my mind, and I will just take a trip back into my thoughts, relive
them and ANALyze them. I usually don't give it much thought, but it is also very hard to think my
way out of the vision.. Like I am stuck in my past, but the present is still ticking. Sometimes
even literally making me appear for an instance, to be completely spaced out. 
 And if you think this is a problem. When I am at the raves, if this happens I usually don't even
remember what it was I was thinking about, until maybe the next day..at which time I will also know
what happened around me in the present, during my spaced-out voyage to the past. Which is in it's
self is another space-out voyage to the past. Shew, this is deep sh!t..
 
Now, lets go back to the ravE situation. Call it the past, call it the present.
 This inability I have will make me come across like I am thinking something, but when you snap me
out of it, my mind goes BLANK. You ask me "What were you thinking about?" and I will have no
rational answer for you.
 Techno music and the ravE scene particularly. When I get into an enviorment that dark, yet
completely colorful. I am totally showered with beautiful input.. After my first ravE, I knew this
was my new vacation location. And I need a vacation atleast once a week.
 When I first started raving, the first ravE and up.. No one wanted to talk to me. Everyone was
just doing there thing, having fun like they so much deserve now for being alive. But I was just
getting in the way or interrupting. I would be thinking feeling, and sharing my feeling with whom
ever was in hearing range.but looked at like "huh? be gone little one".
 Yes, people (candy ravErs) would come up and introduce themselves to me and my friends, want to
hug, and basically preach the meaning of love with there joy for being alive. But they were just
playing the part, because if I didn't play along I was rejected.
 Example: I can't stand the feeling of lotion on my already smooth hands. To me it is just terrible
mixed with a dirty ravE and hotter temperatures. It actually makes my body feel like it is lacking
oxygen for some reason. When I would kindly & peacefully "sincerely!" say no thank you when offered
lotion.. I was immediately past off as not interested. Not playing the part.
 So after awhile of feeling like a was completely alone, in my way of thinking. I started leaning
more towards the biggest sounds and input left for me to enjoy at the ravEs..The music.. 
 Then one night, while raving with my friend Luciana. It all changed. For starters, Luciana my
friend and practically family to one of my best friends, came onto me. She is beautiful. One second
I am thinking...I don't know what I was thinking, completely dumbfounded. The next second I am
thinking Tim, one of my best friends got mad at me the day I asked Luciana for her phone number.
And now she is rubbing up against me like a kittin around a warm leg.
 On the third second she asked me something. I thought I heard "Jeff, can you show me a good time"
But I had to be sure with something like this, being it was such an out of reality thing for her to
be saying.. Especially for someone I had barely known at the time for over a year. A girl that
liked my other friends, not me. And would always talk about how her man needs to be tall, buff, and
Harvard grad.
 So on the fourth second I said "what?" And on the fifth second, by the hesitation in her
appearance, she instantly either feared rejection, or thought I was disappointed. So she did not
repeat herself and quickly turned away.
 Now if this wasn't a ravE where things are going alittle faster than normal. My initial response
might not of been what, maybe something like a great big smile and a "did you say what I think you
said?" instead. Luciana is a beautiful lady.
 After awhile that night, she found someone else. She brought him over to me and said with a very
happy smile "see Jeff, this is my kind of man".. I was happy for her. After we all hung out for
awhile they decided they wanted to go chill alone for awhile. So I wondered off on my own journeE..
 I end up spotting this girl. She had lights around her waist..one flashing bike light attached to
each belt buckle. I went up to her and told her how much I liked the way the lights seemed like
just one circling around her hips. Not premeditated. Probably thanks to her, we end up really
hitting it off after that.
 But then. One of her friends came up to her and whispered something to her, something later on I
thought sounded like "you better hurry up if you like this guy" While there whispering, I get
distracted by all the imput now taking place over hers. And I find out I have a four girl (plus)
audience standing around behind me. All totally beautiful, saying things like "what does she have
that I don't have?" I turn around to my newly found friend and she asks me where the chill room is
located. I respond, she asks me if I want to go check it out. What do I say? No.... }:\ Damnit!! I
was getting to much attention now!! What happened!!?!?!??
 I now have a half dozen more stimulating instances going on around me. It all happened so fast.
Girls saying things like "he is making me hungry",, or I think it was I am dancing, this is
happening, this is unreal and totally flattering. The night ends, I go home with the upmost
confidence in my self-being.
 I then went to my next ravE, FUSION. Where I got up and danced again. In hope, the monster would
come back out of the closet once again. And it did!,!,,,something fearce. In my mind it seemed like
every single girl was enjoying my dancing. So what do I do? I fucking danced non-stop, without
skipping the beat for six hours....
 Around the end of the night is when it first started. Girls now WANT me to move on them. And as
you can so clearly see yourself, the shyness was thick. There not having fun now mind you, they now
just want me to move in..
 Oh yea and, that night was the first night I wasn't IGNORED by the male population at the ravEs.
But did they want to meet me? No! They just wanted to walk around me and say things like "live it
up me" and they were not happy. They gave off more of a "dick" vibe.. Like they were jealous, but
at the time seemed to me as straight up disrespect and disbelief... Infact the only person that
came up to me and gave me props was one of the promoters. He came up to me and either said "the
whole world is watching you, keep it up" or it was "All the girls are watching you, keep it up" and
he made me very happy. He was cool..
 Multiply all my inabilities, enhanced fully by E usage. Trying to conquer my shyness, my
quietness, and inability to concentrate when happy input unfolds..
 Then you got me, here, a year later...

 You know. I never held a grudge to anything. All I have been doing is trying to correct myself,
while being attacked, pressured, and misunderstood. 

 I would also like to share another mistake, mistakin thing that happened to me not so long ago,
during a time when I was coming down, and at the time I was most SNAPPED out on what is happening
to me.
 I was at a friends house after a ravE, there were a lot of ravErs there I had never seen, but all
seemed to know me as someone they DID NOT want to be friendly with.  And the stupidest thing
happened. A bunch of people were in the room..Then they all got up a went to burn or something,
except for one. He stayed in there while I was mixing. I stopped, then he said something to me like
"I remember you when you first started raving. You know it's cool your all dancing and having a
good time with your friends. But sometimes you need to give alittle back"
 I don't know what I was feeling. I know that, that was the last time I took E because I was so
twisted up. I ended up saying "you know, I have problems. I don't want to be no roll model. And the
girls there are to young for me anyways" It was so stupid for me to say that, for I do not really
feel this way. He quickly got off the subject. The next day I was like, "oh my god, what did I say
that?"
 And you know what? I believe that story is getting dragged around the ravEs too. 
 That day he seemed to not be takin by my words. But shortly after that day, all of the people he
hangs out with completely started HATING me. I mean total disrespect. This is a shit happens
situation, and no one seems to want me to answer for it..
 I just It really sucks all the messed up shit I have gone through this past year..

 But I have to cut this off somewhere...
I hope no one gets the wrong impression..

Nice chatting with yea. If you got this far..Goto bed!!!
=]:
Jeff

I thought you guys would enjoy these... haha.

Ten Reasons why "Scooby Doo" was a Drug-influenced Cartoon: 

1.Scooby and Shaggy were always being freaked out by ghosts and ghouls,
but no one
else saw them before Scoob and Shaggy. 
2.Scooby and Shaggy always had the munchies. 
3.Shaggy always thought Scooby was talking and was the only one who could
hear him
and understand him. 
4.Scooby and Shaggy always fell into the trap that was intended for the
monster because
they were tripping over themselves and couldn't see where they were going. 
5.They were always deluded and warped, by thinking they were dressed up in
some
costumes and entertained the monster. 
6.Shaggy always said "like" to the extreme, i.e. "like ZOIKS, Scoob, let's
get outta here!!"
What's a "zoik"? 
7.Scooby and Shaggy were always the ones in the back of the van (doing who
knows
what). 
8.They drove around in the MYSTERY MACHINE, which had that weird trippy
design
on it's side. 
9.Shaggy and Scooby were always giddy and laughing. 
10.Look at Shaggy; the way he dressed, his goatee, etc., 'nuff said. 

Byroni... .. .    
(The Space Cowboy)

O/<ay.  So, for a second there I got a few responses to this.  Now there's a
bit of a change.  The current roommate has given his notice so the room will
be available as of Oct. 1.

Here's the info:

Roommate wanted to share modern 3 bedroom mobile home with fireplace, nice
yard, 3 position carport, washer & dryer, center heat and air etc.  Local
community swimming pool & jacuzzi, recreation room with small gym and pool
tables. Convenient access to highways 880, 680, 101 and 237; just off
Montegue Expressway and 880. Centrally located near The Great Mall, McCarthy
Ranch, multiple shopping centers, parks, post office, medical centers, golf
course, downtown San Jose and airport.

Looking for:
	Non-smoker
	steady full-time employment 
	Male or Female, 35 - 50 years of age
	references required (looking for good payment history)
	rent due by the 5th of each month
	rent includes utilities and full access to house
	your private phone line already installed

Please send all responses to PhoenixJPL@aol.com (if you reply to this
address, I may not catch it very quickly within all the email from the list
that comes in everyday).

LuV -N- BiG HuGZ,
~^V^~PhoeniX~^V^~
& HiS MoM

> all

> everything!

> Some people are talking about 2 other things. Corporate sponsorship and
> price.
> Yes this party is being sponsored; they are Southwest, American,
> Dollar renta Car, Noahs Bagels, and Starbucks. Yes, they're
> corporations, but
> look at who they are... they're there for a reason; the airlines are
> flying
> people out, the car rental place are for the same people, and the
> remaining
> two are giving out a free breakfast for everyone. Of course all of them
> will
> make money some way or another, but they will be helping elements in
> making
> the party better. Think how different that is from someone like NIKE or
> MTV
> sponsoring a rave.
> 
> And price... yes, we all know that raves (some atleast) are getting more
> 
> expensive these days. But are the parties getting better? Some are...
> but
> how offen do you feel that your $20 or $25 or $30 is well spent? We
> dunno,
> but sometimes we feel a little let down by just black lights and
> speakers
> for the price. Granted, its not just the setup that makes a party great
> but
> really, what you're going to get for 25-bucks (presale) is going to be
> some-
> thing you will remember forever. Shoot, get the double-night ticket and
> it's
> even cheaper. Each night is going to be different, it'll feel like
> another
> party all together. Anyways, enough hype, enough explaining, enough
> text,dang..

On Mon, 15 Sep 1997, Niels P. Mayer wrote:

> > The stuff that gives Red Bull its "Zing" is called Taurine (The 
> > caffine and sugar do help too, tho). Taurine is naturally found in Bulls, 
> > funnily enough, some kind of hormoney stuff, but the stuff in Red bull is 
> > artificially produced.
> 
> I believe Taurine is an Amino Acid.
> 
> You can also find such amino acids in various nutritional concotions 
> at GNC and other health food and vitamin supplement stores.
> 
> I've found Twinlabs "Choline Cocktail" to be a good substitute for
> coffee (has caffeine in the form of Guarana Extract, plus tons of
> choline and b,c,e vitamins). It's a powder that you mix with water or 
> juice to produce a drink. The only problem is that after a few days of
> drinking it, you feel all amped out but you can't think productively
> and just sit around daydreaming and staring at things, or you end up
> wasting time in useless flame wars on SFR... :-)

I don't much care for massives so I didn't even bother with The Electric
Highway or Big Top but was I the only one from the list who went to the
after-party at Pablo's Sugar Shack? I danced my ass off to Monty, Taj, Garth,
DJ Sneak, & Doc Martin last Saturday night.  Both Sneak and Doc played two
hour sets
that finished somewhere around 7:30am Sunday with Crystal Method &
Fluke dancing right next to me! 10 hours of music, great soundsystem,
great crowd (for a club) and all for $10 = 4 star review.  Seems like
there used to be more nights like this, wish there were.

-Molly

From: "Noah[Siphon]Ruiz" <noah@cadence.com>
Subject: Rev: Dj Rap @ Ultra
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


It wasn't easy getting up this morning. ;)

Ok here goes my take on the night....

Got there pretty darn early, matter of fact an hour or so early.  So we
kicked it till it opened.  Around 10ish we walk in and it ends up being
only $5.  That was a pleasant surprise.  The place is made up nicely.  Not
very many people there at that time, but they rolled in by the minute.
They had some food trays out, that was a nice touch. 

Its seems that they only had 1 cartridge/needle when we got there so Noel
was just play'n rekerds for a while.  They ended up getting set about a
half hour after that.  Noel spun a mixture of stuff.  Some of it was on the
jazzy tip.  Nice.

Next was Miss StarEyes.  She got the ball rolling with some jump up and
some rollers.  I was talking with Flux while she was spin'n.  Right on top
of a bass bin.  Let me tell you it was loud.  Good sounding bass... Good to
see you Flux. ;)

Dj Rap was on next with her Benny and sunglasses.  She started off with an
intro "Its DJ RAP".  It was appropriate as far as I'm concerned.  She
started out with massive crazy beats that just got the crowd going
instantly.  She definitely didn't f@&k around getting the people ready to
sweat cause she didn't let off the whole time.  Towards the end she played
alot of older jump up and she even played this Jonny L (piper) remix that I
never heard before.  It was dope.  (by the way Jonny L is coming next
Monday to Ultra).  Her skills were good.  No real wrecks.  She had a couple
of rewinds.  She dropped alot of tracks in at the right times.  Some
crossfader abuse...She was on it!  She likes to move behind them decks
though!  Lots of good energy.

We left after her.  I heard a couple of mixes from Sage who was next, but
not enough to review on.  I didn't get to see Diesel Boy.  =(  Anyone want
to give a review on his set?

There were alot of heads of the industry there.  DJ Sneak, Dj Dan, DRC,
junglist left and right, and a slew of others I'm not able to conjure up at
this time. 

I got an URB magazine with a cd in it from Hypnotic.  Its got crazy techno
on it, not bad, except the cd is skipping like mad (allwell).  I also got a
Photek: Risc vs. Reward cd.  All this stuff for $5.  So thats not bad for
one night.

Other than that, take care...




    S       i       p       h       o       n
_________________________________________________
http://www.geocities.com/SunsetStrip/Alley/7995
____I'm a schizophrenic......and so am I!  ;)____

Subject:	If the Beatles were Programmers


     
	Eleanor Rigby
     -------------
	Eleanor Rigby
	Sits at the keyboard
	And waits for a line on the screen
	Lives in a dream
	Waits for a signal
	Finding some code
	That will make the machine do some more. 
	What is it for?
     
	All the lonely users, where do they all come from? 
	All the lonely users, why does it take so long?
		Guru MacKenzie
		Typing the lines of a program that no one will run; 
		Isn't it fun?
		Look at him working,
		Munching some chips as he waits for the code to compile;

		It takes a while...
	All the lonely users, where do they all come from? 
	All the lonely users, why does it take so long?
		Eleanor Rigby
		Crashes the system and loses 6 hours of work; 
		Feels like a jerk.
		Guru MacKenzie
		Wiping the crumbs off the keys as he types in the code; 
		Nothing will load.
	All the lonely users, where do they all come from? 
	All the lonely users, why does it take so long?

	UNIX Man
     --------
	He's a real UNIX Man
	Sitting in his UNIX LAN
	Making all his UNIX .plans
	For nobody.
     
	Knows the blocksize from du(1)
	Cares not where /dev/null goes to
	Isn't he a bit like you
	And me?
     
	UNIX Man, please listen(2)
	My lpd(8) is missin'
	UNIX Man
	The wo-o-o-orld is at(1) your command.
     
	He's as wise as he can be
	Uses lex and yacc and C
	UNIX Man, can you help me
	At all?
     
	UNIX Man, don't worry
	Test with time(1), don't hurry
	UNIX Man
	The new kernel boots, just like you had planned.
     
	He's a real UNIX Man
	Sitting in his UNIX LAN
	Making all his UNIX .plans
	For nobody ...
	Making all his UNIX .plans
	For nobody.


	Write in C ("Let it Be")
     ----------
	When I find my code in tons of trouble, 
	Friends and colleagues come to me,
	Speaking words of wisdom:
	"Write in C."
	As the deadline fast approaches,
	And bugs are all that I can see,
	Somewhere, someone whispers:
	"Write in C."
	Write in C, Write in C,
	Write in C, oh, Write in C.
	LOGO's dead and buried,
	Write in C.
     
	I used to write a lot of FORTRAN,
	For science it worked flawlessly.
	Try using it for graphics!
	Write in C.
     
	If you've just spent nearly 30 hours, 
	Debugging some assembly,
	Soon you will be glad to
	Write in C.
     
	Write in C, Write in C,
	Write in C, yeah, Write in C.
	BASIC's not the answer.
	Write in C.
     
	Write in C, Write in C
	Write in C, oh, Write in C.
	Pascal won't quite cut it.
	Write in C.
     
     
	Something
     ---------
	Something in the way it fails,
	Defies the algorithm's logic!
	Something in the way it coredumps...
     
	I don't want to leave it now
	I'll fix this problem somehow
     
	Somewhere in the memory I know,
	A pointer's got to be corrupted.
	Stepping in the debugger will show me...
     
	I don't want to leave it now
	I'm too close to leave it now
     
	You're asking me can this code go?
	I don't know, I don't know...
	What sequence causes it to blow?
	I don't know, I don't know...
     
	Something in the initializing code?
	And all I have to do is think of it! 
	Something in the listing will show me...
     
	I don't want to leave it now
	I'll fix this tonight I vow!
     
     
	I Want to Hold Your LAN
     -----------------------
     
     
	A Hard Disk Night
     -----------------
     

	Yellow Subroutine
     -----------------

	Why dont we do it in the code

	><{{{">  <"}}}><

        Rhonda Newhook <newh7510@mach1.wlu.ca>
Subject: Re: Big Top review...(long)
In-Reply-To: <970911215130_1594327824@emout07.mail.aol.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.GUL.3.95.970916111148.16464D-100000@farad.ee.calpoly.edu>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

My roomie and I got there around seven after about five hours of public
transportation to get all the way around the bay by tram, bus. train and
boat, instead of BART.  There weren't too many people there and we just
walked straight in and sought a schedule.  I missed the post with that,
and there were about two whole copies floating around the warehouse, so we
weren't too sure who was on when or who we were seeing half the time. 
Anyways..the show... 

it started pretty slow with some mixing going on at first then M.C. 
Rymetyme and the previously mentioned "sound of the phuture..the sound of
the UK massive".  They had some great beats going off, but it just went on
a little too long (two hours at least) with the same lyric the whole time. 
I'm not a real 808 state fan, but I've only heard way old stuff.  I
actually kinda liked them live.  At this point people were starting to
fill in and and finally dance some, at least those I was around up close
to the stage. Oh yeah, those two hours of the sound of the UK were
actually mostly spent in the second area, as we really dug whoever was
spinning in the second area...either Micheal Dog or Aaron Axelson I guess. 
We both really liked System 7...they seemed to be much more in tune with
their audience and were playing well compared to many of the other live
acts who just didn't have that live thing quite down.  They warmed the
crowd up. Andre Lucero spun a great set between them and Moby. 
Unfortunately the djs inbetween live sets were often overshadowed by the
work on stage and most appeared pretty pissed at the sound checks on the
stage coming thru over their sets..understandable.  Also, most of them had
quite a bunch of people drooling over their decks, until the dancing got
going more up front.  Moby came on stage and just exploded with his Vegan
shirt and complaints about ticket prices and the change in the scene and
all that in between songs. He's an amazing performer.  He said its not too
aften anymore that he gets that feeling where he just wants to dance his
heart out from the music he's hearing these days, so he'd just have to try
to give us that feeling.  He was the main draw for my 25$ (plus the 15$
"Moby::::I like to score"  shirt)...and he deliverd with Next is the E,
Go, a couple unreleased things, and the really danceable songs of
Everything is Wrong.  I turned around a few times and it looked like the
room was pretty full at that point with a lot of dancing going on
(finally) although I too got the impression a lot of people didn't know
who he was.  We'd hoped to catch Banco de Gaia and Loop Guru on the second
stage, but don't think we really saw much of them.  Heard Joey Beltram for
a while (what a mixer!), then caught either BT or Eat Static (who was the
guy in the red pants up there going off behind his rig around three on the
main stage?) but was really running out of energy, cause I'd been up since
6am the previous day.  Around 4 I nodded off in a corner for a while and
just listened to everybody in the second room.  My roommate says Medicine
Drum was really good.  Things started tailing off in the wee hours of the
morning and we headed home.  All in all we both thought it was a pretty
good show and worth the price.  I can see how people had trouble with
their cars...it wasn't the best part of town and people parked around the
corner from the door, where the few security people we were.

Anyway..that's my thoughts on the show.

t.
