To: Larry Ching <larryc@netcom.com>
Cc: "San FranDisco Ravers List" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Subject: Re: [dj gear] Denon vs. Pioneer Dual CD Players? 
In-reply-to: Your message of "Tue, 16 Sep 97 13:04:27 PDT."
             <199709162004.NAA00975@netcom22.netcom.com> 
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 97 13:52:41 -0700
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

>Simple query : Pros and cons of two brands of CD players for DJ work
>
>Denon DN-2500F Dual CD Player  -  list $1800

Consumer reports rates denon consumer players amongst the lowest in
reliability, right next to radioshack and yamaha. This may or may
not matter for Denon pro decks. 

I personally hate these. I find the ergonomics of the Denon DJ players
very bad. Very hard to use. Ass-backwards anti-user interface. I always
end up hitting the wrong buttons or screwing up the controls.

Then again, maybe I'm just spastic.

>Pioneer CDJ-500II Player - list $999 x 2 = $1998

(1) You can get these Mailorder for $599 each. Try J&R Music and Computers.
See http://garbanzo.ssesco.com/nau/mailorder.htm for listings on
this and other companies.

(2) I have these. I like these. They are a significant improvement over
the Denon's in terms of ergonomics and ease of use. I think they sound
very good too.

Some people have complained that if you have super loud bass sounds
around these units they will fail to read a CD and give some kind of
error. I have found this to be a problem only when there's a monitor
speaker with lots of bass blasting straight into the CD player.  For
example, I was having this problem at Burning man on Friday evening at
the Taz soundsystem, mostly because I didn't realize that the monitor
was aimed straight into the left CD player (the right one was working
fine). This is not a normal situation because the monitor speaker was
less than 1 foot away....When I turned it down (it was also too loud
for my ears as well), it was able to track again. I would say a
turntable would have had howling feedback with a monitor speaker aimed
straight onto the vinyl. So this may or may not be a problem for you. 
This problem never happens w/ my monitor speakers at home even though
I can get them up to about 130dB (painfully loud).

 =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==>>                    Niels Mayer (mayer@netcom.com)                   <<==

X-Sender: spaceboy@vibe.org
X-Mailer: Windows Eudora Pro Version 3.0 (32)

From: jonas the spaceboy <spaceboy@vibe.org>
Subject: virgo review (late!)
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

whoa. haven't seen a single virgo review yet. did everyone else end up
on the wrong side of the police cars? i'm sorry, you missed out... not
only did you miss a great party, you also didn't get to see _me_! *grin*

seriously though, it was fun. we got to daly city at 12.30 or so, found
the parking lot (outside lyon's) which served as map point. with tons
of cars with kids driving round and round, it must have looked sorta
suspicious. so i guess it didn't *really* surprise anyone when four
police cars were waiting for us as we approached the trail down to the
beach. we found kristen (kirsten?), also known as the birthday girl,
and returned to the map point to warn everyone. we did, and after sam
changed the voice mail we started looking for an alternate route down
to the beach. after a while, we did, and the hike down began. apparently
this route was a lot easier than the one people were originally told
to use. :) we got to the party at 2.something, and it was banging. the
location was beautiful, and everyone was happy and friendly! i've missed
the sf vibe all summer, but it wasn't until i started wandering around
among all the beautiful ravers that i realized just how much i've missed
you all! i saw a lot of people i haven't seen in a long time, and i met
a made a lot of new friends! much love to all of you! :)
the music spun by mars and mystr-e was pretty much right on the spot.
there's nothing that beats trance at a beach party! for me, though, the
real highlight came during the last 45 minutes. banging hard trance for
the headstrong. :) this combined with a beautiful morning put a perfect
end to a perfect party! thanks a lot sam, nick, and everyone else involved
in making this happen! :)

after a few hours of just being cracked out at christine's house, we all
went down to people in the park. couldn't really get myself in the mood
to dance, i was more in a hanging out kinda mood. and so i did. :) met
more beautiful peeps, and had a blast! the highlight here was definitely
the last hour, when we got classics like jam&spoon's "stella" and future
sound of london's "papua new guinea". yay! 
another highlight was watching all the non-raver types getting down! i 
just love it when people let go off whatever restraints they have on 
themselves, and just have a blast! :)

well, i'm off. but i hope to see you all this weekend. i don't know what's
up for friday, but i'll definitely see you all at play nice saturday! :)

much love.

jonas the spaceboy (who's back in sf)

	id QAA05908; Tue, 16 Sep 1997 16:31:49 -0700
Message-Id: <199709162331.QAA05908@netcom23.netcom.com>
To: Larry Ching <larryc@netcom.com>
cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Re: [dj gear] Denon vs. Pioneer Dual CD Players? 
In-reply-to: Your message of "Tue, 16 Sep 97 16:11:48 PDT."
             <199709162311.QAA23230@netcom22.netcom.com> 
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 97 16:31:49 -0700
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

>  I just called J&R - individual price is $699. Demand is up, the guy says.
> But they have a package deal of two players and the Pioneer DJM-500
> mixer and a coffin for $2299 ( I forgot to ask him about shipping ).

Hmm.. well it was $599.00 when i got 'em... while all the music stores
were charging 100's more... I think J&R wised up to the fact that they
can  charge more just like the music and pro audio stores do. The
mixer/coffin setup is a good deal, though if you want to get a cheaper
coffin, you can find one that's less rugged and fitted than the custom
anvil coffin pioneer offers -- I've seen those for about $180 instead
of $300.00...
	2 * CDJ500mkII -- 1200
	1 * DJM500     --  800
	1 * coffin     --  300	
			------
			  2300

ALso note that if you don't need all the fancy stuff in the DJM500,
pioneer also offers a new DJM300 for cheaper.

>  After hearing about this from someone else, I wondered what would
> happen if the players had a plate of lead or something massy attached
> to them? Adds weight to the whole , but would help damp vibrations.

IMHO, the problem wasn't the entire unit vibrating -- it's the plastic
hinged cover of CD  deck that vibrates and passes the vibration on to
the CD. I was able to get it to track during the overloud monitor
mishap by putting my hand ontop of the hinged CD cover to keep it from
vibrating. So perhaps some heavy 1" thick foamrubber (wetsuit material)
glued to the covers might work (??). Like I said, I believe even a 1200
would have been howling with feedback under these conditions. Best
thing to do is not have your monitor firing straight into the CD deck
-- note that only the deck 12" away from the monitor had this problem;
the one a little farther away in the Pioneer CDJ coffin didn't have the
problem.

 =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==>>                    Niels Mayer (mayer@netcom.com)                   <<==

At 04:11 PM 9/16/97 -0700, Larry Ching wrote:
>So Niels said:
>> 
>> >Pioneer CDJ-500II Player - list $999 x 2 = $1998
>> 
>> (1) You can get these Mailorder for $599 each. Try J&R Music and Computers.
>> See http://garbanzo.ssesco.com/nau/mailorder.htm for listings on
>> this and other companies.....
> 
> I just called J&R - individual price is $699. Demand is up, the guy says.
>But they have a package deal of two players and the Pioneer DJM-500
>mixer and a coffin for $2299 ( I forgot to ask him about shipping ).

I got this a few months ago, and it's very very nice.  The mixer (which I
think retails for $899 anyways) is a superb mixer, very clean sound,
balanced outputs, separate eq's for each of 4 channels, and a slew of
on-board effects like flange, reverb, echo, and even pitch shifting, as
well as a send/receive for an outboard effects box.  It also has a BPM
counter, though like all BPM counters don't completely rely upon it :)  The
BPM counter can be combined with the adjustable timing of the effects for
some really cool sounds - ever hear flanging that cycled in time with the
beat?  Really trippy.  And the coffin is rocks, it's completely sturdy yet
the whole thing can be carried by one person, at least much more easily
than a two-1200 coffin can be carried.

My only problem now is I wish I had 4 or 5 of them for all the layering I
want to do in my ambient sets :)

>> Some people have complained that if you have super loud bass sounds
>> around these units they will fail to read a CD and give some kind of
>> error. I have found this to be a problem only when there's a monitor
>> speaker with lots of bass blasting straight into the CD player.  
>>...
> 
> After hearing about this from someone else, I wondered what would
>happen if the players had a plate of lead or something massy attached
>to them? Adds weight to the whole , but would help damp vibrations.

Keeping them in the case, I've never had this problem; I'd be tough to
imagine a situation where the DJ couldn't address this issue if it started
happening.

	Brian

Yes, another bsp...

I've completed a new mixtape ready for distribution and thought I'd give
you all the lowdown...

The music on this tape ranges from hard, distorted, monotonous techno, to
smooth, slower house-influenced techno, to just plain weird stuff.  Some of
the labels featured are Fax, A13, Missile, Algorithme, E-com, Ideal, Grow,
Svek, Playground, Tag, Primitive Urges, Subhead and a bunch more.  The tape
is called "Hieroglyphics", it's 90 minutes long and comes in a fancy blue
plastic shell.

The prices are the same as my last tape: $5 in person or $7 mail order.
For mail order, all you need to do is email me with your address and I will
send you a tape with a self-addressed stamped envelope ready for you to
drop in the mail.  The best place to meet me in person is Static, tuesday
nights at Liquid in SF (see the URL in my sig for more info).  I may also
have some available at Drop Beat in Oakland.  

So... if you're interested, let me know!

Thanks for your time,
Seth

.....DJ Sutekh
.....Belief Systems................................

.... http://www.nodeone.com/static .......................
.....*send email for info on mixtapes.................................

hiya,

i know this is sort of late now, but what the heck...i rarely write party
reviews.  i'll try to keep this short and possibly constructive.

MUSIC

big top had a lot of potential with all that talent there...there were
definitely moments of musical brilliance, however they were oftened
squelched by the

        a) way too short sets

[ok, let this east coaster try to get the lingo right, 'hella short' :) ]

i mean kevin saunderson gets 30 minutes? i'm sure that at most parties he
would get 2 hours.  30 minutes isn't really long enough for any kind of
'journey'.

an idea:  all sets at least 1 hr, staggered every half hour between the two
main rooms.

        b) people always setting up behind the dj

yeah, i guess not much may be done about this, but its really distracting
for both the dancers and i'm sure the djs/performers

SPACE

the size of this piece of real estate really tends to spread the party thin

VIBE

well, i wasn't expecting all that much, though i always walk in
hopeful...it was definitely best in the chill out room.  when talking to
random people got a mixture of good vibes and "like, why the hell are you
talking to me?"

MY FAVORITE THINGS ABOUT BIG TOP

see, i'm not all bah humbug. :)

SYSTEM 7:  their 57 varieties of acid got me dancing
ANDRE LUCERO:  entertaining breakbeak set even got my shy friend to try her
'liquid' moves :) some things he did made me laugh, in a good way!
BEYOND RACE:    to set the vibe for their chilled out set, they had these
two women walk around the room, the first carried this big flaming staff
and the second followed behind with burning sage.

peace,
/scott

basically i was flabbergasted (c'mon, you gotta love that word) that my car
wasn't broken into at bigtop like it was outside of smiles II. i got to
thinking (uh oh)...

since the locks on my car are a total joke, i mean, every time i lock my
keys in there it takes a big 10 seconds with a coat hanger to unlock the
door, maybe it would be better to just leave the doors unlocked in the
hopes that if someone wants to get in, they won't break the window.  (with
an attempt not to leave anything worthwhile in the car implied)

i don't know...i guess it's a sad state of affairs when you're considering
just 'giving in' to the criminals.

what is this world coming to?,
/scott

At 10:30 PM 9/16/97 -0700, you wrote:

>I want you to either spell my name correctly or take responsibility for

>your actions by giving a simple apology for the mistake.  Do you think

>that's possible?

*****

Absolutely.  


I had no intention of mispelling your name (spellchecker didn't catch it by the way), I had an apparent brief period of unobservance which offended someone I did not know or bear any ill will.  I apologize for the misspelling, it *was* a mistake, certainly not meant as a joke (hadn't even occured to me as funny in the slightest).


On another note:

###

not me.  if you don't want me to slam you, then call me by the right name.

I don't expect perfection from you (or anyone), but i don't like being

called the wrong name, and if i catch someone, their ass is gonna hear

about it!  End of story.

###

This sounds to me like some pent up aggression.  Is it really worth getting worked up over *anything*?  Why spend time being uptight...  everything is just going to happen, or it already did.  This could have been a lot less aggravating to you if you had just said... "hey... it's Deepfog, not frog."  I would have apologized immediately, and that would have been the end of it.


Got this from Leslie right before your email:

###

by the way...

 bet someone (maybe Deepfog/Tony) already told you ... but his obtuse

spellcheck reference was really because you called him Deepfrog instead of

Deepfog.  I think!

###


No one had.  Peace man.


oh, hey Deepfog, one of these times I will remember to only send out the one copy so the list, so you don't get two of the same mail. I would of sent this one only to you, but since you posted to the list, I had to apologize openly...  no hard feelings brother.

Hi All!

Since age came up recently, here's something only a few of
us (including me!) may relate to (hi Leslie! hi Larry! ;) ).
(I can imagine lots of blank faces out there, like, so what?).

Hugs,

- Martin

------------------------------------------------------------------


Are you feeling old?  If not, consider this:
     
The people who are starting college this fall across the nation 
were born in 1980.
     
The Iranian hostage crisis occurred before they were conceived.     
     
They have no memory of a time before M-TV.
     
"New Wave" is their PARENTS musical generation.
     
Cyndi Lauper, Boy George, the Pretenders, the Kinks, the Sex Pistols -- 
are all old music they have heard of, if they have heard of it at all.
     
They have no meaningful recollection of the Reagan era.
     
They were prepubescent when the Persian Gulf War was waged.
     
If they have heard the name "Oliver North," it was probably as a losing 
Congressional candidate, or perhaps in some obscure survey history text's 
reference, such as might be made to Huey Long or Teapot Dome.
     
Black Monday 1987 is as significant to them as the Great Depression.
     
Their world has always included AIDS.
     
Having not lived through the Disco Scare, they can romanticize the 1970s.
     
They see "Family Ties" as something middle aged ladies watch.     
     
They watched "Star Wars" years ago, when they were kids -- on video.
     
Atari predates them, as do vinyl albums and cassette audiotapes; they may 
have heard of an 8-track, but probably never actually seen (or heard) one.
     
>From their earliest years, a camera was something you used once and 
threw away.
     
As far as they know, stamps have always cost about 32 cents.
     
The oil crisis is history of which they probably know nothing -- and why 
anyone WOULDN'T buy a Suburban is beyond them.
     
Most of them have probably never seen a real nun, even if they went to 
Catholic schools.

I have some good news for everyone. The first one of these statements below
is actually wrong. The people who are starting college this fall across the
nation were born in 1979, not 1980. It takes some very rudimentary math to
figure this out, so this may be a sign of extreme paranoia on the part of
the author. But at least that means we have another year before we have to
see this again and actually feel old. So let's make it a good one.

Adam

>>>>> "Messiah" == Messiah Wannabe <messiahw@rocketmail.com> writes:

    Messiah> what with cdrom burners getting cheaper by the minute, i
    Messiah> have a feeling that cd's will soon be the medium of
    Messiah> choice for the really underground artists.  pretty soon
    Messiah> consumers will be able to create cool tracks using pc
    Messiah> programs like rebirth, mix them to their hard drive, then
    Messiah> burn copies onto cd's in the comfort of their own homes.

	I think this would be SO cool.

	1) I have a hard time finding stuff that is fast enough
	   for my tastes here in SF
	2) I am not into really funky beat tracks with lots of
	   breaks, etc. and only care for 3 or 4 beat patterns
	   and like them to just go and go and go like like
	   a metronome, or to accent a certain part of the mix
	   or add a "chorus" I like the beat to go even faster,
	   say 1/3rd or so. Like, str8 4/4 beat at 180bpm the
	   whole 7 or 8 minutes, but with occasional 220bpm
	   blitzes inserted
	3) I really like what is considered in the states "cheese"
	   and the Rotterdam style gabber with sped-up female vocal
	   tracks from other dance/pop songs.

	So I think that would be way cool to have enough HD space and
a good sampler to grab each of the parts I want, the default drum
patches for the beat track, and then mix in a harsh acid track where
apropriate over that... Sigh... dreaming.

	Marisa

Hi again!

Hello SFraves 

I was thinking last night that we, or someone on the list should
organize a SFRaves rave. My idea would be for all the DJ's on the list
interested in spinning would submit there name to an organizing
comittee. Because we all know from all the BSP's on the list there are
quite a few promoters on the list. This party would not be exclusive
to SF raves member to go to, it would most likely be a Underground
Party. Since the point of us throwing the party would be strictly for
the fun of the actual event. A list of charities the profits could be
given to. I havent been on the list that long so i dont know if this
has been suggested before, but i know we would be able to create quite
a slamming line-up from SFraves DJ's. Of course this would be a
benefit party so we could most easily get quite a bit of the cost
erased. 

What do you guys think?

love~jeremy

Sunnyvale, conveniently located in a nice neighborhood.

The basics:
Good sized room with ample closet space and shared bathroom.
The house has 2 large common area rooms, plus dining room and modern
kitchen (DW, gas stove/oven, et al.), large back yard and garden,
washer/dryer, and the house itself is fairly large.
You'd be sharing the house with two gay males.
We'd like to have someone responsible, fun, open minded, and easy to
get along with in a shared housing situation.  Obviously ravers are a
+. :-)

Rent: no, it ain't free - it's Silicon Valley! ...  $600/mo
      + deposit, + last, + utilities

Room available on or around Oct. 1, but can be flexible.  We'd rather
take the time to find the right person than rush to get it filled.

For details, please either email me at scooby420@rocketmail.com, or
Scott at Scottw@emu.com, or call Scott at (408) 336-2620 in the
evening before 11:00p.m. or weekends.

************************************************************************
          __   ____________________  ___  _________  _ ___  ____
         / /  /  _/ __/ __/ __/ __ \/ _ \/ ___/ __/ ( ) _ \/_  /
        / /___/ // _// _// _// /_/ / , _/ /__/ _/   |/\_, / / /
       /____/___/_/ /___/_/  \____/_/|_|\___/___/    /___/ /_/

                     SEPTEMBER 19TH & 20TH, 1997
                        (see bottom 4 lineups)

************************************************************************

Alright Rave-kids... here's the scoop on the massive Liforce event that's
going off next weekend (19th & 20th). This is Liquid & M.Mercury from the
SFR mailing list. We've been working with this event since April, from the
flyers, to djs, to lighting... we were there. We're not making money by
sending out this email, but just dont want ANY of you to miss this event!
We know there is a lot of talk about what's going on, where, who, ect...
we'll let you in on the truth behind this party. It's real, it's legit,
everyone on the line-ups are gonna be there, it's going to be like nothing
you've ever experienced.

We (Sherry & Ryan) have been working hand in hand with the head promoter dude
since April. We've given him advice on the lineups, trying to get together
everyone (djs & liveacts) we could think of people always WANT to see, or
only heard about, designed the flyers, and pretty much advised him on what
'most' ravers would want from the the best party they could dream up.

This is FCP's (first contact presents) first party, before they've been all
involved in theatrical productions. We keep telling people, ITS NOT
(necisarily) THE DJS/MUSIC THAT YOU'LL REMEMBER... ITS EVERYTHING ELSE!
They're building these huge movie-like sets and props, lights & lasers sets,
make-up artists from Startrek! for the aliens that'll be there :) and
so much more; we can't wreck the surprise for you, and tell you everything!
It's gonna be so fun, we can't believe it's in less than two weeks.

Another note:
Some people are talking about 2 other things. Corporate sponsorship and price.
Yes this party is being sponsored; they are Southwest, American,
Dollar renta Car, Noahs Bagels, and Starbucks. Yes, they're corporations, but
look at who they are... they're there for a reason; the airlines are flying
people out, the car rental place are for the same people, and the remaining
two are giving out a free breakfast for everyone. Of course all of them will
make money some way or another, but they will be helping elements in making
the party better. Think how different that is from someone like NIKE or MTV
sponsoring a rave.

And price... yes, we all know that raves (some atleast) are getting more
expensive these days. But are the parties getting better? Some are... but
how offen do you feel that your $20 or $25 or $30 is well spent? We dunno,
but sometimes we feel a little let down by just black lights and speakers
for the price. Granted, its not just the setup that makes a party great but
really, what you're going to get for 25-bucks (presale) is going to be some-
thing you will remember forever. Shoot, get the double-night ticket and it's
even cheaper. Each night is going to be different, it'll feel like another
party all together. Anyways, enough hype, enough explaining, enough text,dang..
sorry this is SO long...!

CHECK **********        WWW.FirstContactPresents.COM         *************
or 1-888-664-8879  for updates, the LINEUPS, info on FCP, and more...

So people... come out to this, you wont regret/forget it :)
It's going to be beautiful and we hope to see you all there!

Much love and dancing and smiles!
Sherry & Ryan (Liquid and Mercury)   - liquid hg design


P.S.  They're planning on doing a PRE-PARTY on the Thursday before that will
      be free for the BOTH-night tiket holders, and $5 or $8 for everyone else.
      They'll probably only have one of the smaller rooms open with a few of
      the djs below, but will give you a taste! Our guess is, that if you go
      to ThAT, you'll go to the next 2 nights for sure :)    You WILL SEE!

*ENIGMA* -a world premire video (this is since they are truly an ALL
computer generated musical group, and could not perform live.. but hey!)

Sorry if this is not totally rave related but a good friend of mine had
an unexpected visit from the SFPD last night. About 10 police stormed
his flat (he was  sleeping with his wife and newborn baby). They
confiscated, actually ripped up, his medicine even though he produced a
picture ID from the club. 

Anyway, there is a march and protest tomorrow in SF and we could use a
good turnout. 

1:30 PM Thursday sept. 18th meet at the Club (1400 market?) and march to
850 Bryant.

2:00 Hall of Justice - 850 bryant Demonstration to demand that the SFPD
respect the Compassionate Use Act of 1996 (prop 215) and return this
man's legal plants.

Thanks--

Martin

>

>           __   ____________________  ___  _________  _ ___  ____

> ************************************************************************
> 
> Alright Rave-kids... here's the scoop on the massive Liforce event that's
> going off next weekend (19th & 20th). This is Liquid & M.Mercury from the
> SFR mailing list. We've been working with this event since April, from the
> flyers, to djs, to lighting... we were there. We're not making money by
> sending out this email, but just dont want ANY of you to miss this event!
> We know there is a lot of talk about what's going on, where, who, ect...
> we'll let you in on the truth behind this party. It's real, it's legit,
> everyone on the line-ups are gonna be there, it's going to be like nothing
> you've ever experienced.
> 
> We (Sherry & Ryan) have been working hand in hand with the head promoter dude
> since April. We've given him advice on the lineups, trying to get together
> everyone (djs & liveacts) we could think of people always WANT to see, or
> only heard about, designed the flyers, and pretty much advised him on what
> 'most' ravers would want from the the best party they could dream up.
> 
> This is FCP's (first contact presents) first party, before they've been all
> involved in theatrical productions. We keep telling people, ITS NOT
> (necisarily) THE DJS/MUSIC THAT YOU'LL REMEMBER... ITS EVERYTHING ELSE!
> They're building these huge movie-like sets and props, lights & lasers sets,
> make-up artists from Startrek! for the aliens that'll be there :) and
> so much more; we can't wreck the surprise for you, and tell you everything!
> It's gonna be so fun, we can't believe it's in less than two weeks.
> 
> Another note:
> Some people are talking about 2 other things. Corporate sponsorship and price.
> Yes this party is being sponsored; they are Southwest, American,
> Dollar renta Car, Noahs Bagels, and Starbucks. Yes, they're corporations, but
> look at who they are... they're there for a reason; the airlines are flying
> people out, the car rental place are for the same people, and the remaining
> two are giving out a free breakfast for everyone. Of course all of them will
> make money some way or another, but they will be helping elements in making
> the party better. Think how different that is from someone like NIKE or MTV
> sponsoring a rave.
> 
> And price... yes, we all know that raves (some atleast) are getting more
> expensive these days. But are the parties getting better? Some are... but
> how offen do you feel that your $20 or $25 or $30 is well spent? We dunno,
> but sometimes we feel a little let down by just black lights and speakers
> for the price. Granted, its not just the setup that makes a party great but
> really, what you're going to get for 25-bucks (presale) is going to be some-
> thing you will remember forever. Shoot, get the double-night ticket and it's
> even cheaper. Each night is going to be different, it'll feel like another
> party all together. Anyways, enough hype, enough explaining, enough text,dang..
> sorry this is SO long...!
> 
> CHECK **********        WWW.FirstContactPresents.COM         *************
> or 1-888-664-8879  for updates, the LINEUPS, info on FCP, and more...
> 
> So people... come out to this, you wont regret/forget it :)
> It's going to be beautiful and we hope to see you all there!
> 
> Much love and dancing and smiles!
> Sherry & Ryan (Liquid and Mercury)   - liquid hg design
> 
> P.S.  They're planning on doing a PRE-PARTY on the Thursday before that will
>       be free for the BOTH-night tiket holders, and $5 or $8 for everyone else.
>       They'll probably only have one of the smaller rooms open with a few of
>       the djs below, but will give you a taste! Our guess is, that if you go
>       to ThAT, you'll go to the next 2 nights for sure :)    You WILL SEE!

I want to offer my charming company to you!

I'm one of those people who have only just recently 
discovered the world of raving- I spent the last year 
in Amsterdam- experiencing all that Amsterdam has to offer.
I know a lot about the scene in Europe/UK but I'm completely 
clueless about the SF scene.  Now I find myself NEEDING to 
hear good techno on a regular basis, it's in my blood.

I went to Big Top and did NOT get a good first impression
about the scene here.  $30 entrance, everyone left by 3am 
(probably because they were mostly under 18) and 
NO ONE was dancing!  I have a feeling that not all events 
are like Big Top, I need some info about where to go and it
would be Xtra nice if I had someone to go with.

Please contact me if you are 20 years old or over, you love
house/techno/drum n bass, dislike trance (okay you can like
trance, but I don't like it), you go to clubs/raves to hear 
good music, you don't have a high and mighty attitude because 
you're SO different, you LOVE to dance, you use drugs 
occassionally but don't need them to have a good time, you pay 
some attention to your appearance but don't smear glitter all 
over yourself and wear 8 inch platforms because you need everyone 
to look at you, you are (or used to be) a thinking individual,
and you'd like someone new to go out with.

I'm 21 years old, in my last semester of college, I've lived in
Boston and LA.  I'm one of the cutest little Asian chicks you'll
ever see in your life, I'm one of the nicest people you'll ever
meet in your life, I have a good time no matter what I do (God,
I feel like I'm writing a personal ad, this is sorta embarrassing),
I'm moving to New York soon so if you are too that would be really
nifty.

marisa -

since you've got email, i'm guessing you have access to some sort of
personal computer.  if it's in your own home, so much the better.  if
it's a fairly recent model (either a power pc or a pc w/a pentium
processor) you can get this cool program called rebirth (which by the
way i would love to "borrow" myself if anyone has it - i've only
gotten to mess w/the free download) which is basically an 808 and two
303's in one computer program.  then you can make up your own beats,
or use the phat ones that come with it, or download other peoples (at
least one sfraver is offering his tracks to download, i believe), then
do whatever you want with them, speed 'em up, slow 'em down, turn up
the 303, loop a sample on your soundblaster card, whatever.  you'd
never have to buy another cd again, just plug your pc into your
stereosystem/box and play your own music.  all this is totally do-able
for anyone with a relatively new computer, you only need lots of hard
disk space to actually burn cd's, which you only need if you want to
distribute it...

- messiah wannabe

---Marisa Giancarla <marisa@andromedia.com> wrote:
>
> >>>>> "Messiah" == Messiah Wannabe <messiahw@rocketmail.com> writes:
> 
>     Messiah> what with cdrom burners getting cheaper by the minute, i

>     Messiah> consumers will be able to create cool tracks using pc
>     Messiah> programs like rebirth, mix them to their hard drive,
then

> 	   for my tastes here in SF

> 	   breaks, etc. and only care for 3 or 4 beat patterns
> 	   and like them to just go and go and go like like
> 	   a metronome, or to accent a certain part of the mix
> 	   or add a "chorus" I like the beat to go even faster,
> 	   say 1/3rd or so. Like, str8 4/4 beat at 180bpm the
> 	   whole 7 or 8 minutes, but with occasional 220bpm
> 	   blitzes inserted
> 	3) I really like what is considered in the states "cheese"
> 	   and the Rotterdam style gabber with sped-up female vocal
> 	   tracks from other dance/pop songs.
> 
> 	So I think that would be way cool to have enough HD space and
> a good sampler to grab each of the parts I want, the default drum

> apropriate over that... Sigh... dreaming.

(excerpt from Lifeforce BSP message):
>>Another note:
Some people are talking about 2 other things. Corporate sponsorship and price.
Yes this party is being sponsored; they are Southwest, American,
Dollar renta Car, Noahs Bagels, and Starbucks. Yes, they're corporations, but
look at who they are... they're there for a reason; the airlines are flying
people out, the car rental place are for the same people, and the remaining
two are giving out a free breakfast for everyone. Of course all of them will
make money some way or another, but they will be helping elements in making
the party better. Think how different that is from someone like NIKE or MTV
sponsoring a rave.<<



I have to take issue with this paragraph from your (repeat) promotional 
message.  If it's going to be a big, corporate-sponsored event treat it as such 
and don't try to "justify" the corporate (read:$$) driving this party.  
C'mon... Starbucks?  Yeah, I think it's great they offer employee health bennys 
and all, but I can think of few other firms that are as predatory as this one.  
One of the reasons I live in SF is because there are many small neighborhoods 
filled with "community"-- i.e.,  local independent business-run clothing 
stores, record shops, restaurants, COFFEE SHOPS, etc.  I live here because 
every corner is NOT filled with a Blockbuster, McDonalds, STARBUCKS, 
wherehouse, Gap, etc.  I was very happy the other day when I saw that the Una 
Mas (national fast-food mexican chain) that had invaded the street by my house 
had gone out of business, while Miguel's little greasy taqueria had hung a 
banner saying they had been in business 22 years.  Starbucks is opening an 
average of ONE NEW STORE EVERY DAY; how long will your favorite local 
coffeehouse-- the one where your friends work, the one where you hang out and 
read the paper on Sunday morning,--- last when a new Starbucks opens across the 
street?  IMHO, this is NO different from a rave  would be if sponsored by Nike 
(they're there to clothe the DJ's) or MTV (they're there to play Enigma's 
video).  Sorry, you're splitting hairs here.  A corporate-sponsored rave is a 
corporate-sponsored rave.  

Anyway, the line-up looks fun.  I just hope this is not a taste of things to 
come...give me a repeat of Sunday's People's Park or a full moon or a sunset 
anyday over "American Airlines and Noah's Bagels Presents:  Techno, a Journey 
into The Moment's Hot New Music".  

Ciao, Nathan

Jennifer Yao wrote:

> 
> I went to Big Top and did NOT get a good first impression
> about the scene here.  $30 entrance, everyone left by 3am
> (probably because they were mostly under 18) and
> NO ONE was dancing!  I have a feeling that not all events

I will have to agree with Jennifer about Big Top... it was quite a
dissapointment, and definitely not a good showing for someone's first SF
rave.  Did anyone else who went feel this way?  The whole integration of
live bands and dj's didn't go to well.  In the main room a band would
finish their set, and ten minutes later a DJ would start, while in the
meantime everyone would leave to go to another room, and the whole thing
just didn't flow.  

I myself left at 3am simply because there was nothing else to look
forward to.  

Well that's my opinion of Big Top.  Jennifer, there will be better stuff
to come.  Just keep watching.  Talk to ya later.

hey there peeps,

this is julian from socal raves or better known as juce down here, but will
also respond to:
	jucey
	jucey julian
	jucey jules   or
	jules (which sounds like jewels)

anyways, i'm coming up to the bay area to visit my sister who's at uc
berkeley right now.  i've been raving on and off for about 5 years now.  i
actually started off in the bay area when i attended berkeley.  but i'm
living down here in cloudy, hot, humid southern california now.  

well, i love this scene, love the music, and love the people.  and
hopefully, so will my sister who will be attending her first rave this
weekend, along with several other rave-virgins.
now i've been reading everybody's posts for the past week and a half (sorry
if i didn't wait the normal 2 weeks), sorry to hear how the massives went
off this past weekend. eht down here was about as exciting down here as it
was up there (so i heard, didn't go myself).  big top down here, although
things got way screwy with cancelled stages and cut djs, people, on the
whole, seemed to have had a pretty good time considering how big it was.

on saturday night, i will be taking my sister and some of her friends to
lifeforce.  i know it's a massive and it's corporate sponsored, but they've
got some great acts and djs.  plus, i'll be there to support one of our
boys and fellow socaler, dennis barton of skylab 2000.  hopefully, this
will go off and i'm really excited to see how the promoters visually
entertain us all.  so if any of you sfravers plan on going to this saturday
night, let me know.  i'll be sporting a socal-raves laminate or two.  i
would love to meet some of you kids.

i would really like to go to play nice, as it seems like a lot of you are
planning to head down there, but i can't be at 2 places at once. :(

oh, i don't have any plans yet for friday night.  my sister's probably
going to call it an early night (wants to be nice and rested for saturday
night), so if there's a nice small party going on with thick vibes and hard
thumping beats, let me know.  

hope to meet some of yas,

juce


btw, i told my sister to check out people's park sunday.  i'm not sure how
long she stayed there, but she said she had fun and that "it sounded like
the music you (that being me) play."  which i guess i take as a good thing.

Black Adder wrote:

>I take it that a prescription was issued by a doctor? 
>Why didn't your friend show them the prescription? 

>Martin wrote:
>> 2:00 Hall of Justice - 850 bryant Demonstration to demand that the SFPD
>> respect the Compassionate Use Act of 1996 (prop 215) and return this
>> man's legal plants.

He does have and did produce a doctors prescription, although a
recommendation is all I beleive he needs.

Regardless of the problems of the cannabis club and their relationship
with the police, A man was legally, quietly growing some plants on his
back porch, with a doctors prescription. (No elaborate grow setup).

I, personally, am not going to swallow the SFPD resoning that they have
the authority to disregard and ignore the Compassionate Use Act simply
because they do not agree with the cannabis clubs practices.

It seems to me that people in need growing their own is the best
solution for everyone involved. It eliminates involvement with dealers
in general. (both street corner and the club).

Martin

with people who preach the PLUR gospel instead of just letting it happen,
get anywhere NEAR me with pacifiers and/or stuffed animals in public, or
smear themselves with glitter - thanks, but no thanks, that's so like, 1991

multiple piercings and nasty hair, but oh well - are we regressing or
evolving here, and can you do both at once?), and I live in New York - but

one of the "cutest little Asian chicks you'll ever see in your life"
here...  Hell, even my boyfriend could be one of those...  he's cute as
hell and we wear the same clothes...

BAM BAM BAM BAM BAM BAM" - that probably leaves out most techno for me I

From: Aurora8 <aurora8@earthlink.net>
X-Mailer: Mozilla 2.01 (Win95; U)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: ~N E Body RAVES!~ BSP
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

As most of you know, I am working my ll' arse off to make sure y'all 
get a good dose of fOaM. As of now, due to SF & Oakland being such 
greedy little piggies ($5000 just 4 tha permit : ( there may be a fOaM 
fundraiser ; ) down in SoCal to garner enough capital to host one up 
here. In the meantime, I seem to have had another brilliant idea.
   I was driving to school yesterday and I saw a young man. I have seen 
many others like him. He was hobbling as if he had been so unfortunately 
stricken with Polio, Muscular Dystrophy, Multiple Sclerosis or any one 
of a number of debilitating diseases. I thought to myself, "I have never 
seen anyone like this at a rave... why not?" Of course my brain began to 
work overtime and I'll not bore you with the details, but suffice to say 
that an idea had been born. I want to make sure anyone & EVERYONE feels 
welcome to dance! Somehow, I want to get groups of people that may be in 
wheelchairs, use braces or even may be mentally challenged, together and 
bring them to an environment where they are not judged on the basis of 
how well they dance, but feel like they have all the freedom in the 
world to move however they're able!
Introducing....
                  ~N E Body Raves!~
Thanks for listening!
-TRACY

At 10:40 AM 9/18/97 -0700, Aurora8 wrote:
 
> Somehow, I want to get groups of people that may be in 
>wheelchairs, use braces or even may be mentally challenged, together and 
>bring them to an environment where they are not judged on the basis of 
>how well they dance, but feel like they have all the freedom in the 
>world to move however they're able!

in soCal i know there are several people in wheelchairs who come to
events...they never get a second look or anything so this sounds like a
great idea.

but do people at raves normally get judged on how well they dance?  if they
do that's too bad...

and if you're at a party that's really going off at like 1 a.m. even if you
can walk perfectly well without external aid, you still have no freedom in
the world to move however you're able.  unless shuffling back and forth in
the same 2' x 2' space counts as moving...

good luck putting this together!
-------------------------------
"i scream so much.  you know what i mean.  this electric stream.  and my
tears in league with the wires and energy and my machine."

Subject: Clarification on ~N E Body Raves~

I do not think that people are judged by their dancing skills (other 
than B-Boy circles) at raves... precisely why I think it would be great! 
I mean, these people are probably used to being gawked at everywhere 
they go so they may not even venture into a nightclub for fear of more 
stares. I also want this to be for people that are mentally challenged. 
They unfortunately suffer the most just due to people's ignorance. I 
think everyone there would gain something from it. Hopefully those 
without any disability will see just how lucky they are and those with 
disabilities will realize just how normal they are. Maybe everyone will 
understand just how special we all are.
-TRACY
PS. Sorry for the rampant posts... I'm just SO excited!

Subject: Re: NRR: Med marijuana patients plants confiscated
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

We need to clear something up about this patient.  I am directly involved
with the 215 campaign.  It is very difficult to obtain a "percription" for
medical pot.  If this person had a "perscription" they would receive cannabis
from the federal government,  so much that they would not have to grow any. A
"recommendation" for cannabis is completely different. But, if you have a
recommendation you can obtain cannabis from a buyer's club.  You need a
perscription for cannabis from Holland.  This is the only way to obtain a
"perscription" in the U.S. Ther was a federal program that provided cannabis
to 12 patients. 4 or 5 of them have died( not from pot) and the rest continue
to receive pot.  Right now there are 0 "perscriptions" in the U.S., only the
leftovers of a worthless government study, "recomendations", and all the
homegrown you can harvest.  Peace Love Pot

We did this for the uk-dance mailing list, called it Triology - got a 
venue with 3 rooms and had 700 people jumping like loons to Tech/house, 
Jungle and weird beats in the 3 rooms, organised and DJd by people from 
the list. Best thing I've ever done. It'd go well here. I'm game for 
organising/DJing. We need a co-ordinator and a separate mailing list to get 
with organising it, but it's more than possible - it'd be a crime if we 
didn't.
If you want to see what it was all about in the UK, check:
http://www.kult.demon.co.uk
It was so successful they're doing more stuff all over London (Without 
me, sob, sob!). However, don't even think about doing it for financial 
gain - it ain't easy to make money out there. We lost a load, but it was 
worth paying to see hundreds of sweaty smiley faces jumping up and down 
due to our efforts.
Overnout

C@weasel

>> " Don't even try to imagine one thousand square kilometers of singular
>wide

>> desolation so stark it'll  have you crashing into yourself like that

>> the truth, lies, fear, joy and every other minor ingridient that makes us
>> human, and then digest it to feed the appetite of that which makes us all
>> one.  Don't imagine a place where the wealthy find what money can't buy,
>> where the beautiful pass unnoticed, the powerful are humbled, the wise
>> learn, and the philosopher chuckels to himself.
>>
>> Dont try to imagine expressing yourself in an oasis of stars and night,
>> music in body-wrenching megawatts, lights that blur the borders of
>fantasy
>> and reality, entertainment for all six senses.  Don't imagine a
>dance-floor
>> so huge it could hold the world's entire population.  Don't imagine a
>place
>> that wreaks havoc on the mind set of modern man, a place that will change
>> the way you think, taking you into the future.  Don't imagine your past
>and
>> future uniting in a space so big that time stands still leaving you in a
>> beautiful present that will stay with you forever.
>>
>> Imagine nothing...  "
>>
>> DESERT STORM  1997 - 24 - 27 September   >>>
>http://www.desertstorm.co.za
>>
>>
>> For those of you who cannot make it - I *sincerely* hope to see you on
>> Table Mountain - New Years Eve 1999 -> http:southafrica2000.com
>>

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Date: Thu, 18 Sep 1997 15:42:36 -0700
From: ChaDsTeR <chadster@nwlink.com>
To: nw-raves@hyperreal.org
Subject: [NWR] A little good natured humor, sorry if this is kinda spammy but I wanted to share

Because of all the day to day stress we often find ourselves under, I 
thought this may help each of you out in its own way :)
     
When you are feeling a little stressed, read the below:  

Picture yourself near a stream. Birds are softly chirping in the crisp cool
mountain air.  

Nothing can bother you here. 

No one knows this secret place.
 
You are in total seclusion from that place called "the world." 

The soothing sound of a gentle waterfall fills the air with a cascade of 
serenity.
 
The water is clear and you can easily make out the face of the person
whose head you're holding under the water. 

Look.  It's the person who caused you all this stress. 

What a pleasant surprise.  

You let them up... just for a quick breath... then ploop!  Back under they
go...
 
You allow yourself as many deep breaths as you want. 

There now, feeling better?((((((((((P.L.U.R.)))))))))
((((((((ChaDsTeR))))))))

                               *** HELP ***
                               *** VIDEO ***
                               *** PHOTOS ***


        Liquid (ryan) & I (mercury/sherry) are making a CD-ROM all
        about the rave scene addressing the issues someone from
        out of the area would want to know about the scene here.  Here
        are the topics we've come up with so far.  Please let us know
        what you think, what we can add, and if you have any video &/or
        photos we could use to put on it.  Here's our 'outlin':


        1. PEOPLE
                - ravers
                - promoters
                - djs
        2. ART
                - flyers
                - bombing/graffiti
                - fashion
        3. PARTIES
                - locations
                - photos
                - video
        4. HANGOUTS
                - locations
                        - Haight
                        - Telegraph
        5. HISTORY
        6. FUTURE
                - MTV
                - commercialism


                                              ** let us know what you think **

                                                ;) mercury

Hell yeah!

ALL of the people I know  who are/did use it didn't get anything out of
it.
It is sad to see a rise in its use,

What is worse is people who do it for their first time and try to get
everyone else to do it with them, promising some kind of wonderful
transformation in their life.

I guess only the strong survive, and doing  any type of meth is a test,
because it does not make people any stronger.


Pete

This weekend SF welcomes Richie Hawtin (at onetrakmind) and Tony Humphries
(at Passport), plus lots of performers at the big Lifeforce massive.  There 
are also parties all around northern California -
Mount Shasta, Monterey, Sacramento, Chico...  And also noteworthy is that
the old Kennel Club has reopened as the Justice League and is hosting
a number of shows in the next couple weeks.


                                THE SFR CALENDAR
                                       
    http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi
    
   
     _________________________________________________________________

Radio/TV Shows

     * Sunday night 8pm-10pm - "Soundz of Resistance" w/DJ Poohbear.
       Underground electronic music, mainly jungle/drum and bass, dub and
       hard techno along with guest DJs, interviews and not-so-random
       amples of life. KZSC 88.1 (Santa Cruz)
     * Sunday night 11pm-2am - "The Dreaming/Innermind Show" w/DJ Miracle
       & Mr. Monchichi. House, Jungle, Trip-Hop, Ambient, Dub,
       Break-Beats & guest DJs. KSCU 103.3 (Santa Clara)
     * Sunday night midnight-1am - "Shortwave" - Electronic music in all
       of its guises. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Tuesday night 9pm-mid - "An Epiphany of Sound" hosted by J.C. The
       best in beats to satiate your inner child. Electronic dance,
       noise, spoken word, world music and more. Also available in
       RealAudio. KZSU 90.1 (Stanford)
     * Wednesday night 9pm-11pm - free form music mix. KPFA 94.1
       (Berkeley)
     * Wednesday night/Thursday morning - "the tube" hosted by miss laura
       aka lola. an electronic excursion into ambient soundscapes,
       ethereal trance, and washes of other whimsical muzik. KAZU 90.3
       (Monterey Bay Community Radio)
     * Thursday morning 10am-2pm - "The Further Adventures of Aardvark" -
       trip-hop to experimental to ambient to gabba etc, etc. KSJS 90.5
       (San Jose).
     * Thursday 5pm-9pm - The Beta Lounge - Live netcast of jungle, dub,
       breakbeat, hiphop, ambient, experimental.
       http://www.betalounge.com/
     * Friday 9:30am-noon - Snappy the Aligator plays deep groove music
       that dips into cool electronic sounds, classic soul, reggae &
       more. KALX, 90.7 FM (Berkeley)
     * Friday 3pm-6pm - free form music mix. KUSF 90.3 (SF) (also
       available on Realaudio
     * Fridays 9pm-midnight - Andrew from Groove Merchant spins on KUSF
       90.3 (SF)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - midnight-noon. House/techno mix
       with Johnny K, Ozone & guests - KCSS 91.9 Central Valley (Turlock)
     * Friday night/Saturday morning - "Just Desserts" w/Mr.Goodwrench -
       10pm-2am Jungle, Detroit, Techno, Acid House, whacked-out Dub, and
       noise KFJC 89.7 - Los Altos Hills
     * Friday night - Moondance. Ambient; 3am-7:30am, KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday afternoon - "Bus Stop" - music and talk w/guest DJs from
       SF and beyond. 2pm-3pm. KUSF 90.3 SF.
     * Saturday night 9pm-mid - "Underbrush" w/DJ Radon and guests -
       Beats, Breakz and Buzz KZSU 90.1 (Stanford). Also broadcast via
       RealAudio.
     * Saturday night 11pm - Flux Television, Viacom Channel 53 -
       Ambient, acid jazz and house music videos & interviews. (415)
       281-3377. flux@flux.net
     * (every other) Saturday night 10p-12:30a - "1984" w/DJ Richtoffen.
       House, Trance and German rave. 90.1 (Chico)
     * Saturday night - "amp" 1am. MTV.
     * Saturday night - "Subsonic". 1am-6am, KITS 105.3 SF.
     * Ambiance Magazine - 9:30p weds-sun PNC Cable 2 (Modesto &
       Oakdale), 9p fri & sat, marcus cable ch 9 (ceres & turlock).

Administrative Notes

   If anyone has info on any other events, send it to me! I can't
   possibly hope to get all the info every week.
   
   This info gets sent via email every Thursday. To subscribe or
   unsubscribe to the calendar mailing list, send e-mail to
   majordomo@hyperreal.org with either the line
   
   subscribe sfraves-calendar or
   unsubscribe sfraves-calendar
   
   There is also an sfraves discussion mailing list for issues related to
   clubs, parties, house and techno music, etc. To subscribe, send e-mail
   to majordomo@hyperreal.org with the line
   
   subscribe sfraves
   
   in the body of the message.
   
   
   
   
    Derek Chung - dhchung@hyperreal.org

i hate it when this happens...
------- Forwarded Message

When sex is a dangerous game
Alison Motluk reports
from last week's International Ethological Conference in Vienna
The flatworm Pseudoceros bifurcus is no romantic. When it wants sex, 
it simply rears up and stabs its mate with its penis. Because it is a 
hermaphroditic species, its mate has a penis too, so it may get a jab 
in return. This leads to an unusual foreplay ritual that its 
discoverers in Germany have dubbed "penis fencing".
Nicolaas Michiels and Leslie Newman of the Max Planck Institute for 
Behavioural Physiology in Seewiesen stumbled upon the 6-centimetre 
worm in the sea off Heron Island at the southern end of Australia's 
Great Barrier Reef. For 20 hours they observed 16 pairs of worms, 
which they had housed in ice-cream tubs. At first, the animals did 
nothing.  "They can't smell, so they couldn't find each other," says 
Michiels.
But when the worms happened to meet, they started sexual fencing bouts 
that lasted up to an hour. The two animals would sit up, evert their 
penises and try to inject sperm into each other. Only about one out of 
six strikes leads to successful insemination, says Michiels, who calls 
the behaviour "brutally inefficient". The animals are left severely 
wounded, with prominent punctures.
Michiels says each worm may be trying to inseminate others and avoid 
being stabbed itself so that others have to bear the energetic costs 
of reproducing its genes. "It's hard to know whether the individuals 
are really trying to avoid being hit," comments Janet Leonard of 
Oregon State University in Newport. "It's an interesting hypothesis.
>From New Scientist, 6 September 1997

------- End of Forwarded Message

word paul.
but seriously, hun, the people who have the problems, are NOT going to
take heed to your plea for them to quit.
they're prolly saying "that candyraver kid don't know shit about nothin,
he doesn't understand and he sucks"
see.. there's this thing called denial...
"I use it in moderation". 
moderation?
no...
hmm
let me cut/paste exerpts of a conversation i had with a friend re: his
addiction that it took 4 months to stay a week clean. 

a sidenote before i start the exerpt: i hate the drug, it's destroyed alot
of what i have known to love, and turned my friends into distant memories
who i wish i could see more of but why hang out with them when they're all
twacked out and drama-indulged? (ack it's that DRAMA word again, someone
shoot my ass off)

you people need to realize that crystal meth DOES change your personality.
itcan cause permanent personality disorders, such as acute schizophrenia
or paranoia, or general assholiness. it does HELL to your emotions, fucks
up your perspectives, starts out as recreational and ends up creeping into
your very heart and soul and taking them captive...

 flame me about this, please, i have a million flames in
return...

anyhoo on with the excerpt
*****

 *Merc* im tellin you...i mean i know that im still addicted to crystal
*Merc* i know that if i did some it would be the best fucking feeling in
the world
*Merc* but i was away from it for a long enough time to let my head clear
*Merc* and i wouldnt even put myself in that position again
*Merc* you never stop liking the drug, but you have to get away from it
for long enough to see clearly, that it hurts more in the longterm
Merc:the shortterm stops being so important. when yer hooked on speed the
next rush is all you give a fuck about... and no matter how good you are
feeling in your body, you're fucked
up.  well, i know for myself i wouldnt have been strong enough to just
quit. i had to get away from it
***
(regarding friends who do crystal as well)
***
	Merc: people say "those kind of people arent your friends" but
thats bullshit
 they are your friends and i know that
 but they are fucked up, and you're fucked up
i know how it is, addiction is like a disease  
everyone just feeds off of each other , cuz nothing else matters.
its like a sinking ship. you cant save them, all you can do is jump off
the boat yourself. id much rather sulk in my room and do some cool things
by myself than to be so fucked up for a hit of crack or a bump of crystal
that i hate life that much more. and that's all that shit ever leads to.
hating life more than you would have...
the shortterm becomes too important when yer addicted like that
coz you're never
ever
going to be able to come up with a way to be fucked up all the time
it can't happen
you'll run out of money, or life first..
something's gotta give.. and when yer addicted, anytime that you aren't
using you feel like shit
worse than you would have straight.
****

i could go on but i think well shit...
paul, t would be lovely to think that your small plea would affect
someone, but it takes alot more than a post to a mailing list to help
those who have a problem..

everyone else, if you have ever asked yourself (this is people who do
crystal)( even for a SECOND:L "Do I have a problem?" 
you probably do... or if you keep up the usage.,. you will very soon have
a problem..
most of my friends have been caught in this grip, and it caught me for a
moment but i slipped free and i'm sitting around in solitude wondering
what to do
if it's even worthopening your mouth and speaking your opinion
because so many friendships are lost by confronting people with drug
problems
anyway...
stay true to yourselves, always.
xo

I was in 7-11 the other day and i was dieing for one of those ever so tasty
slurpees. All they had was some mystery flavor that tasted like poo. All of
the other ones were all melted.. Well anyways, it was like 3 o'clock in the
morning and you know how it is really hard to make decision at that time..
Well i'll get on with the story, I was looking around and next to the
poisinous hot dogs I spoted a can of red bull. =) As I was walking over to
look at the back of the can. I noticed right next to it a can that had BIG
letters that read, "XTC". I had to buy that can. I was in line and I took a
big gulp of it and I yelled out, " OH SHIT, IM eN bALLs"..... =) The drink
actually tasted good... I was just thinking that they should run ad campaigns
with some big name Djs endorsing the drink.. It could be like Carl Cox
holding up a can of XTC and saying, "After a long session, I always like to
drink my XTC. It gives me that special boost to help me groove till dawn."

kewl party pictures... Im warning though that these are pictures of massives.
 (I know how all of you peeps always say that massives suck) Sorry y'all =(
no party pix of n e of the small gatherings that ive been to... maybe next
time. peace

Peace Love Unity Respect

Dan-e

Subject: Sorta RR: Raymond Roker Interview - freakin' long

Hey guys,

I've been busy, haven't had a chance to post to the list lately about all the
cool escapades. After going through withdrawls ("WHY HASN'T ANYBODY POSTED
ANYTHING IN THE LAST FIVE MINUTES?!!!!!" Yeah, I need to get a life....) due
to my inability to make anytime to really post anything, here is a whopper of
a post to make up for it all. 
Sorry 'bout the size but for those of you who don't give a rat's ass about
URB, 

Hit DELETE NOW on your email program. (bye, bye). 

(Don't flame me either, I'm just trying to give those w/o web access a chance
to read it. Plus, I really happen to believe it's rave related, considering
the roots, man. It's all about the history! It's also not a BSP considering
I'm not forcing you to our COMMERCIALLY SUPPORTED WEB SITE that I make zero
money on.)

Ah, but for those of you who have read URB and followed the mag (and maybe
these last 7 years of following it really means something to ya), or you just
plain like it, here is the interview that I did with him at ULTRA a coupla
weeks back.
This is supposed to go into Citi:Zen tommorrow, so sfraves get the scoop on
everyone else  (ahhhh, it's just 'cuz I love you all....)

You know what else, tho? If you have any comments about what he says, I'd love
to know them. I have to write an intro and a conclusion, and I don't know
really what to write (straight brain drain...I've been soooo busy I can't see
straight). 
Give me some ideas, plz! It would be cool if some of you had some story about
how something in URB might have affected you or got you into the scene or
something like that.
(oh, and if Chelsea Clinton is now part of this list, ('cuz "you go, rave
girl") and you submit an idea... IT GOES IN!)

still a democrat,

rob.
http://www.citizenmag.com

########################################

C:Z
 I was reading your editorial in the latest issue and saw that you have some
real changes going on within URB.

Raymond Roker
 Yeah, some people have to realize their own growth. Todd (C. Roberts) has
been with us for a long time and he just wanted to realize some other things.
That is how I feel sometimes as well, you know. The magazine is a very
encompassing profession, as you well know, and there is this electronica craze
going on right now. Everybody wants to get what should be coming to them. They
have put a lot of hard work into the scene and Todd was one of them, so he
wants to branch out. Its funny because even though he is leaving us to pursue
other things, he has actually become a greater asset to us cuz hes out there
now representing what we are about, looking out for us, and giving us some
great pieces. So its solid.
Tamara (Palmer) moved up to San Francisco and I talk to her more now than when
she was even in the URB office. I almost talk to her on a daily basis and I
know what we need from her for the magazine, so it is working out well. She
just wants to be at home in San Francisco, keep her own hours. Shes a San
Francisco girl still. 
A lot of people come to L.A. and never quite get acclimated.  It happened to
my cousin as well. He went back to New York eventually.

C:Z
 Are you from L.A.?

Roker
 No. I was born in the Bahamas in Nassau and I grew up in  New Orleans. Ive
lived in L.A. since I was 13.

C:Z
 Its funny because I just got back from New York a few weeks ago and dealt
with a lot of native New Yorkers while I was there. Talking to you earlier
down stairs, I thought you had this east coast flavor in the way that you
talk. Its very to the point. You were like, Yeah, yeah, yeah, keep going,
and I was like, Man, I gotta hurry up and get to the point.

Roker 
 Do I?

C:Z Yeah. I was expecting this whole L.A./California laid back personality,
but it wasnt like that. It probably has to do with running the magazine....

Roker
 Well, I have to deal with a lot of people. Ninety percent of the roads that
you go down, in a social exchange, Ive been down before numerous times. You
just have to cut to the quick. I really deal with things pretty
striaght-forward and I know what things I need to avoid. You kinda just have a
plot already figured out with a lot of your interactions. 

C:Z
 Seven years ago, you were running around with the first issue of URB
distributing it around L.A., Melrose Avenue, and such. I would imagine that
the Raymond Roker of seven years ago is quite different from the one today. Do
you feel, as you are getting older, it is changing your perspective of the
Rave/Hip Hop/Publishing scene?

Roker
 For one thing, as you get older, your eyes open up. Perspective is all about
lifes experiences and how they are accumulated. What you see, or have been
privy to, is what you know. Ive always been one of those people who like to
explore and see new people. I like finding out what is going on at different
levels. The magazine was a doorway for me to do this. When I started URB I
didnt realize that the magazine would be this portal to this expansive,
growing, revolution. The magazine has put me in a position to walk through
this doorway and other minds [that read the magazine] have opened up to the
potential as well.
Even though my perspective on certain truths didnt change, I still believe in
the same connections back when I started the magazine, I got to see how
pervasive some things really are; both good and bad.

C:Z
 The struggle that I face when publishing a magazine is the conflict between
the business needs and the ideal opportunity to say what I really feel. Do you
feel that conflict when publishing URB?

Roker
 Yeah, you mature in that respect. It is a forced maturity. You just have to
be realistic and wiegh what is important to run a business. When you are
younger and first starting out, certain things feel more important than others
because you dont really realize the reality of the situation. Not as much is
at stake. As you go on, though, you learn how to balance the requirement
between the ideals of publishing and the business requirements that take
place. Comprimise is part of life. 
For instance, we drive 55 because 65, 75, 85 is going to get you a ticket or
cause you to get in accident and kill someone else. You can be Fuck the
World and drive 80 mph down the road in a 35 mph zone, but you are probably
going to kill someone.
Its not selling out, it is just being able to weigh the two requirements to
find a successful balance. What is more important to me right now? Is it
writing an editorial that calls my main advertiser a lying piece of shit or
knowing that my main advertiser is a lying piece of shit but allowing them
to give me money so I may subvert their monetary support in other ways, one of
which is to write about truth. 
URB has been subversive. We have done this right under the nose of some of our
advertisers. Actually, if you read some of my older editorials you will read
that I sometimes mention the names of our advertisers and question what they
are doing even though they are advertising in that same issue.
Anyway, it is your business so no one can really keep the score on you. Its
your decision as to what needs to happen. Business, just like in life, comes
down to personal choices. The responsibility business has to truth is just as
high as an individual has to upholding the truth. If individuals are a certain
way then their business will reflect that.

C:Z
 One of the things that I was always impressed with is your dedication to
creating a bridge for the people involved in this culture. You have always
made an attempt to show how rave or techno and hip hop are intertwined.

Roker
 Its because I am an Oreo. Im mixed. It is as simple as that. My reality has
always been because people have always tried to divide my world or divide me. 

C:Z
 What do you mean, Youre mixed?

Roker
 You know, Im black. Im also white. My heritage is mixed. The black side of
my family is Bahamaian, I dont know them to be any more than that. They are
of African descent living in the Bahamas. Sons of slaves, daughters of slaves.
But on the white side of my family, my mother is half Porteguese, Russion Jew,
and German. There is all sorts of stuff goin on up in there.
Im black and white and I grew up in the south. All my life people have always
tried to divide me. I had to go through the pain of dealing with that. It
happens to all people that are of mixed race and culture. The stories are
always the same and as you grow up in this type of world you start to be able
to draw the connections. I mean, regardless of personal experience, people
really doubt the connections that Ive been trying to show in URB. Anyway, I
dont need a world that is divided. Ive been trying to explain the
connections for years but certain people still dont want to see these things
because it doesnt reflect their reality. To them, it doesnt matter what I say.
But thats not the world I want to live in, so if I go to my grave Im going
to project the world [with these connections] and if I can back my stance up
with enough evidence, cool. The world that is not connected with me is a world
I dont want to be associated with. Its not a world I want to be a part of.
Fundamentally, I believe there are real connections beyond my wishful
thinking. I mean, how could you have gotten to Drum n Bass without Hip Hop?
How? Draw the fuckin line for me, yknow? If it wasnt for Bambatta, if it
wasnt for Kool Herc figuring out how to mix records and how to make the DJ
the center of attention, Sasha would be nothing. He descended from these
innovators not from some loser disco dj. The progression goes from Grandmaster
Flash mixing it up with Larry Levan which involves your gay black house with
your black ghetto, disenfranchised Hip Hop. This eventually reaches your white
British kid. You cannot draw a family tree without connecting all of these
things. If this is not done it is disrespectful and it is a waste of culture.
To think that my music just suddenly spontaneously combusted out of the
Heavenly Social because Ed and Tom (of the Chemical Brothers) decided to play
this music is disrespectful to our culture. I am comfortable with knowing that
there were many types of people that contributed to this revolutionary new
music because it makes it colorful, it makes a movement, it makes it something
I want to be a part of.

C:Z
 Seeing all the progress that this scene and music has made, do you feel
vindication that some people are starting to get it? That after seven years of
bangin your head against the wall that some progress is being made?

Roker
 Ive easily got another seven years a head of me. Its cool when you travel
and you meet people from around the country and they talk about things that I
believe in or along the lines of where my head is. That is when I feel, like,
damn, this kid is on it. And who knows if hes even read URB? My mom is a
teacher, so I really feel like teaching is where my head is. Whether it is
through my writing, my graphic design, or whatever it is I can get involved
with, I try to teach something. 

C:Z
 What happened when you took URB national after you had been a free local
magazine for so long throughout California and L.A.? Did you lose anything
along the way?

Roker
 Well, we lost our innocence. We also lost the comfort of just being among
friends. But being only local and always just covering those you are familiar
with can become fairly incestuous. You deal with your same circle of DJs, same
circle of promoters, and you write about the same things every month. 
L.A. was not proving it was the center of world, it wasnt even trying. Other
places in the world were delivering stronger flyers, stronger connections to
Detroit techno, connections to Europe, House, Jungle, peaceful rave movements,
3 day parties. Florida was going off, Wisconson was going off, so why just do
the L.A. thing? 
L.A. has proven that it doesnt really support its own local efforts as well.
I mean look at the L.A. Weekly which has to take sex ads to diet pill ads etc.
just to survive. The Reader went out of business. BAM tried to fill our shoes
when we went national for a second. Now its like a fuckin newsletter. L.A.
Style and Buzz are  duking it out. 
Its not a city built around publications. There is too much transient culture
moving in and out, there arent any newstands, everybody drives, its too
spread out. There were a lot of reasons to go national. The record companies
were concerned about being just locally advertised, clothing companies, and
even the DJs were concerned about reaching other audiences besides L.A. We had
to move for our own good and Ive always wanted to do URB Magazine in the best
possible way. 
Im not going to fuckin dedicate the best years of my life to something and
not push it to its potential. 
That doesnt mean that it needs to be the biggest in the world, but it does
mean that we must make it the best possible magazine it could be. I knew that
part of its growth was dependent on making it national. Not to be egocentric,
but I feel that URB had done a damn good job at representing what was going on
in the scene so why hide us away in California? I really thought that someone
was going to come along with some money and dump it into something national
and it was going to take what should be ours.
So that was it. We did it. And when we did it, everybody was like, Thats it.
Theyre over. Kids really resented us, boycotted us, and we really fell out
peoples good will in the state of California. But, however, there were people
that were finding us for the first time around the country and that was exciting.

C:Z
 I remember when you made that switch. I was really hyped for you. Actually, I
think I saw it coming. You were increasing the quality of the paper stock,
your coverage was getting more national, etc.
 
Roker
 We really, really went into some serious times after going national. Cash
flow was an issue. We had to invest so much into printing, had to wait to get
our money from distributors, it was really tough. It took two years before we
got over that and trying to stay away from going over the brink. It was just
about Spring or Summer of last year when things really started to click. 
People that didnt call before started to call. People wanted us to sponsor
their tours. The cool insiders were checking us again, or at least admitting
to it, and we had passed the hump. I think some people just had to respect us
for our longevity and they eventually realized that we didnt change our
philosophy just because we went national. I dont sweat it to this day.

C:Z
 Did the magazine almost go out of business?

Roker
 Well, we probably almost went out of business a few times during our
existence but we were really, really hurting during this period. There is big
difference between really, really hurting and almost going out of business,
you know. There is always a way out. I mean, even if you had to lay off people
and ask them, Hey guys, you can hang out if you want while I get things
together, and fuck off all your creditors or whatever. You can do it as long
as you have your audience. Look at Apple, you couldnt find a more
revolutionary company, and look at their woes. Companies do that sort of thing
all the time. 
As time goes on, I am having less and less of hard time dealing with the fact
that our company has had hard times. Way bigger companies have had bigger
problems. Its just a fact of doing business.
All those magazines that were dancing around our assumed grave....

C:Z
 It didnt happen.

Roker
 Nope, it didnt happen. Sure enough, though, the scene expanded to command
national attention and we were there along with that expansion. It was a
natural progression and we had to do it.

C:Z
 My only criticism I can think of regarding URB was its lack of an overt
political stance. I carry this criticism about the rave scene in general,
which is: Where can we preach to the non-converted about how we feel? I
always thought that URB was sometimes too much about what was going on rather
than what we, our generation, could do with what was happening.

Roker
 Well, I can think of many more criticisms of URB, but really, part of that
comes down to the resources weve had. URBs political stance has always been
more cultural, more from the heart. It has always been less concerned with the
tangible how-tos. Some of that has to do with me. I like to deal more on the
personal tip. My editorials really may come off as making strong statements,
but Im not on the preachy tip and I believe in more personal actions. 
I think if you read between the lines, though, there is more there than people
give credit for. A lot of people might say, you know, URB is not really
political, but do you really read the articles? Do you really listen to what
the artists are saying?
I used to listen to Black Sabbath. Im still a Black Sabbath head and I had to
listen to people talk about how Ozzy was a satanist. I was like, Do you
really listen to Ozzy? Do you read what his lyrics are about? Does he ever
mention Satan in a loving kind of way? Does he ever mention God or Jesus?
People didnt listen to him talk about peace, caring for the environment, and
worry about blowing ourselves up. You had to read and listen.
I think that a lot of what URB has covered has allowed for a message to be
sifted out. It really cries out for personal responsibility. I think for me,
that is the most important thing. People have to start with themselves. If
they start there and learn how to believe in truth, believe in themselves,
believe in what they are listening to, project that truth out into the scene,
have compassion, recognize struggles of their brothers and sisters, that is
what translates into political action. 

#######################################
