i need to take a trip across the country, seriously - i hate not being able
to see exactly what it is you people are talking about (oh, and by the way,
i was looking at urb a few minutes ago and *gasp* ohmigod you people really
DO still wear gigantic platforms out there)...

this is an awful ramble, but oh well - i am supposed to be at roni size
with my boyfriend (whole reason for the urb magazine read is cuz it got us
a comp + 1 if he'd write the review - I'm now sitting on my ass and
painting my toe nails thanks to the fucking mayor of this city, who's
crackdown on nightlife has gotten my 24 ass turned away from SEVERAL club
doors now since i can't find my drivers' license)...

Anyway, it's just been one bitch session after another with me today, but
regardless:  i came from the south (gawgia, to be exact) - used to drive
all over the south east to party, 44,000 miles on a brand new car in a
year, to be exact...  at any rate, for some reason, the florida kids all
went to smack after a while (the pills got to the point where people would
just walk around and throw up and keep on eating them, and no i'm not
kidding), and it was, oddly enough, the north carolina kids who got freaked
on speed...

now - my thing always was, i'd get some, go dance all night, give half of
it away and not think anything of it, and drive the four hours back to
atlanta alone, singing really loud and butt-dancing and coming home to
crash after being up the entire weekend.  yeah, my head was cracked out,
and i was a mess, but a few days of good eating and sleep turned everything
around.  Perhaps the weirdest thing I saw all weekend were the hardcore nc
speedheads who'd been up for days, going to the next party and the next,
and the next, and then coming home and doing some more.  that always fucked
up my head HARD...

And it got worse when i saw my friend, who was skinny to begin with,
narrowing down to nothing but a skeleton with taut skin and sores...
Seeing this other guy, who was a professional boxer and went to school to
be a, get this, drug counselor, up for fourteen days and sitting by his
window with a shotgun in paranoia - earlier on that weekend he had a party
at his house, and decided he'd take an old guitar amp, do something to it
that made it into a tattoo needle, and actually give himself one of the
best tattoos i've ever seen - still tho, he was missing teeth and had a few
of those nasty sores himself, but it was a pretty bizarre thing to see...

i don't know what happened to any of those people - last i heard, since i
just had to quit going there after a while since everyone got so freaky on
me, was that she quit and moved away, and god only knows what happened to
him...

here's the clincher tho - i still do it sometimes...  apparently it's
reaching mass proportions here again on the east coast (upper east coast
this time, i moved) under the name of "glass" - probably called that
because that's what feels like is going up your nose, i dunno, but it's
more the younger kids - at any rate, i don't see myself feening for it, and
i don't know any dealers personally - so what is it out there - is it all
over the place or what?  Are normal college-educated types doing it and
getting hooked, or is it just the uh, people who get totally caught up in
the scene and don't have a life outside?  what?  from my perspective, which
is a party every few weeks or so and a sunday and monday of hell recovering
(i'm an old lady, remember) it doesn't seem like that big of a deal - and i
haven't seen anyone freaking out on it or getting seriously paranoid since
i moved here...

and i'm clueless, because i'm all the way on the other coast and until
today, i seriously thought someone was joking when he said y'all wear 16
inch platforms and stuff cuz we don't do that here...

and i'm pissed because i'm not at roni size right now and my apartment is
totally clean and the driver's license STILL hasn't shown up, and i don't
get it...

anywayz, i guess i'll see for myself next spring, if i don't fly out there
to check it out first, but it's just weird - i mean, it seems like
ravers/scene people support some drugs and not others, when it just seems
to me like personal choice...  It sounds like you guys lump it in with the
likes of crack or something and that people seem to use it the same way...

at any rate, i can see the damaging effects of any kind of amphetemine,
physically and emotionally, but playing around with my serotonin levels
seems just as dangerous...

>see.. there's this thing called denial...
>"I use it in moderation". 
>moderation?
>no...
>hmm
>let me cut/paste exerpts of a conversation i had with a friend re: his
>addiction that it took 4 months to stay a week clean. 
>
>a sidenote before i start the exerpt: i hate the drug, it's destroyed alot
>of what i have known to love, and turned my friends into distant memories
>who i wish i could see more of but why hang out with them when they're all
>twacked out and drama-indulged? (ack it's that DRAMA word again, someone
>shoot my ass off)
>
>you people need to realize that crystal meth DOES change your personality.
>itcan cause permanent personality disorders, such as acute schizophrenia
>or paranoia, or general assholiness. it does HELL to your emotions, fucks
>up your perspectives, starts out as recreational and ends up creeping into
>your very heart and soul and taking them captive...
>
> flame me about this, please, i have a million flames in
>return...
>
>anyhoo on with the excerpt
>*****
>
> *Merc* im tellin you...i mean i know that im still addicted to crystal
>*Merc* i know that if i did some it would be the best fucking feeling in
>the world
>*Merc* but i was away from it for a long enough time to let my head clear
>*Merc* and i wouldnt even put myself in that position again
>*Merc* you never stop liking the drug, but you have to get away from it
>for long enough to see clearly, that it hurts more in the longterm
>Merc:the shortterm stops being so important. when yer hooked on speed the
>next rush is all you give a fuck about... and no matter how good you are
>feeling in your body, you're fucked
>up.  well, i know for myself i wouldnt have been strong enough to just
>quit. i had to get away from it
>***
>(regarding friends who do crystal as well)
>***
>	Merc: people say "those kind of people arent your friends" but
>thats bullshit
> they are your friends and i know that
> but they are fucked up, and you're fucked up
>i know how it is, addiction is like a disease  
>everyone just feeds off of each other , cuz nothing else matters.
>its like a sinking ship. you cant save them, all you can do is jump off
>the boat yourself. id much rather sulk in my room and do some cool things
>by myself than to be so fucked up for a hit of crack or a bump of crystal
>that i hate life that much more. and that's all that shit ever leads to.
>hating life more than you would have...
>the shortterm becomes too important when yer addicted like that
>coz you're never
>ever
>going to be able to come up with a way to be fucked up all the time
>it can't happen
>you'll run out of money, or life first..
>something's gotta give.. and when yer addicted, anytime that you aren't
>using you feel like shit
>worse than you would have straight.
>****
>
>i could go on but i think well shit...
>paul, t would be lovely to think that your small plea would affect
>someone, but it takes alot more than a post to a mailing list to help
>those who have a problem..
>
>everyone else, if you have ever asked yourself (this is people who do
>crystal)( even for a SECOND:L "Do I have a problem?" 
>you probably do... or if you keep up the usage.,. you will very soon have
>a problem..
>most of my friends have been caught in this grip, and it caught me for a

>what to do
>if it's even worthopening your mouth and speaking your opinion
>because so many friendships are lost by confronting people with drug
>problems
>anyway...
>stay true to yourselves, always.

I am sometimes ashamed to have been blessed with the energy I have.

And sometimes I wish I could just drip my blood into the mouths of the
tweaks.  Just to trip them out.  Just kidding.

It's like, there are people who trust in the meth, and think of it as the
future, like they are more competetive and vital because of it.

And that is what I love about jungle.  And other forms of music.  If you
are RIGHTEOUS, and the music is BUMPING, it's like no other drug.  It's
you and having a power exchange with the primal forces that sit and wait
within our silly modern bodies.

I am sorry that some of you will do speed and never been in a drum circle
at a Grateful Dead show.

But I will say this.  If you take speed, try to save enough money to buy a
drum, and find a circle.  There are nice ones on the Berkeley campus,
especially on Sunday afternoons.  you can't help but hear them.

And get good at playing your own drum.  And don't let other people play it
very often, unless they really really need to.  Or you want them to.

And slip into a heartbeat that sometimes will just make you start crying.
Not out of sadness, or happiness.  Out of the emotions that we cannot
connect with sometimes.  The ones that don't have names.  And play with it
gently.  But also beat the motherfucking shit out of it sometimes.  But
definitely play with it.

And it will play with you.  Bonk bonk!

Oh yeah, and then quit being taken advantage of by speed, right?

And then pray that one day the Man will decriminalize cannabis, so that
people will have access to something other than drink to use to feel a
little less connected to the horrors that life brings sometimes, or more
connected to the wonders we can bring life.

NOW I SOUND LIKE A RAVE FLYER AUTHOR HI HOW ARE YOU


I feel bad for you, if you tweak.  And bad if your life has been messed
with directly or indirectly by a drug so cheap and silly and powerful,
that people start living the sterotype of the anti-drug crusaders.

And commit crime without justification or thought.  Which is of course the
bad kind of crime.

Which of course, connects me back to the point.  It is no crime to bang
drums.  Get to it, ye wee snozzijizz.

DUH,
MAX

yeah, i heard it being called "glass"--although i think that's a variety
rather than a blanket term...i know a couple friends of mine in the SF and
LA scenes who've started using--college students and reasonably
well-adjusted people.  yeah, they use for weekend thrills, but the point is
they use, and more than once. 

and the funny thing is, all the scare stories and warnings of addiction and
comedown and paranoia haven't driven the idea from my mind.

i want to try speed.  for the experience.

isn't it strange?  actually, all this talk about it has brought the idea to
the forefront of my mind...

>stand there with cold faces.  Parties are SO much better when
>we're all participating and contributing.  Don't 'cha think?

I think this is just a part of our culture.  It ha \s and will always be
there.  The groove is in the room, so you should be able to catch it
anywhere you stand.

lara at vibe.org (lara@vibe.org):

>a sidenote before i start the exerpt: i hate the drug, it's destroyed alot
>of what i have known to love, and turned my friends into distant memories
>who i wish i could see more of but why hang out with them when they're all
>twacked out and drama-indulged? (ack it's that DRAMA word again, someone
>shoot my ass off)
>
>you people need to realize that crystal meth DOES change your personality.
>itcan cause permanent personality disorders, such as acute schizophrenia
>or paranoia, or general assholiness. it does HELL to your emotions, fucks
>up your perspectives, starts out as recreational and ends up creeping into
>your very heart and soul and taking them captive...

you can't emphasize this enough...i've experienced the exact same 
things...

<rant><preach>

i've been going to parties here in Colorado for about 5 years now, and it 
wasn't until about 3 years ago that crystal hit Colorado.....*hard*.

Three summers ago I began dating a girl who was a coke dealer (I didn't 
know it until we had been dating a month -- she hid it well, initially -- 
at the time I was foreign to coke and afraid of it and didn't want to be 
involved with someone who was attached to it)....Soon after I reached the 
point of being fairly committed to this girl, she and her circle of 
friends dove full-on into crystal. Within the course of 3 months I 
watched her change into a cracked shell, burned from the inside out. I 
watched her and ehr friends spread the evil antivibe of crystal (IMHO it 
is simply evil incarnate -- not to be dramatic, but, if you've 
experienced anything like I have, you understand) throughout Denver's 
scene, eventually reaching people who, at the beginning of that summer, 
seemed like their happiness, their love, their vibe was too strong be 
consumed by crystal. Crystal just sets fire to your mind, heart, and 
soul. What's left after your two-week long binges is the ashes of what it 
means to be human. 

Physically removing her from the crackhouse she lived in, taking her 50 
miles south to her Dad's house didn't help. I was sort of hoping the 
phoenix would rise from the ashes, that being so far removed from the 
drug and her friends and dealing the shit that she -- and the rest of the 
Denver scene -- would rise above it and return to the way thigns used to 
be. I distanced myself from her completely right here because I couldn't 
take the emotional strain, I couldn't keep feeling responsible for a 
person who was so beyond irresponsible, and couldn't keep feeling 
responsible for the circles of people sho sold and dealt to. I had 
already suffered an emotional breakdown trying to help her and my other 
friends. But within a week her crystal-head friends got her back to 
Denver. Within two weeks her binges were worse than ever. Within a month 
she was dating another dealer and was pregnant.

I don't even want to know what happened to the baby. And I can't even 
begin to picture what this ex-girlfriend's life is like now -- she either 
overcame it and became the beautiful soul she once was, or she's walking 
the streets of Denver talking to herself about walnuts (which, according 
to her after being up for 7 days straight one time, are alien pods 
planted on earth by an intergalactic police who are all out to steal her 
drugs. When the aliens hatch from the walnuts, they become invisible to 
most, but apparently they're always right next to us.) 

Sometimes I try and convince myself that crystal is just another drug. We 
delineate betwen the softy touchy feely puffy cloud "good" drugs and the 
evil bad nasty concrete jungle "hard" drugs, and crystal is just another 
drug. But I've experienced other "hard" drugs -- I've watched coke fly 
through the Denver scene on a silvery-chrome electric wave, I've seen the 
slow-moving deep pale blue shadows of heroin and the sickness of its 
recovery in our scene, I've seen the dark laserlight dimensions Special K 
offers up, but crystal in my mind retains its own blackness, it's an 
antimatter that sucks the goodness out of the earth and its people. 
That's all it is when you look at it on that level.

I don't usually preach because to me usually nothing is worth moshing in 
the pulpit for, but this is, in my mind, the closest thing to an evil 
I've experienced. 

I recently returned to Colorado after a year of living in Fremont, 
working in SF and the valley, and there's so much good and real about 
rave and ecstacy culture in the Bay Area that I've wanted to share with 
Denver -- we have so much to learn from you SF Ravers, you're 1 1/2 steps 
ahead of the world. When I came back from Denver I figured, "ok, Denver 
is probably catching up with the way SF and LA's scene have moved towards 
being more candy/penny-ravers, more politicaly active, more positive, 
more real and accepted." But at my first party back in Denver, I had 8 
young girls -- fresh from shopping at Contempo/Wet Seal, fresh from 
sneaking away from Mom & Dad to steal the car and go party -- ask me for 
crystal. It's a shame SF is seing a resurgance as well.

but we can conquer it. 

</rant></preach>

much love and real hugs.

have a  positive, safe and vibey weekend.

 


                                             andyhawks@usa.net

Wow!

Great turnout for a weekly 21+ jungle party. 

I didn't expect that many people to show, so my expectations were low. Tuns
out, a lot of "the family" showed up.

Y'know, a lot of the familar faces you saw a few years ago at the House
parties. Well now they're shakin' to jungle.

And the vibe was DOWN. Way down. No bullshit here, folks! It's nice to know
a vibe with genuine sincerity still exists out there.

Adnan had free food (the tabouli was AMAZING!), Om Records was giving away
tapes, and lots of smiles!

Hot damn, I think I'll go next week too!  ;)

Don't have the v-mail, but they're at Kate O'Brians every Thursday, 10p-2a.
I think it's $5.

J-

>yuck.  =[



I've always wondered why folks in the throes of the 7-Day Bulging Eyeball
Syndrome start to imagine electronic surveillance devices...implanted in
the radio, the telephone, the clock radio.    I understand the concept that
a paranoid person would imagine that they are in trouble with the law or
the intergalactic space cowboys,  but the repeating  hallucination  that
they are electronically wired is fascinating to me.

Kind of like the DMT/alien thing.  I mean, there are a million different
things one could hallucinate:

  o  picnic tables square dancing
  o  staplers making love in Jello bowls
  o  ski hats sword-fighting  with Broadway theatre tickets.

why does the brain select aliens?

and why do tweakers imagine cia bugs in their light sockets?   i guess it's
their attachment  to electricity and electronic devices that interests me
the most .

it's odd that the collective human unconscious latches onto such images.

or,  is there really something on the other side that the sober mind cannot see?


sober and fascinated,

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Fri Sep 19 11:11:08 1997
Received: (from majordom@localhost)
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id LAA27070;
	Fri, 19 Sep 1997 11:11:08 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from netcommunications.net (root@netcommunications.net [208.147.42.10])
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) with ESMTP id LAA26978
	for <sfraves@qmail.hyperreal.org>; Fri, 19 Sep 1997 11:10:56 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from [38.248.198.82] ([38.248.198.82] (may be forged)) by netcommunications.net (10.1/8.7.3) with ESMTP id LAA05747 for <sfraves@qmail.hyperreal.org>; Fri, 19 Sep 1997 11:09:37 -0700 (PDT)
Message-Id: <l03110701b0484d85b32c@[38.248.198.88]>
In-Reply-To: <3.0.32.19970919001109.007418d4@uclink4.berkeley.edu>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Date: Fri, 19 Sep 1997 10:09:08 -0700
To: sfraves@qmail.hyperreal.org
From: Leslie Ayres <leslie@netcommunications.net>
Subject: Re: CRYSTAL METH
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Interesting thread... especially this...

>
>and the funny thing is, all the scare stories and warnings of addiction and
>comedown and paranoia haven't driven the idea from my mind.
>
>i want to try speed.  for the experience.
>
>isn't it strange?  actually, all this talk about it has brought the idea to
>the forefront of my mind...
>


temptation is hard, isn't it?  so many things seem appealing, especially in
the short-run.  like spending the money we should be saving, like eating
the chocolate cake we'll regret later because it keeps us from losing the
weight we want, like having another martini because it seems like fun and
then we're sick (yeah, yeah, that's me).

and some of these tempting things almost seem to have a life of their own,
waving that temptation in front of us, offering more fun, more time to
party, a chance to be one of the crowd ... their own little marketing
campaign built in.

saying no to these temptations isn't easy...  in fact, it's fucking hard.

and the hardest ones to resist are the ones where there is little gray area.

you might be able to have one bite of chocolate cake, or spend a little
money on a treat and save the rest....

but the reality is there isn't much gray area in highly addictive drugs,
and to me, crystal/crank/coke/et.al. is the absolute worst, because the
first thing it does to your mind is make you think you're completely in
charge *and* make you lie about the effect the drug has on you.

ever notice how people never come up to you at a party and say "hi, i'm on
speed, are you too?"  it's always either not spoken of at all, or mentioned
with embarrassment.  it's a drug of denial in every way.

and extended use will make you crazy, folks.  picture a healthy totally
cool 35-year old marketing executive who starts using crystal and becoming
what she perceived as the queen of the sf nightlife scene.  she was my
roommate.

one christmas day (when the rest of the world was with friends and family
and having good times) i came home to barricaded doors and her delusions
that people were waiting at the front door and there were cops watching our
house from behind a car parked nearby that she was watching out the window.
her downward spiral was painful to watch, and since i didn't use speed, she
didn't think i was as "cool" as she was, so i moved.

and she's not the only friend i've lost that way ... and yes, it is lost,
because to a speed freak, everything is secondary to the drug.  sorry, but
i've learned that there's nothing in it for me to hang around and be
"supportive" because unless someone has committed to freeing themselves
from this drug, there is no support you can offer, because they don't care
about you or anything else.

and for those of you who "occasionally use in moderation" ... maybe you're
one of the lucky ones.  but maybe you're only lucky so far.  is it really
worth that risk?  does your sanity and your health really mean that little
to you?  because remember, the first thing this drug does is make you lie
about it.  to yourself and to your friends.

saying no isn't easy.  i still get offered bumps or lines occasionally,
even though my friends know i'll say no .... but there's always still that
moment of temptation, hmmmm, maybe, since i could dance longer, and it
would feel good.... but i know that there is no "maybe" in this choice.

sorry, but with speed, there's *nothing* good about it.  and i mean
*nothing*.

here's wishing you the strength to love yourself enough to do what's really
right for you,

leslie



From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Fri Sep 19 11:33:31 1997

	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id LAA02597;

From: Layne Loomis <lucke@rocketmail.com>

Layne

On Thu, 18 Sep 1997, Sol wrote:

> But I love sitting in a corner shuffling a deck of cards until my fingers
> are raw.  
> 
> It's such quality time. 
> 
I think you meant, sitting in a corner shuffling cards while the secret
agents lurk just outside and you're wondering with what you think is that
back of your mind but your actually obsessed with the fact that the
fuckin drapes don't close all the way, in fact they leave about an 1/8 of
an inch open and even though you're not doin anything wrong they really
should close all the way and the sun coming in is reminding you that it's
daytime, and that's not a safe time for you to be outside because everyone
can see that you're a victim of the people, the people who run from the
light because the light doesn't feel good anymore and you smile, but only
because you think somebody wants you to smile but you know damn well
you're alone, in fact really, really alone... yet somehow you wish you
could be just a little more alone until you get a chance to sleep for a
day or two and get back in the rut with everybody else, not that you miss
them, but you're tired... oh wait, I don't have to be tired, I can go back
into the bathroom, the secret place where I go when I need to sleep but
decide to divert the need, and you go and you lay out that rail and you
look at it and it's so pretty and perfect and you go to suck it up, but
you smell it from afar and the smell makes you twist with sickness and joy
at the same time, because it's one thing to be on a bender but it's
another thing to be on a bender and not have any so at least you're not
pathetic like them, so you look around for a straw or a dollar bill, but
you throw those away because only a tweaker leaves shit like that around
so you reach into you wallet and find a bill and crank it up and shove it
up your nose and go to town, and it doesn't even hit your nose anymore, it
feels like it sticks to the bottom of the front of your brain, and it's
not about asking yourself what you're doing anymore but rather finding a
way to keep your body from folding in half from the rush and the pain at
the same time and you tell yourself "what an amazing drug" that can keep
you awake and keep you from being human and weak by sleeping defenseless
from the evils of the world should they come... and hurts me at the point
of entry rather than later down the road but little do you realize that
yes, it makes you not human, it tears away at your ability to feel and
maybe someday somebody will take the time to tell you that you're turning
into an asshole, but that's okay because they're an asshole for not
understanding you and not acknowledging that you're still in control but
you really don't care because you're getting the smell of ether down to
the bottom of your lungs, even though they don't feel like lungs and you
know you're not falling asleep anytime soon.

And I ask the musical question, what the fuck are you doing?

Come back to the living, flush it down the toilet, it's not worth anything
anyway. A drug that cheats you of your dreams has nothing to do with a
scene about love, understanding and making the parts fit.  Drink some
water, pick up a book, and get sick of your eyes tweaking on the page
until eventually, you feel the urge to sleep for a long time.  When you
wake up, we are still here, we love you, we always did but you scared us.
Be strong and together, you don't need to be scared and alone and this is
the first step.

The drug sucks.  Some drugs eat seratonin receptors, some drugs eat brain
cells, some drugs just make you eat, but speed sucks away your life, and
the potential for abuse is so high that I have to make a blanket statement
of "quit while you still can", and if you haven't tried it, please don't.
I was very addicted a couple years back and it is now nothing better than
two lost years, and a handful of crazy Hunter S. Thompson-esque stories
that aren't worth anything but scaring people.  Crystal Meth in it's
purest form has a list of temporary and permanent side effects and risks
that goes on for days, as well as the fact that most speed is made by
tweakers who skip steps and leave it smelling of ether, benzene and other
impurities that are outright poisonous to all living creatures.

And for those of you who think tweak, gak, glass, crystal and crank are
any different from each other, open any book, or have your fuckin brain
checked.  Methamphetamine in any form is just outright harmful, and
although you may not believe that you'll live to be 25 like I did once,
you might, and you don't want to hate yourself for causing damage to the
body and brain you will live in for the rest of your life.

Peace,
AndyW

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Fri Sep 19 12:18:50 1997
Received: (from majordom@localhost)
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id MAA17430;

From: Leslie Ayres <leslie@netcommunications.net>
Subject: Re: CRYSTAL METH
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

andy hawkes and andy w, you have written two of the most moving and
well-written posts I have ever seen on SFRaves...

it's clear that personal emotion and experience has made you both speak up
so eloquently...

is everyone listening out there?  do you hear that these posts are coming
from a place of love and concern?  do you see that your actions hurt those
around you who must witness your fall?  do you see how pathetic the
addiction is when you look at it in retrospect?

we can't tell each other what to do.  we can only make our own choices ....
but i know that the choices i make can set an example for others.

when i was offered coke the other day, i was conscious that, even though it
was a tempting diversion, saying yes would have made me a hypocrite.
practicing what i preach (and yep, i do tend to preach  ;^) is too
important if i am to have any credibility ... and the same goes for each
and every one of us.

because even if it's not you that falls into the downward spiral, it will
be one of your friends, someone you love.

do it for yourself ... but if that little voice in your head gets weak and
you can't hear it telling you that you can be strong and resist ... think
of my voice, too, and andy's and andy's and all the people who love you
.... telling you that you *can* be strong enough and you *can* love
yourself enough to win that battle.

wouldn't it be great if we *really* showed the underground dance community
around the world what makes san francisco so special, and we -- each and
every one of us -- make a commitment to resist the darkness and heartbreak
that this drug spreads?  now that would be about love and unity!

love, leslie

From: Leslie Ayres <leslie@netcommunications.net>

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

>I hate those stupid articles, my friend was freaking out on me
>when she found out that I was using it...She was like, don't you
>know it's called GBH for Gross Bodily Harm?  GHB is an anaesthetic
>and taken in moderation, it can really add some zing to your e.
>


problem is, here, "moderation" to one is "overdose" to another.  and
there's little predicting it.

and an overdose on ghb puts you into a coma.  yeah, you'll wake up in a few
hours, but in the meantime, your friends freak out cuz they can't wake you,
if you're at a party, they'll probably need to call 911 and have you taken
to the hospital, and the party may be over because of it.

really fun, isn't it?

i especially love when the overdose victim wakes up bright and bushy-tailed
and says "wow! i was really asleep!" and has NO idea that their friends
have been worried out of their minds for hours, and that they weren't
asleep, they had overdosed.

or they're in a ghb coma and the party's over, but they can't be roused.

hopefully they don't wake up like that in the emergency room (and by the
way, if you're under 18 and taken there, and your parents don't come get
you, then you go into child protective custody.  oh boy that's fun, too)

ghb probably won't actually kill you.  but please, don't do it at parties,
because you may ruin everyone's good time.

leslie

(oh yeah, second problem is that your info on what GHB is is incomplete ...
and to me, if you don't have full information on a substance, you shouldn't
even consider doing it.  period.  the Just Say Know program has begun
creating flyers of information on substances, and their ghb flyer is quite
informative, or check some web sites)

Mime-Version: 1.0

To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Dori <luvnlyfe@freshmilk.com>
Subject: Drugs And Peoples' Perogatives
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


okay, i realize this is very heartfelt for a lot of you, but with all the
back and forth on it all, this is what i get:

1. some drugs are good
2. some drugs are bad

3. this is not objective, this is based on personal experience and deep
heartfelt emotions and personal convictions...

unfortunately, NO ONE is able to dictate whether a large group of people
will all be able to intelligently make the decision to use or not to use...
case in point:  the uselessness of DARE and the "drug war".

nor can you tell someone ahead of time whether or not to make a personal
choice (although as much as we'd like to sometimes - we've all seen friends
fall)

and as much as we'd like to spread the love and the message and keep our
friends from harm, there's not a hundred percent chance that they'll 1)
listen to us, 2) feel the same way, or 3) take your word as their own -
sorry, but I haven't seen Jesus yet, and I still don't believe in him.

and, even worse than all that, even if your friend makes a wrong decision
and fucks him/herself up for it, it's not always the case, no matter how
much you love them or try, that you'll be able to pick them up off the
floor of hell, either - unless they're so goddamn helpless and rockbottom
that they realize they need help and can't do it themselves, but they know
that they sincerely want to put the effort into getting off of whatever it
is.

if someone decides to get help because you've been pestering the hell out
of them with your worry and concern for so long that they want YOUR pain to
stop, it's likely to happen.  And once they get you out of their hair,
they'll go back to their nasty habits...

seen it happen.  (unfortunately, i actually caused it to)...

as much as we'd all like to have a lovely world where bad drugs are gone
(this is a perfect world i'm talking about, so we'd all agree on what we
thought was bad), and good drugs are free (a personal opinion i think would
be nice in a perfect world hehehe), and everyone exemplifies PLUR,
eventually we all look at that southern baptist preacher and realize he's
full of shit, get our ass off the pew and go find out what we think for
ourselves (at least I personally would hope)...

that may sound harsh after some of the really gutwrenching emotional posts
on here, which are obviously based on personal experience, but a few things:

-we gotta have faith in each other to make the right decisions for ourselves
-we gotta realize that part of the reason a lot of us are involved in this
is cuz you can do your own thing and be accepted for it
-we gotta realize that other people's mistakes will eventually hurt us,
unfortunately, in some way or another and that's part of life.  it sucks.
but this is the reality we generally deal with on a day to day basis.

again, i apologize if i sound like a hardass - and again, i can't stress
enough, that you don't have to agree with me either, that's why this is a
FORUM for DISCUSSION.  and like a lot of you, the above ideas rang true for
me because they were based on personal experience.  and because i chose to
make my own decisions.  and because i'm a strong person.

d

your usual portions of house music creativity and fun... Viola... the
souffle is ready...

                ***NEW RELEASES***
*VA-Combine EP                 SR9714 (Organised Noise)  July 7th        12"
Some of the best straight up techno west of Carl Craig, Stacey Pullen, Ian
Pooley, Derrick May, etc. All of whom are dropping it in their sets...


*VA-East Bay Conspiracy EP     SR9713 (Trip'N'Spin)      July 2nd        12"
Featuring the likes of ETI, Jondi & Spesh, Nick Kelly & Cave Dwellers...
A intense contribution to the San Francisco/West Coast House Movement
Deconstruction meets Hardkiss

junglist with his debut appearance on several UK playlists... No U-Turn
meets Penny Black

12"

>>>>> "Leslie" == Leslie Ayres <leslie@netcommunications.net> writes:

    Leslie> problem is, here, "moderation" to one is "overdose" to
    Leslie> another.  and there's little predicting it.

	Very true. Even if you have taken it before, unless this is
from the same batch as the last time. Even then, other things you may
have drank or eaten can affect how the same amount from the same batch
affects you this time. This is true for a lot of drugs, if not all.

    Leslie> and an overdose on ghb puts you into a coma.  yeah, you'll

	"coma" is stretching it a bit. The person is passed out not
quite the same as a coma. And alcohol does that very well, too.

    Leslie> wake up in a few hours, but in the meantime, your friends
    Leslie> freak out cuz they can't wake you, if you're at a party,
    Leslie> they'll probably need to call 911 and have you taken to

	If you are at a party, and your friends know you took GHB, and
you pass out, and they freak, you have some clueless friends. Not that
I am advocating GHB at parties in the slightest. If for no other
reason than if you pass out, you are FORCING your friends to watch
over you, make sure noone robs you, rapes you (I have very strong
feelings that that almost happened to me at an e-bay party last year
when I had foolishly partaken in something that had no business at a
party, which is why I won't ever go to a party held in the e-bay
again. I don't like the crowd or vibe they attract - sorry if anyone
has a problem with that), etc. etc. and just how much of a "friend"
are you to do that to someone? And if you aren't awake before the
party ends then they have to carry you out and take you home till you
wake up, an even bigger imposition.

    Leslie> really fun, isn't it?

	Not as fun as being so into alcohol that you go through a
bottle of 151 every 2 days and one day half come to while you are
strapped down to a stretcher being wheeled down the hallway and
then fade out and come to as someone is shoving a tube down your
throat and you are trying to jump up and tear their throat out
but your tied down and theres this tube in your throat and they
can't hear you cussing at them and you are convulsing so bad you
really couldn't have gotten up anyway and maybe it would just be
better to go back to staring at the water spiraling up into the
drain in the ceiling cause it is so pretty and you wish you were
spinning up there with it and god you're so nice and numb.

    Leslie> ghb probably won't actually kill you.  but please, don't
    Leslie> do it at parties, because you may ruin everyone's good
    Leslie> time.

	I totally agree. There are some things that go great at
parties, and E is definately one of them, IMHO, followed by weed. But
GHB, acid, PCP, ketamine, mushrooms, DXM, those kind of things I jusr
don't think are apropriate or safe to use at parties. It brings things
down for everyone else to have to deal with you, you may wind up raped
or robbed, and, IMHO, they just work better in private or in a small
group of friends at someone's house where there aren't going to be
strangers around and if you pass out someone can just throw a blanket
on you and let you be.

	Marisa

From: Rob Rayle <robertr@autodesk.com>

To: luvnlyfe@freshmilk.com, sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Re: Drugs And Peoples' Perogatives
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

> 1. some drugs are good
> 2. some drugs are bad

	As someone with some experience in this area, I'd like to
weigh in. I don't use drugs at all anymore, but I've used speed &
lots of other things in the past (this is true, not just ass-covering
in case the list is monitored.) Personally, coke was much more of a 
problem for me than speed was. Why? because I liked it a lot more, so
I did a lot more of it.

	I think that the main problem with speed is that it keeps you
from sleeping & eating. Go without fod or sleep for 3 weeks & you'll
look like a speed freak even if you don't touch the stuff.

	Anyway, I'm not arguing that speed isn't bad for you. It is. But
people react differently to different drugs, and some people will be able
to take or leave it.

	What I am arguing with is the flip side - the smug assertion that
speed is bad *but the other drugs are OK*.

	For those of you who are or will become addicted, here's a simple
rule - what drug do you love the most? That one is the one to watch out for.
The drug you like the best, the one you do the most of, is the one that will
get you.

	Rob

have any experience with this drug, i am certainly curious. well, very
curious, and not just on a social level. ready? here goes.....
you have to get A's. not B's. you have to be president, not VP. you have
to belong to not just one, but ten. you have to be the BEST, not good. you
have to SUpERFaST, not quick. you have to be happy, not normal. you have
to here, now. you had to be there, then. you have to be ....etc. 
how can i do this? i kNow! speed/coke/crank, that'll keep me up, that'll
keep me going. with this, i can do it. without, i'll FAIL.
the temptation itself has nearly driven me insane, i couldn't imagine what
the real stuff would do. thankyou, so incredibly much, for saying what you
said and saying it from the heart. you have killed my curiousity....and i
love you for it.

>okay, i realize this is very heartfelt for a lot of you, but with all 
the
>back and forth on it all, this is what i get:
>
>1. some drugs are good
>2. some drugs are bad
>
No, basically all drugs are bad, we just overlook the fact for the ones 
we happen to like.  

>
>if someone decides to get help because you've been pestering the hell 
out
>of them with your worry and concern for so long that they want YOUR 
pain to
>stop, it's likely to happen.  And once they get you out of their hair,
>they'll go back to their nasty habits...
>
>seen it happen.  (unfortunately, i actually caused it to)...
>
I'd rather pester them to stop than just sit back and watch my friends 
waste away to nothing.  
My younger brother looked like he had just stepped out of a picture of a 
holocaust victim, when I finally did something about it.
Pestering isn't enough.  I pestered, he promised.  that worked oh so 
well.  So I destroyed his life (or at least that's what he was screaming 
at me when I told him), I narc'd him out to our parents.
He almost looks human now, and sometimes, the smile isn't fake.
And one day, I'll be able to look him in the eye.

>on here, which are obviously based on personal experience, but a few 
things:
>
>-we gotta have faith in each other to make the right decisions for 
ourselves
>-we gotta realize that part of the reason a lot of us are involved in 
this
>is cuz you can do your own thing and be accepted for it
>-we gotta realize that other people's mistakes will eventually hurt us,
>unfortunately, in some way or another and that's part of life.  it 
sucks.
>but this is the reality we generally deal with on a day to day basis.
I have faith in others, but you also have to live up to their faith in 
you to help them when they need it.  

And it's not just crystal/speed/etc.  You can do the self destruction 
jag with anything.  even, oh my, e.  Especially e.  Cause you feel so 
wonderful and happy, and plurrrry, and you have all these friends, and 
they think its okay, but it's not.

If your life revolves around a drug, there is something wrong.  
When you can't handle the next week unless you get so much partying over 
the weekend, there's something wrong.  

This scene is far from perfect, but just about all of us have had some 
experience dealing with addiction.  Don't we owe it to our friends to 
help them avoid it, or pull them out of it.  At least to try? 

>
>again, i apologize if i sound like a hardass - and again, i can't 
stress
>enough, that you don't have to agree with me either, that's why this is 
a
>FORUM for DISCUSSION.  and like a lot of you, the above ideas rang true 
for
>me because they were based on personal experience.  and because i chose 
to
>make my own decisions.  and because i'm a strong person.
>
>d
>

It's a hard topic, apology accepted and unneeded (but probably best said 
to avoid the noid later).

And the strong survive?  or do they...?

From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>

To: Dori <luvnlyfe@freshmilk.com>

Subject: Re: Drugs And Peoples' Perogatives
In-Reply-To: <v03110724b048530206c2@[207.168.222.15]>

Um, I wasn't trying to be the catch all end all, I just felt I should say
my peice, because I don't trust the DARE program, I don't trust your
friend who is telling you it just keeps you up, I don't trust the parents
who say all drugs are bad (but take your Ritalin, honey), I don't trust
the dealer who says this is clean shit and I don't trust the methhead who
claims as long as you do pure meth you won't get tweaked out.  Maybe
somebody trusts me, because I party, I'm not an old/new skooler, I'm open
with my views and feelings on things, etc.

Sharing my perspective is as at least as valueable as you undermining the
commentaries of others and going on about the perfect world we obviously
aren't in. Suffice to say that perhaps somebody trusts my
opinion, or has seen themselves close to the situation I described.  This
is not a perfect world, very few people die from doing one line, but there
is a pattern to amphetamine use for many people unlike most drugs out
there, and I though I'd share my experience.  It's not harmless in certain
situations and those sitations can arise rather quickly.

There are people ON THIS LIST, in this community, at our parties, people
that some of us care very much about who are already established pattern
users of speed.  It is for them I sent that post.  Search your feelings
and ask yourself if you should say something to these people, or just run
to an anonymous forum and post your rage about the drug nobody admits to
doing.

There are DJs who can't seem to quit the shit on this list as well.  Users
of coke and crystal, full of life, and with heads full of egocentric
ramblings about a world where their needs are paramount, regardless of
their ramifications.  People who are becoming detached from their
feelings, and spend time thinking of how they should seem to feel, rather
than feeling as a prelude to thought and action.  People who live in the
stimulus/response trap that is addiction.  Some of our youngest, most
talented, most popular and inspiring individuals are having trouble
keeping the peices together.  There comes a point when you wake up feeling
groggy, and if you do a rail you feel normal, a little more aware.  This
point is addiction and comes VERY quickly with methaphetamine for a good
portion of the population.

I shared my reason for not doing it.  It is because it has done things to
me, that MAY happen again if I use again.  I could probably talk myself 
into the slight exception and get away with it, that one incident, but
I won't, because that space was so ugly, so lonely I would not risk it by
doing the smallest bump, the thinnest line.

Despite the rush, and the promise of being awake when I lack the strength,
I would rather fall asleep in the sand at a beach party and be laughed at
as Andy aka DJ Narcolepsy (it's happened) than risk going through that
again.  I saw that drug cripple the Dead tour scene in 89, the goth
/industrial scene in 91/92 and I've heard about what it did to this scene
in 93/94, especially in LA... anybody see a pattern here?  Get wise.

I'm not polarizing the issue, any drug can be a 'bad drug'.  I know
stoners who need to get on with their lives, I know people who do E every
weekend, and almost seem miserable when they're not on it.  There are
people in every walk of life who are sick with alcohol addication, an
ingredient in my favorite *Guiness* which I so dearly love, but few are as
sick and damaging as the path cut when speed comes through town.

Peace,
AndyW

every one makes their own choices, but check out my story.  Over the last two
years I have realy tried to be more true to my self.  I have not put anything
up my nose and I have also came very close to not drinking spirits.  It was
the music back in 92 that began bringing me to my current reality check.  I
still hit the buds, but i have come to  peace with my self about this because
there are a lot of positive effects of pot.  So here I am in 97, spinning
records for a couple years, being myself, just being, and all of a sudden
WHAM!!! BIG reality check,  I find out my girfriend for 3 years has just
tried or has been doing speed(crank,meth,DOPE!!!). I lost my shit, I cant
hang with this.  I have spent several years of my life turning my
evil-vandalism-drug-dealing-life around hoping to stay as distant as possible
from shit like this.  And now someone so close to me has lost all my trust.
 She did not come to me and tell me "Hey I got this fucked up urge the other
day to do something stupid," no, I found out from her friends and ceased the
dope out of her purse my-self.  She lied to me and told me she would never
think of doing it.  She should know better, we live with her mom who vaccumes
at 3am and looks 60+ when she just made 50.  I am having so much trouble with
this and I dont know where to turn.  Sometimes I wish I could vanish
completely into the underground( im all ready half-way there).  All i am
lacking now is more family , and i know they are out there.I feel i should be
going to these raves by myself, not bringing my girlfriend or any other
un-adjusted people.  I want to meet more hard-core people that dont go out to
parties for the drugs or even the music( it all kicks ass anyways!) but for
the LOVE!!!! THE FIFTH ELEMENT!!!!!!!!!!  That is my high-wire now.  I love
music, I love all organisms, and most of all I love myself and the creator.
 Self confidence is the key to happiness, and if you are happy you should not
need any of those
hardcore-laboratory-chemical-dirt-non-organic-shit-drugs-interfering with the
most valuable gift, your mind!!!!       PEACE LOVE AND OPEN-MINDEDNESS
            RUEN ONE

From: "e.menon" <emdash@rocketmail.com>
Subject: Re: Drugs And Peoples' Perogatives
To: Dori <luvnlyfe@freshmilk.com>, sfraves@hyperreal.org

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

drugs. good drugs? maybe those that are prescribed to you for a
reason. i'm on several of those, and they've saved my life. but they
are good only for me and other ppl like me. i don't think drugs are
necessarily bad, either. if you're going to use them, do a little
research before hand. what effect does it generally have on ppl? and
keep in mind that we all have a different body chemistry, so the same
drug won't affect me and my friend in the same way. i have my own
opinions of which drugs are 'bad', and this is only because i've seen
them literally destroy ppl close to me. and don't fool yourself, _all_
drugs if used in excess can and will destroy you. maybe i'm fortunate
that i have seen a lot of people totally lose themselves to one drug
or another, and i've had my own share of experiences of losing myself.
and no, when i was 18, i wasn't about to listen to someone tell me
that this or that was dangerous - i had to find out for myself. i'm
rambling on, as usual, but what it all comes down to is that all
drugs, alcohol included, can be deadly. just be aware of what you're
taking, and be aware of your own limitations. and really, try to
experiment with new things in a safe setting, around ppl you would
trust with your life. because that's what it comes down to. you're
playing with your life. especially with illegal drugs. you don't know
what it is exactly that you're putting into your system, do you now?

i just had some disturbing news relayed to me about an old friend.
he's in prison due to his drug use. no, he's not dead. but i'd say
that his addiction has destroyed his life. another old friend i hear
is still alive, and just knowing that much puts my mind at ease. he
never expected to live this long. i've had 2 friends lose their lives
- one was directly related to drugs, and another probably wouldn't
have taken his if he'd had his shit together a bit more. and i won't
go into the relatives i've lost to addiction. 

it's not a game, all happy happy all the time. despite what it may
look like at times. drugs will inhibit your thought process to the
point that you will no longer be the person you thought you were. and
this is a scary thing to go through. you stop caring. period. if this
is what you're looking for, then hey. party on blindly.

be safe - e. :)

................................................................
"To be nobody but yourself - in a world which is doing its best, night
and day,
to make you like everybody else - means to fight the hardest battle
which any
human being can fight, and never stop fighting."   - e.e. cummings

all the
> back and forth on it all, this is what i get:

> 1. some drugs are good
> 2. some drugs are bad
> 
> 3. this is not objective, this is based on personal experience and
deep
> heartfelt emotions and personal convictions...
> 
> unfortunately, NO ONE is able to dictate whether a large group of
people
> will all be able to intelligently make the decision to use or not to
use...
> case in point:  the uselessness of DARE and the "drug war".
> 
> nor can you tell someone ahead of time whether or not to make a
personal
> choice (although as much as we'd like to sometimes - we've all seen
friends
> fall)
> 
> and as much as we'd like to spread the love and the message and keep
our
> friends from harm, there's not a hundred percent chance that they'll
1)
> listen to us, 2) feel the same way, or 3) take your word as their
own -
> sorry, but I haven't seen Jesus yet, and I still don't believe in
him.
> 
> and, even worse than all that, even if your friend makes a wrong
decision
> and fucks him/herself up for it, it's not always the case, no matter
how
> much you love them or try, that you'll be able to pick them up off
the
> floor of hell, either - unless they're so goddamn helpless and
rockbottom
> that they realize they need help and can't do it themselves, but
they know
> that they sincerely want to put the effort into getting off of
whatever it
> is.
> 
> if someone decides to get help because you've been pestering the
hell out
> of them with your worry and concern for so long that they want YOUR
pain to
> stop, it's likely to happen.  And once they get you out of their
hair,
> they'll go back to their nasty habits...
> 
> seen it happen.  (unfortunately, i actually caused it to)...
> 
> as much as we'd all like to have a lovely world where bad drugs are
gone
> (this is a perfect world i'm talking about, so we'd all agree on
what we
> thought was bad), and good drugs are free (a personal opinion i
think would
> be nice in a perfect world hehehe), and everyone exemplifies PLUR,
> eventually we all look at that southern baptist preacher and realize
he's
> full of shit, get our ass off the pew and go find out what we think
for
> ourselves (at least I personally would hope)...
> 
> that may sound harsh after some of the really gutwrenching emotional
posts
> on here, which are obviously based on personal experience, but a few
things:
> 
> -we gotta have faith in each other to make the right decisions for
ourselves
> -we gotta realize that part of the reason a lot of us are involved
in this
> is cuz you can do your own thing and be accepted for it
> -we gotta realize that other people's mistakes will eventually hurt
us,
> unfortunately, in some way or another and that's part of life.  it
sucks.
> but this is the reality we generally deal with on a day to day basis.
> 
> again, i apologize if i sound like a hardass - and again, i can't
stress
> enough, that you don't have to agree with me either, that's why this
is a
> FORUM for DISCUSSION.  and like a lot of you, the above ideas rang
true for
> me because they were based on personal experience.  and because i
chose to
> make my own decisions.  and because i'm a strong person.
> 
> d

People, It's okay to make jokes, but my post wasn't intended as a joke.
I am really serious about this. Imagine yourself in my shoes:
You go away for 2 weeks for vacation and find out that 20 or so of your
friends have become addicted to Crystal. I don't mean using it ever so
often I mean buying $100 or so of it and using it all in a week!
This is scary and it makes me upset. These are people I love and I would
much rather they hadn't started on it.
Love,
Paul*E*Wog

Somone emailed me in private with this message because they did not want
to send this email with their name attached over SFRaves.
Here is a very meaningfull and wise post by an annonymous person:

Love,
Paul*E*Wog

--------------
Paul,

Do you drink coffee? You may have noticed the prices steeply rose
about a year ago and have since been rising. The reason - Columbias'
main resource "Cocaine" is not doing so well. Why buy overpriced snow
when
you can cook up a batch of Crank for a third the Price? Besides the
fact
that it is 10 times more physically addicting than heroin. Which is
great for the dealers because it takes such a small amount for you to
become addicted. This is a fools drug (and I have been the fool before)
college kids take it to stay awake and study, people use it as a
weightloss program, and some ravers use it as a means to stay awake
all night and dance. No matter what reasoning you have, it sucks, I
agree 
with you 100%. I did not post this to the list because 1) most people
don't want to be told that their drug is bad and some people say all
drugs affect people individually 2) I have no room to talk, I have
used it in the past. I can tell you this, the world is too populated,
its going to find a way to kill off a lot of people so it can survive.
This
drug is going to be one of its means along with aids and some other not
so pleasant things. I am glad you choose to be strong, remember this
if your friends don't listen get away from them no matter how much it
hurts
that shit can only bring you one step closer to death........

Yes, Liquid E is the right term for it. Although it is far from it.
Myslef, never having tried it so I am not saying too much, but
all i know is that recently a very large batch of GHB came into a harbor
in SF. Be carefull who's water you drink from at a massive. GHB is a
liquid and people put it in their water. It is used a lot in New York,
known as Liquid E.
Love,
Paul*E*Wog

This is some very real shit....especially the last coup[le of lines. We 
all search for ways to help our friends end their battle with SPEED...but 
sometimes they don't want to. They'll lie, steal, and hurt you through 
the ntire ordeal. There sometimes comes a point when the only thing that 
you can do to help the person is to force them away from you, in an 
attempt to destroy their support network. Without a net to continually 
fall into, people become resourceful again...they have to eat, sleep, and 
exist....and making them achieve these things on their own is sometimes 
the only path towards success. It is in some ways our way of allowing our 
friends to feel the ground as they are hitting rock bottom.

Peace,
ES

>More like liquid duh... mostly harmless.
>
>If you're interested in trying it, take a small dose at first, NOT AT A

>way.
>

I
>have used it myself, and I'm not against the drug, but in certain
>circumstances, it is pretty bad.
>
>Never mix with alcohol, under any conditions, never take more than 3 
times
>the minimum affecting dose for your body weight.  The problem with GHB 
is
>you never feel "high enough", so people keep taking it.  It's not a 
drug
>that makes you feel sick before you OD.

Hey Kids...hopefully i'll be seein all ya'all tomorrow nite in Monterey :o) 

My mommie gave me this...i thought it was kinda neet-o...

ATTITUDE

"The longer i live, the more i realize the impact of attitude on life.
Attitude, to me, is more important than facts. It is more important than the
past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than failures, than
sucesses, than what other people think or say or do. It is more than
appearence, giftedness, or skill. It will make or break a company... a
church... a home. The remarkable thing is we have a choice everyday regarding
the attitude we will embrace for that day. We cannot change our past... we
cannot change the fact that people will act in a certain way. We cannot
change the inevitable. The only thing we can do is play on the one string we
have, and that is our attitude...i am convinced that life is 10% what happens
to e and 90% how i react to it. And so it is with you...we are in charge of
our attitudes."  --Charles Swindoll

OK take care all of you and have a great weekend doing whatever it is exactly
you do...oh and on monday...
HAPPY AUTUMN!!!!
ByE
lovez!
JiL

p.s. did i ever tell you i was a psychic genie?...well i am...i just found
out...what great news for a friday :o)

geezeummmm... =)

GHB is like one of the safest drugs you can possibly take, you just have
to know how to use it! the problem with the drug is that potency is
usually never the same, so you have to expeiment with dosages with every
batch you get. ie. you get a bottle of it, take a small amout (a cap
full) wait a while, if it doesn't do anything, take a tiny bit more, and
keep doing this until you get the effect you want. 

Caution: if your buzzing good, don't take anymore, cause it won't fuck
you up that much more, it'll most likely put you to sleep.

once you've figured out your dosage, you can always take the same amount
for the same buzz, you don't get a tolerance to it, but if you get a
different batch of it, you have to figure out your dosage again.

Please don't experiment at a party though, cause it can cause it to get
shut down!

Please becareful out there.... =)


oh yeah and if you plan on trying GHB go here first and learn about it!
as with any drug, you should learn as much as you can about it before
you try it! 

http://www.lycaeum.org/drugs/synthetics/ghb/


ps. no flames please.... I just put on flame reflectors, if you flame
me, it'll bounce right off and back to you! =) try me... I dare you ;)

love ya guys, jer

Hey hey y'all.

	After being away for a coupla dayz, its suprisin to see so many drug
related posts... good. I'm in agreement that amphetamines can and most
of the time, will be, the devil's drug. There's an article at the
lycaeceum web page 
	  http://www.lycaeceum.org/drugs/synthetics/amps/builtforspeed.html

	that deals with both sides of speed... the ugly nasty fuckin abusive
side and also the side that the drug was originally concocted for...
thought maybe some of you might want to take a look.
	I remember talking to somebody about the scene in another city and how
they have pamphlets circulating around about commonly used drugs...
short and long term effects... they said it helps them out in educating
folks about what the drugs do. Personally, when I was first hearing
about certain drugs, I didn't know what stuff I heard about the effects
of those certain drugs to believe and what not to believe, I felt like I
needed to 'experiment' and my experimneting did get out of hand <to put
it mildly>. I think they have a good thing goin on out there... make
people see what its all about with the written word, so all of us don't
need to run the risk with 'experimenting' to see whether we like it.
	Or has handing out drug effect pamphlets been done before, out here?
Maybe we could do it again... not everybody has a computer to use as a
reference tool.

					 luvs 
					  the McCarthy boi

Can you say vi-vi-vi-vi-b-b-b-b-er-a-tion... Oh what a feeling. :)~

Eric

Subject: a few (more) comments on heroin & drug use
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

At 05:58 AM 9/20/97 -0700, you wrote:
>> Im frightened to really face the truth about how big a problem it is
>> and the scope of the epidemic of anphetamine use & addiction that
>> appears will be comming in this country(please someone tell me I'm
>> wrong!!).  I am familiar with it's power.  Its a 24hr drug for a
>> round- the -clock world.

or a twelve hour party - c'mon, some of older, lethargic types can
obviously see a need for you-know-what if we are expected to make it
through twelve hours of chaos...

personally, i rarely stray that far from home these days so i don't have to
put myself in that position...  i am getting to the point where six hours,
four or five of those spent dancing my ass off, are getting to me...

luckily, when i hang in new york and party, i can do this, and take a taxi
home instead of getting behind the wheel of a car...

>> Herion use is up to.  It seems there is a form of 'snortable' powdered
>> herion.  The kids are using it & saying its ok because they are
>> snorting it instead of shooting it. That really scared me.

yeah, here's the deal - it's the same heroin, just a lot more pure and
that's only due to the ways of the market and the abilities of smugglers
and factories...  and snorted, generally it's a lot weaker of an effect -
again, you can't get addicted to snorting heroin by doing it once...

several months ago i was at a get together with a bunch of south american
kids - figure out parts of that yourself and take a wild guess at what we
were doing...

i went for a line of what i thought was columbian suger, and next thing you
know i felt surprisingly light and fuzzy...  almost like i'd smoked a
joint, but, lighter and fuzzier...

what was "addictive" here was the fact that here i was, just did a "rail"
of heroin, and after the initial freakout when i found out it wasn't what i
thought i was (boy was i pissed, i had always said, "I'm never doing that,
I'd like it too much" after all these orgasmic references - think
trainspotting here)  - I found myself saying, "Wow, that's not bad at all,
not as intense as all this documentation made it out to be, and hell, i
feel DANDY.  I COULD DO THIS ALL THE TIME."

THAT was where the problem was.  It's readily available, and we have a big
conspiratorial media push a lot like what's happening on this list -
supermodels giving interviews in every beauty magazine in the book, new
york magazine doing coverage, etc. etc. - so, lots of curious cats get
interested...

again, what it boils down to is personal choice and maturity...  a few
years ago, and this was documented on hyperreal for a long time, a girl
calling herself China Girl od'd at a large 3-day outdoor gathering called
Interstellar Outback in Kentucky...  she died, and after a guru from st.
louis and half the kids who came with him sat and meditated, she came back
to life, but not after being carted away in an ambulance...  if the letter
that she wrote, which also ended up in urb, i believe, is still around, a
lot of you, especially the younger ones, should take a read.

this girl was no idiot - nor was she a drug addict, or a heroin addict.
she was a user of pharmaceutical grade, clean substances who made a one
mistake...  use any drug at all, and you put yourself at risk for
something... 

hell, step outside your front door and you run the risk of getting run over
by a car or something...  live in fear?  that's not the answer... 

take too much Aleve, you could hurt yourself.  Just because it's legal and
prescribed by a doctor doesn't mean it's not dangerous...  And if you think
our pharmaceutical industry or our medical fields aren't corrupt, ask me
personally, and i'll tell you about a few things.  i spent a while at an ad
agency that marketed these prescription drugs to the medical field, in
order to influence them to push them on their patients.  Because they were
good drugs?  Not necessarily - because Proctor & Gamble, Merck, and other
companies have an agenda, and it's not to make you feel better.  The one
good thing about things that come from pharmaceutical companies is that
they're not cut up with bathtub substances before you get them.

education is the key here, not an "underground" anti-drug movement.  and
the good folks at hyperreal, who've given kids all over the country the
ability to read and discuss this stuff, have provided more than enough
information for us to know what we're doing to ourselves when we feel the
need to expand.

Hahahahahahahh, last night, myself and two girlfriends of mine went to go
BOOGEY.  We were all slow and didn't get to STEP2K until about 1, and then
that was great, but it could only go until 2.  So where could we go?
These women were hyped on REDBULL n GIN, can you feel me?  They wanted to
go beat out and get down.  So we were going to go check the Richie
Superhhawtin thang.  But it was already 2:30 and it was like money and we
knew that that particular spot usually turns into some strange sort of
RAVER OVEN.

And I had three free VIP passes to PRODUCT at the almighty SOUND FACTORY.
I got them way early in the summer when I was at the STARLIGHT room on top
of the Sir Francis Drake above Union Square (which on a Wednesday
coincidentally is great fun, if you want to see a completely different
scene).

So we went to product, me and two other jungle heads who happen to be
ladies.  And I just wanted to thank the Gods of Lurk.  That was the
lurkiest thing I've ever seen ever in my entire life ever.

Except the part that was lurkier than I had ever dreamed anything could
ever be, in terms of unadulterated lurkiness.


Thank you.

DUH,
MAX

i'm not discounting his gesture. a billion dollars over the next
decade, and it will go to help the 'poorest people in the world, the
people who need it the most.' and i suppose it is a fair chunk - the
article i read on it states that it's about a third of his wealth.
leaving him with ... 2 billion. my point is that it's not a big loss
for him. and that he gets front page coverage for his gesture, while
there are a *lot* of ppl who give their more valuable time and aren't
recognised for it at all. i'd be really impressed if he had done it
anonymously. but no, he made an *announcement* to the media and to the
rich. (show and tell anyone?) yes, more ppl with his standing should
do such things. but they should do it because they want to help, and
this they could do anonymously. don't you think? as it is, no, i'm not
impressed. but then i'm not often impressed by the super rich and
their monetary gestures. as i said, and this is really only my
opinion, it's no skin off his back, and it does give him some mighty
nice media coverage. i'm not discounting it; it is a big help. i'm
just not bowled over by it... and not surprised that he's getting
front page coverage for it. disgusted, more like. is his donation more
important thatn all the other news that really should be getting front
page coverage? (but then again, i don't see the news value in chelsea
starting at stanford, either. :P page 11, and very small: news on the
nea; a bill to protect abused children... pg 17: civilians killed by
security forces in india; bomb explodes near bosnia  police station,
injuring 50.... and not to mention all the news that isn't supposedly
'fit to print'.)

cheers - e. :)

Hello Sfraves!!!


	Ok everyone... Mark this in your calendar! Beginning at 10am on
Saturday, Oct. 4th Windowpane and Lightseed Productions are coming
together to bring a very special gathering. It is called the Dragonfly
Festival. The intention of this event is to create a universal,
multi-resonant, multi

media celebration of the arts, community, spirituality and environmental
activism. This event will take place just 1 hour north of San Francisco,
on the Russian River, surrounded by big beautiful redwoods and emerald
green water. It is going to be an awesome occurrence and you should make
sure that you do not miss this!


********************************************************************************************************


Greetings and a most cordial invitation to attend the 1st annual

encouraged to pre-purchase your ticket, to ensure entrance to this
special event.***


Directions to the gate:

Take 101 north through Santa Rosa -> take the River Road Exit and go left
at the stop light (west). Stay on River Road, and about 20 minutes later,
after you've passed Korbel Winery on your right, you will be in the town
of Rio Nido. Follow the event signs for parking. The event takes place on
the beach behind Stump Town Brewery.

bear right.  Follow the directions above from there.

Forwarded message:
From:	leslie@netcommunications.net (Leslie Ayres)
Sender:	sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
To:	sfraves@qmail.hyperreal.org
Date: 97-09-19 14:12:26 EDT

Interesting thread... especially this...

>
>and the funny thing is, all the scare stories and warnings of addiction and
>comedown and paranoia haven't driven the idea from my mind.
>
>i want to try speed.  for the experience.
>
>isn't it strange?  actually, all this talk about it has brought the idea to
>the forefront of my mind...
>


temptation is hard, isn't it?  so many things seem appealing, especially in
the short-run.  like spending the money we should be saving, like eating
the chocolate cake we'll regret later because it keeps us from losing the
weight we want, like having another martini because it seems like fun and
then we're sick (yeah, yeah, that's me).

and some of these tempting things almost seem to have a life of their own,
waving that temptation in front of us, offering more fun, more time to
party, a chance to be one of the crowd ... their own little marketing
campaign built in.

saying no to these temptations isn't easy...  in fact, it's fucking hard.

and the hardest ones to resist are the ones where there is little gray area.

you might be able to have one bite of chocolate cake, or spend a little
money on a treat and save the rest....

but the reality is there isn't much gray area in highly addictive drugs,
and to me, crystal/crank/coke/et.al. is the absolute worst, because the
first thing it does to your mind is make you think you're completely in
charge *and* make you lie about the effect the drug has on you.

ever notice how people never come up to you at a party and say "hi, i'm on
speed, are you too?"  it's always either not spoken of at all, or mentioned
with embarrassment.  it's a drug of denial in every way.

and extended use will make you crazy, folks.  picture a healthy totally
cool 35-year old marketing executive who starts using crystal and becoming
what she perceived as the queen of the sf nightlife scene.  she was my
roommate.

one christmas day (when the rest of the world was with friends and family
and having good times) i came home to barricaded doors and her delusions
that people were waiting at the front door and there were cops watching our
house from behind a car parked nearby that she was watching out the window.
her downward spiral was painful to watch, and since i didn't use speed, she
didn't think i was as "cool" as she was, so i moved.

and she's not the only friend i've lost that way ... and yes, it is lost,
because to a speed freak, everything is secondary to the drug.  sorry, but
i've learned that there's nothing in it for me to hang around and be
"supportive" because unless someone has committed to freeing themselves
from this drug, there is no support you can offer, because they don't care
about you or anything else.

and for those of you who "occasionally use in moderation" ... maybe you're
one of the lucky ones.  but maybe you're only lucky so far.  is it really
worth that risk?  does your sanity and your health really mean that little
to you?  because remember, the first thing this drug does is make you lie
about it.  to yourself and to your friends.

saying no isn't easy.  i still get offered bumps or lines occasionally,
even though my friends know i'll say no .... but there's always still that
moment of temptation, hmmmm, maybe, since i could dance longer, and it
would feel good.... but i know that there is no "maybe" in this choice.

sorry, but with speed, there's *nothing* good about it.  and i mean
*nothing*.

here's wishing you the strength to love yourself enough to do what's really
right for you,

leslie

okay guys, RONI SIZE - Reprazent...

i'm only calling it wimpy because it's not like the normal techstep i've
been shaking my butt to lately, but it's GOOD...

cd #1 is full o'vocals that aren't even cheesy - she kinda sounds like
Eryka Badu (i hope i spelled that right) at times and it gets kinda R&b'y
(they're from Bristol, it's understandable)...  it even breaks out from the
"this is drum & bass" beats to some hip-hoppy and even borderline "breaky"
beats...  The MC is cool although he can be a bit "conrad-y" at times...

cd #2 i wouldn't DARE put near a dance floor - but right now i'm sitting at
home and i have to say you could smoke some serious marijuana while this is
on...

I AM glad my boyfriend was the one who spent $34 on it tho...

dori

NEW FORMS is of course, one of the most important electronic music albums
of the year, and not particularly wimpy, nor r'n'b, nor anything else
besides a truly ground-breaking effort getting awards such as the Murcury
showered on it everywhere.

It is an album for people who appreciate music.  Yes, it has more acoustic
drums and stand-up bass, and a more organic feel than most recent jungle
releases.

Then again, it is not a dancehall album, that is what remixes (see
Grooverider's remix of Share The Fall from this album, an absolutely
STOMPING new anthem from over there) are for.


I would be surprised to see if many jungle headz would call this shit
wimpy though.  It's Roni Size, he's always been a little bit past gun talk
and hardcore tech sounds.

DUH,
MAX

Subject: Re: NRR:GHB article in WEB mag
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Thanks for the un-hysterical GB post. You might want to check out the Just
Say Know webpage (http://www.sirius.com/~hr4u) for further unbiased factual
information on GHB, crystal, ketamine and more to follow. Have you seen the
informational safety fliers out in some of the clubs/parties/stores? It's a
campaign to educate people so they can make their own decisions based on
facts, not hype or stuff people think will sell magazines or get TV ratings.

Also, I agree with Leslie on her earlier points about the destructive nature
of crystal, however I'd just like to add that I think there are many more
occaisional recreational users who never develop a problem than you think -
its just that you never see them or notice them the way you do the lost
souls....
One reason is they feeled compelled to lie or keep their use quiet is not an
effect of the drug, but because they know the reaction they get from their
peers will range from disapproval to rejection to disgust or worse. The worst
case is always assumed and projected onto people even when they don't know
the person personally or outside the party/club environment. 
The Urb magazine article put it best "its not the drug. A drug is an
innanimate object - as dangerous as a head of lettuce until put into a
human's hands. Ultimately the responsibility comes down to the individual".
It is time for each of us to take responsibility for our own actions and not
place blame on the drug. I'm not advocating the use of crystal or any other
substance, and truthfully it seems for a lot people its a ticket straight
down the toilet - but who's to say they wouldn't have bought that ticket
somewhere else if crystal wasn't around?
Learn to love yourself and enjoy all aspects of life without drugs first,
then know and respect the substances you are using.
That's my 2 pennies worth  - check out JUST SAY KNOW

jd

To: mickeymc@pacbell.net

Subject: Drug info fliers Just Say Know (was fuckin speed and drugs in general)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Thank you for bringing this up. Recently a campaign called JUST SAY KNOW
began distributing drug informational/safety fliers to clubs/parties/record
shops etc. The first one in the series is crys, with more to follow. The goal
is to let people know what they might be getting themselves into, then at
least a person can make an informed decision for themself. Because not all
relevant info can fit on a flier there is a related web site on
http://www.sirius.com/~hr4U

People have been using substances for thousands of years -- its illogical to
think or even necessarily want them to stop - education, self-love and harm
reduction is the way. Celebrate life through dance and pass on some Just Say
Know fliers if you find them at a club.......  thanks  jd
